Title: Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Your role

We are seeking a curious and versatile Data Analyst who has strong SQL skills and has worked with Tableau to join our team of seven data professionals. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional analytical and problem solving skills, as well as solid communication skills enabling them to share analytical insights effectively with business stakeholders from marketing, operations and the executive layer. The person in this role will serve as a trusted advisor to the stakeholders and contribute to the overall health and quality of the data platform.


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data analysis tasks
Design and participate in the modelling of KPIs
Advise on and come up with performance indicators and proxies for visualisation of the success of different teams
Work with stakeholders to support them navigate the Data environment, understand and work with the reports relevant to them
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business outcomes
Create, verify and maintain visualisations to effectively communicate insights
Suggest actions, based on the data insights and work with teams to develop their strategies


Your profile


Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Social Science or Statistics, with a solid track record as a Data Analyst and a strong emphasis on data manipulation
Proficiency in SQL, hands-on experience with Google Analytics, GTM, Google Ads, and event data, as well as knowledge of data warehousing (BigQuery) and architecture, is desirable!
Hands-on experience with Tableau; experience with dbt, GetKlar, and TimeSquare is a significant plus!
Understanding of classic e-commerce KPIs and metrics, with the ability to contextualize each data point in relation to others
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and extract actionable insights
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with familiarity in multi-cultural environments


What we offer


An appealing discount on all of our products – from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients
We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year
The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket
A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a flexible work model and 'workation'
Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia
You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas
Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world
We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day


Apply with your CV and cover letter via our application portal. To show us that you've read the entire job ad, please include the phrase 'YES, I AM SUNDAY'S NEW TEAM MEMBER' in the first sentence of your cover letter.

Contact

Sabrina Thome

Apply for this job

About Us

Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy – as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations.

We take our ecological responsibility very seriously: Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable.

We have a diverse team of 190 people and 37 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues.

We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don’t match with 100% of the requirements.

Title: Data Analyst (d/m/w)
Description:
Sind Sie auf der Suche nach neuen und spannenden Herausforderungen? Dann beginnen Sie Ihre Karriere bei uns und werden Sie Teil eines unserer Kundenprojekte.




IHRE AUFGABENSCHWERPUNKTE

Extrahierung und Sammlung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, darunter Logdateien, Datenbanken und Monitoring-Tools
Bereinigung, Transformation und Standardisierung von Daten, um ihre Qualität und Konsistenz sicherzustellen
Automatisierung von Datenerfassungs- und Bereinigungsprozessen
Durchführung von Leistungsanalysen und Erstellung von Prognosemodellen
Entwicklung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Leistungsindikatoren, Sicherheitsmetriken und anderen relevanten Kennzahlen







WAS SIE DAFÜR MITBRINGEN

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Datenwissenschaft, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
Mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise im IT-Bereich
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Datenbankabfragesprachen wie SQL sowie Programmierkenntnisse in Python, R oder ähnlichen Sprachen
Erfahrung mit Tools und Technologien zur Datenvisualisierung, wie z.B. Tableau, Grafana oder Kibana
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Probleme zu lösen
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse







WARUM SIE BEI UNS GENAU RICHTIG SIND

Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm







Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.




Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung.




Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst with a focus on Power BI
Description:
Our Berlin and Munich offices are expanding! Do you want to be our future data colleague?

Data is one of Solita’s four areas of expertise. We have more than 400 data specialists, and our knowledge portfolio contains a variety of data-related specializations involving data solutions in a lot of technologies, both in the cloud and otherwise. In Solita, you will be part of a team that is courageous and passionate, but at the same time easy-going.

As the German market is a cornerstone of our growth strategy in West Europe, we are strengthening our German team with new Data colleagues. You will be working in our Berlin or Munich offices (Hybrid of course) where everything is in place to make your working day meaningful: coffee chats, office dogs, and apéro with colleagues at the end of the day.

Where Your Expertise Is Needed


Rollout Power BI Service as data visualization solution
Setting up, configure and maintain Power BI Service (e.g. Workspaces, Access Control, Data Sources Connectivity)
Building semantic models for reports and dashboards
Building data visualizations
Guiding clients on their digital transformation journey towards cloud native data visualization



What We Are Looking For


Expert in end-to-end Power BI Service ownership (setup, rollout, maintain, utilize)
Expert expertise in SQL, DAX and M
Expert in data modelling (semantic modelling) in Power BI
Native in German and good English knowledge



What We Offer


Challenging, impactful projects to work with
Nordic work culture of trust, responsibility, and maximum freedom
Individual benefit packages that suit your personal needs
Learning and career growth opportunities
A Scandinavian company culture mixed with German culture: read more



We believe the diversity of ideas and backgrounds gives us the creativity to be successful in a rapidly changing world. In support of this, we stress equality of opportunity for all qualified individuals in accordance with applicable laws. Decisions on hiring, promotion, development, compensation, or advancement are based solely on a person’s qualifications, abilities, experience, and performance.

Interested in hearing more?

We want to hear from you and figure out together what works best for us both. Tell us about yourself and your background in your own words.  Unfortunately, currently we cannot offer relocation for candidates outside Europe.

Our recruitment consists of 3 rounds of interviews where you will meet our team and learn more about working at Solita.

If you would like to hear more about working at Solita, please contact our recruiter Pauline Roy-Malikian: pauline.roy-malikian@solita.be
Show more

Title: Data Analyst/Market Researcher
Description:
Job Description

Responsibilities:


Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscapes, and growth opportunities.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights and inform business decisions.
Develop and maintain comprehensive databases and dashboards to track key performance indicators and metrics.
Generate reports, presentations, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategies and initiatives based on research findings.
Stay current on market developments, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and market research.


Requirements:


Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
Proven experience as a data analyst, market researcher, or similar role, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.


What We Offer:


Competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance and retirement savings options.
Flexible work schedule and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the United States.
Professional development opportunities, including training and certifications to support your career growth.
A supportive and collaborative team environment where your contributions are valued and recognized.
Show more

Job Description

Responsibilities:

  • Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscapes, and growth opportunities.
  • Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights and inform business decisions.
  • Develop and maintain comprehensive databases and dashboards to track key performance indicators and metrics.
  • Generate reports, presentations, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategies and initiatives based on research findings.
  • Stay current on market developments, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and market research.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
  • Proven experience as a data analyst, market researcher, or similar role, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI.
  • Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with a commitment to producing high-quality work.
  • Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
  • Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance and retirement savings options.
  • Flexible work schedule and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the United States.
  • Professional development opportunities, including training and certifications to support your career growth.
  • A supportive and collaborative team environment where your contributions are valued and recognized.

Title: Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m)
Description:
Werde Teil unserer Mission, werde Teil von Doctolib!

Doctolib sucht einen erfahrenen Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m), der unsere Sales Teams unterstützt und wertvolle Einblicke aus unseren Verkaufsdaten gewinnt. Als Teil des Sales Excellence Teams optimierst du Effizienz und Leistung unserer Vertriebsteams und trägst damit direkt zum Erfolg des Deutschland-Geschäfts bei.

Deine Aufgaben


Du identifizierst Verbesserungspotentiale auf Basis unserer Datengrundlage und leitest daraus Maßnahmen ab, um die Performance unserer Sales Team zu verbessern
Du baust Analysen für das Management und unterstützt Entscheidungsprozesse mit Hilfe von fundierten Datengrundlagen
Du vereinfachst den Zugang zu relevanten Sales-Daten mit Hilfe von Dashboards und Self-Service Tools
Du trainierst die User (Sales Manager:innen), damit sie die aufbereiteten Daten zur Effizienzsteigerung verschiedener Sales-Prozesse nutzen können
Du bist die zentrale Kontaktperson für unser globales Data Team, um die Data Roadmap und die Anfragen für Dashboards und Ad-hoc Data Requests zu besprechen
Du lernst mit unseren BI / Reporting Tools Periscope Data und Tableau umzugehen - hierzu bieten wir dir eine ausführliche Einarbeitung



Dein Profil

Vorab der kurze Hinweis: Falls Du dem unten beschriebenen Profil nicht exakt entsprichst, aber trotzdem der Meinung bist, dass die Stellenausschreibung zu Deinen Fähigkeiten passt: Bewirb Dich gerne trotzdem!

Um Teil unseres Teams zu werden, bringst du Folgendes mit:


Du bringst min. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Sales Performance / Strategy / Data Analytics oder einem ähnlichen Bereich mit
Du hast eine strukturierte, analytische Arbeitsweise und arbeitest dich gerne tiefgehend in neue Themenbereichen ein
Dir macht es Spaß, komplexe Daten in aussagekräftige Erkenntnisse umzuwandeln sowie neue Lösungen zu entwickeln und das Team für die Umsetzung zu begeistern
Du liebst es mit Excel/G-Sheet zu arbeiten; erste Kenntnisse in SQL, Tableau oder Metabase sind ein Plus
Zudem verfügst du über ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, die du in verhandlungssicherem Deutsch und sehr gutem Englisch zum Ausdruck bringen kannst



Was wir Dir bieten


ein Aktienoptionsprogramm für alle Doctoliber
eine betriebliche Krankenversicherung mit tollen Zusatzleistungen
Vierteljährlicher und ein kompetitives Gehaltspaket
28 Urlaubstage + 1 Tag zusätzlich für jedes volle Beschäftigungs-Kalenderjahr (max. 30 Tage)
Das Doctolib Parent Care Programm, das extra Elternzeit (1 Monat) uvm. enthält
Solidarity Days: 2 Tage pro Jahr, um Wohltätigkeitsorganisationen im Gesundheitswesen zu unterstützen
Mentales Wohlbefinden durch Zugang zu Coaches und Psychologen in Zusammenarbeit mit externen Partnern
Ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, das hybrides- und Büro-basiertes Arbeiten ermöglicht
Flexibility Days: 10 Tage im Jahr aus dem EU-Ausland oder UK arbeiten
Erstattung der ÖPNV-Kosten
Verpflegung Budget und gesunde Snacks im Büro
Ein gefördertes Sportangebot mit unserem Partner Urban Sports Club



Der Interview-Prozess


Erstes Interview mit deinem Talent Partner (30 Min)
Interview mit dem Team Manager (1h)
Finales Interview + Case Study (1h)
Mindestens eine Referenzprüfung



Job Details


Festanstellung / Unbefristeter Vertrag
Vollzeit
Arbeitsort: Berlin
Startdatum: ab sofort
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell



Doctolib ist ein Arbeitgeber, der Chancengleichheit fördert und Vielfalt schätzt. Wir freuen uns über alle Bewerbungen und bearbeiten diese völlig unabhängig von Geschlecht, Religionszugehörigkeit, Hautfarbe, Herkunft, sexueller Orientierung, Alter, Familienstand oder Behindertenstatus.

Alle mit diesem Formular übermittelten Informationen werden von Doctolib zum Zweck der Verwaltung der Bewerbungen verarbeitet. Für weitere Informationen über die Verarbeitung Ihrer Bewerbungsdaten durch Doctolib, klicke bitte hier.

Wenn Du Deine Rechte ausüben möchtest oder Fragen zur Verarbeitung Deiner Daten hast, kannst Du Dich schriftlich an uns wenden unter hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com.

Doctolib ist ein Arbeitgeber, der Chancengleichheit fördert und Vielfalt schätzt. Wir freuen uns über alle Bewerbungen und bearbeiten diese völlig unabhängig von Geschlecht, Religionszugehörigkeit, Hautfarbe, Herkunft, sexueller Orientierung, Alter, Familienstand oder Behindertenstatus.

Wenn Du Deine Rechte ausüben möchtest oder Fragen zur Verarbeitung Deiner Daten hast, kannst Du Dich schriftlich an uns wenden unter hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com.

Title: Data Analyst in Marketing (Relocation to Tallinn)
Description:
As a Data Analyst in a Marketing team, you’ll play a central role in Bolts Global's marketing operations - helping us decide where we focus our time and money.




If you are passionate about data analysis, A/B testing, and impacting the way decisions are made that affect millions of customers and millions of euros in marketing spend - you’ll be at the right place in Bolt!




About the role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Marketing team, you’ll ensure we’re making the best decisions. You’ll work closely with our teams to measure the impact of millions of euros spent on advertising brand campaigns, to identify the marketing communications that have the highest performance, and to recommend to our global and local teams serving the 30+ countries the best ways to spend their time and budgets.




In your job, you’ll be working closely with our marketing and business management teams as well as our industry partners (Google, Meta, TikTok, etc.)




Your daily adventures will include:

Conduct in-depth analysis of marketing investments to recommend the optimal budget allocations between channels, markets, and specific campaigns - following the existing frameworks.
Collaborate with marketing specialists and managers to design and analyze A/B tests for marketing communications initiatives with minimal supervision
Provide data-driven insights and recommendations to the marketing teams and leadership supporting day-to-day operations, business reviews and strategic decision-making
Support the stakeholders with ad-hoc analysis and bring visibility by building dashboards and reports.




About you:

Bachelors/Master’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or Business
At least 2 years of experience dealing with large volumes of data
Outstanding SQL skills and a solid grasp of Python/R for data analysis
Fluent with at least one of the BI tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik, DataStudio, Metabase, etc) and data visualization in general
Good understanding of statistics for A/B testing and experimentation
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations
Fluent in English
Extra bonus, but not required - experience with marketing and consumer analytics, marketing mix modeling, and/or Bayesian statistics




Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!




Why you’ll love it here:

Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.




*Some perks may differ depending on your location.

Show more

Title: Working Student Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
We're looking for a motivated and driven Working Student Data Analyst (m/f/d) to join our Market Data Insights' team in Berlin.The team is part of the Network Planning domain, they discover and collect external data, providing external data services to analytics and data science applications.

Your Tasks – Paint the world green

Role

As part of our team, you'll play a vital role in supporting the Network Planning team throughout the route and network development process. Here's what you'll be doing:


Continuous Network Improvement: Analyze our network to enhance our service quality.
Data Analysis and Processing: Dive into large datasets using scripting languages and write queries in the database.
PowerBI Reporting: Create and maintain essential PowerBI reports.
Stakeholder Management: Foster proactive communication with both internal and external stakeholders, addressing their needs and reaching out to them proactively.
Documentation and Result Processing: Ensure accurate documentation and process work results efficiently.
Data Quality Assurance: Identify data quality issues and actively contribute to discussions on resolving them.


Your Profile – Ready to hop on board


You are currently enrolled in university and have at least one year left
Good understanding of SQL and a keen interest in building ETL pipelines.
Experience with Python is a plus.
Openness to working and learning within an international and agile environment.
Passion for the transportation sector and a genuine interest in network planning.
Familiarity with a Business Intelligence technology, such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, Oracle BI, etc.
Proficiency in MS Office programs, especially Excel.
Strong analytical skills, a proactive mindset, and a goal-driven personality.
Ownership mentality and willingness to support your colleagues.
Fluency in English.


Our Perks – More than just a job


You have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are creating the easiest way to travel. We want your ideas and give you autonomy to make them reality.
Flix is flexible. Organize your own schedule with trust-based hours and up to 60 days of working from (m)anywhere. We are an office-first company, and we encourage all employees to come regularly to their local office.
Travelling is our passion. Discover the world with your free Flix rides and bring along your friends and family for half price.
Teamwork makes the dream work. Our FlixTeam has people from over 80 different nations. We work in a multicultural environment where we can challenge and support each other.
We're not only green in color. We’re building for the long term, and that means protecting our planet. We constantly test new green technologies and compensate for the CO2 after all our business travel since 2018.
Your well-being is important to us. To treat your mind and body we will give you a competitive paid time off package, mental health support including 1:1 consultations with a psychologist, and a neat discount on UrbanSportsClub memberships.


Want to rewrite the history of mobility with us? Then join our ride and apply now. We're excited to hear from you! We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply.

Flix – A place to enjoy work and have an impact

The future of transportation is Green. Here at Flix Tech, the R&D group, we develop software with the brightest minds from around the world to engineer new experiences for our millions of customers across our apps and websites. Every day we solve challenging problems, like how to scale rapidly around the world and how to make an experience that delights our customers. We have a culture of sharing ideas, contributing to open source projects and being an active member in our technical communities.

Flix is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity), national, social or ethnic origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements, competence and merit.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Data Analyst (m/w/d) Festanstellung, Vollzeit


München, Berlin oder deutschlandweit remote Deine Aufgaben Wir verändern eine ganze Branche – verändere sie gemeinsam mit uns! You made my day – mit unserer innovativen und marktumwälzenden Plattform geben wir bereits einer Vielzahl von Menschen weltweit Zugang zu einer neuen, flexiblen und selbstbestimmten Arbeitswelt und bieten unseren Kunden durch unsere Software gleichzeitig einen komplett virtuellen und marktrevolutionierenden Kundenservice. Sichere unser weiteres Wachstum und mach mit uns den Unterschied als Data Analyst (m/w/d) in unserem Headquarter in München , im Hauptstadtoffice in Berlin oder auch deutschlandweit remote . Strategische Datenanalyse: Als Senior Data Analyst identifizierst du Datenprodukte für die Unterstützung unseres Wachstums und für die Optimierung unseres Geschäftsmodells. Du setzt diese Datenprodukte gemeinsam mit dem Data-Team um und hilfst so deinen Stakeholdern bei ihrer operativen und strategischen Arbeit Business Partnership: Du fungierst als enger Partner für verschiedene Teams innerhalb des Unternehmens, indem du deren Bedürfnisse verstehst und datenbasierte Lösungen anbietest, die ihre Ziele unterstützen. Durch deine analytischen Fähigkeiten und deine Fähigkeit, komplexe Analysen verständlich zu vermitteln, trägst du aktiv zur Erreichung unserer Unternehmensziele bei Visualisierung und Berichterstattung: Du entwirfst und entwickelst ansprechende Dashboards und Berichte, die komplexe Daten visuell ansprechend darstellen und unseren Stakeholdern klare Einblicke in relevante Kennzahlen bieten. Durch deine Arbeit unterstützt du Entscheidungsträger dabei, fundierte Entscheidungen zu treffen und Chancen zu erkennen Methodik: Du wendest agile Methoden wie Scrum und Kanban an, um effizient zu arbeiten und sicherzustellen, dass unsere Projekte termingerecht und mit höchster Qualität abgeschlossen werden Dein Profil Erfahrung und Expertise : Du hast bereits erste Erfahrung als Data Analyst oder Scientist und verfügst über herausragende Fähigkeiten in der Analyse und Interpretation komplexer Datensätze Ausbildung : Du hast ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in einem MINT-Fach oder einem ähnlichen Studiengang Analytische Fähigkeiten und Data Visualization : Du verfügst über ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe Probleme zu lösen und datengesteuerte Entscheidungen zu treffen. Du hast außerdem Erfahrung in der Erstellung aussagekräftiger Datenvisualisierungen, die komplexe Informationen einfach, klar und präzise darstellen Kommunikationsstärke und Business Partnership : Du bist in der Lage, komplexe Analysen klar und überzeugend in deutscher und englischer Sprache zu kommunizieren und bist ein starker Teamplayer, der effektiv mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern zusammenarbeiten kann Modern Data Stack und Data Modelling : Du hast bereits mit einem Modern Data Stack gearbeitet und kennst die neuesten Tools und Technologien. Du bist erfahren im Entwerfen effektiver Datenstrukturen für optimale Analysen und Interpretation Eigeninitiative und Methodik : Du bist proaktiv und hast eine Leidenschaft für kontinuierliches Lernen und persönliche Weiterentwicklung. Du wendest agile Methoden wie Scrum und Kanban an, um effizient zu arbeiten und sicherzustellen, dass unsere Projekte termingerecht und mit höchster Qualität abgeschlossen werden Warum wir? Chance : Du hast von Tag eins die Chance, eines der am stärksten und profitabel wachsenden Startups mitzugestalten und deinen Footprint zu hinterlassen Innovation : Du arbeitest in einem spannenden Umfeld, das einen etablierten und trägen Markt auf den Kopf stellt – und wir stellen dir dafür ein leistungsorientiertes sowie motiviertes Team und moderne Technologien zur Seite Team : Du arbeitest eng mit einem erfahrenen Data & Analytics Team und starkem Management aus Experten zusammen, das von offener Diskussion und gegenseitigem Lernen geprägt ist und hast die Möglichkeit dein Wissen zur Weiterentwicklung einer innovativen Plattform aktiv miteinzubringen Footprint : Du arbeitest mit uns an den drei globalen Trends Future of Work, Sustainability und Sharing Economy - so verändern wir gemeinsam die Welt zu einer besseren Werte : Wir sehen uns als eingeschworene Grown-Up Familie, die ihre Werte Mut, Authentizität und Nachhaltigkeit lebt. Zeig auch du uns, wie mutig du dich der Herausforderung stellst, um mit uns nachhaltige Erfolge zu feiern! Über uns Wir sind ein Game Changer - innovativ, zeitgemäß und anders. Ein Unternehmen, bei dem es Spaß macht, Kunde, Talent und vor allem Mitarbeiter zu sein. Falls du Lust auf ein herausragendes Business-Modell und eine nachhaltige Unternehmenskultur hast und Teil eines motivierten, leistungsstarken Teams werden willst, dann bist du bei yoummday genau richtig! Denn mit unserer Technologie revolutionieren wir die Arbeitswelt: Selbstbestimmtes Arbeiten unter fairen Bedingungen! Kunden können mit unserer Plattform ihre Customer Experience komplett virtuell aufsetzen und steuern. Gleichzeitig bietet unser Marktplatz Zugang zu weltweit arbeitenden Talenten. Preis, Qualität und Flexibilität sind bei uns keine Trade-Off-Entscheidungen – wir liefern exzellente Leistungen in allen Dimensionen. Du hast Lust auf Innovation und Revolution? Werde Daymaker! Jetzt bewerben Referenznummer YF-13277 (in der Bewerbung bitte angeben)
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
YOUR FUTURE, ON DEMAND

The ideal blend of stability and flexibility. A genuinely human employer that cares for people and the planet. True autonomy to shape what comes next, for us and you. This is the perfect platform to take your career where you want.

Back in 2005, we pioneered Europe's first TV streaming service. Today, we're the world's first certified climate neutral TV streaming provider. 3 million users across three countries. Over 230 colleagues of 47 nationalities. We're the grown-up start-up, helping to shape a better future since day one. That hasn't changed, even if the world has. We're friendly, international, inclusive – and our people say we're reliable and transparent, too. It's why they trust us and believe in what we do.

THE ROLE

Data is a core advantage of OTT/Unicast TV over traditional broadcast. As platform operators, we know exactly what content our users watch, how popular a show is, and how many seconds of each and every ad campaign is viewed. With roughly 3 million active users every month the data we collect from them allows for efficient and precise business processes and data-based decision making.

We want to build day-to-day business decisions more on hard facts and less on gut feeling. Therefore we are searching for a passionate Data Analyst to join our motivated and growing data team. You will be shaping the big data architecture at Zattoo and building data components that change the way data is leveraged at Zattoo!

THE DATA AND ANALYTICS TEAM

We are a diverse set of people ranging from Data Engineers (DEs) to Data Analysts and Machine Learning Engineers. We love bringing more value out of our data for the organization and truly drive data based decision making in all divisions. We are a bit nerdy and understand the heart of our business operations and our stakeholders to do our job well.

Zattoo operates in both the DtC and B2B space and combined with a TV streaming product, it is a dream company for a data professional to get maximum value out of data and learn new things everyday! We are building a scalable architecture with the newest tools, technologies and methodologies to leverage our big data (we process 6TB daily!)

WHAT YOU'LL DO


Collaborate with our Product Owners (POs) to understand their needs to generate insights from data
Identify and improve KPIs that are most relevant for driving product decisions and understanding what users do in our applications
Design dashboards that are tuned for decision making and insights. You will also be responsible for the design of external facing dashboards and analytics for our B2B clients
Conduct trainings for POs to understand our data and dashboards
Own and improve our product data models and documentation
Design A/B tests and interpret the results for product decisions
Collaborate closely with our Data Engineers (DEs) and other teams to ensure data quality and consistency


WHAT YOU'LL BRING


Master's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or Statistics
4+ years of experience as a Data/Product Analyst in a digital or tech company, analyzing large amounts of data
Obsession to understand end users and what they do in our products with data
Data Visualization: strong proficiency in designing intuitive, impactful and insightful data visualizations that effectively communicate key product metrics and user behavior patterns is essential
Experience with visualization and product analytics tools (we use Tableau, Apache Superset and mParticle (former Indicative)) and the ability to create custom visualizations when standard charts don't suffice
Statistics: background in designing and analyzing A/B tests for product features and user experience improvements
Strong SQL skills
Data Storytelling and Communication: strong communication and collaboration skills with data stakeholders and DEs
Ability to craft compelling narratives from complex data insights
Skill in presenting analytical findings into actionable recommendations for product and business strategies, from technical teams to C-level executives
Data Literacy: as a key member of the data team, you will also serve as a data literacy champion within the organization and:
Collaborate with the data team and POs to foster a data-driven culture
Advocate for data-informed decision making at all levels of the organization
Stay informed about the latest trends and best practices in data analytics and share knowledge with the wider team
Data Quality and Governance: ensure data quality, good data governance practices, and maintaining data dictionaries
Continuous Learning: demonstrate a passion for staying updated with the latest trends, tools, and techniques in data analytics and the streaming industry

Bonus:


Familiarity with A/B testing platforms like Optimizely or Google Optimize
Python skills


WHY JOIN US?

At Zattoo, you're always on firm ground with real freedom to explore. You'll have the support and opportunity you need to go far, while you're helping us create a sustainable and entertainment-filled future for all.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU


Reward: strong market competitive salary
Recharge: 30 days vacation plus public holidays
Regulate: trust-based flexible working hours and the option for remote work worldwide for up to 8 weeks per year


Plus:


We're sharing: Free access to the best streaming experience on the market
We're developing: Your own development budget, German classes and Zattoo all-company hack days
We're inclusive: 'Zattooies' are a fun, engaged, and diverse team made up of 47 nationalities
We're healthy: Health checks, team sports, organic fruit, vegan options and more!
We're responsible: We are carbon neutral, an active employee Green team, discounted BVG tickets and free bike rentals
We're sociable: A calendar of events with fireside chats, lunches, in-house bar, BBQ's, monthly socials, summer party and an annual off-site event


Zattoo enables our users to view indiscriminately and we reflect that in our team too. Regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law we encourage everyone to apply and will give everyone equal consideration. We are an equal opportunities employer, join us and help build a diverse team dedicated to the future of TV.

You can learn more about us at: https://zattoo.com

HTML:
YOUR FUTURE, ON DEMAND

The ideal blend of stability and flexibility. A genuinely human employer that cares for people and the planet. True autonomy to shape what comes next, for us and you. This is the perfect platform to take your career where you want.

Back in 2005, we pioneered Europe's first TV streaming service. Today, we're the world's first certified climate neutral TV streaming provider. 3 million users across three countries. Over 230 colleagues of 47 nationalities. We're the grown-up start-up, helping to shape a better future since day one. That hasn't changed, even if the world has. We're friendly, international, inclusive – and our people say we're reliable and transparent, too. It's why they trust us and believe in what we do.

THE ROLE

Data is a core advantage of OTT/Unicast TV over traditional broadcast. As platform operators, we know exactly what content our users watch, how popular a show is, and how many seconds of each and every ad campaign is viewed. With roughly 3 million active users every month the data we collect from them allows for efficient and precise business processes and data-based decision making.

We want to build day-to-day business decisions more on hard facts and less on gut feeling. Therefore we are searching for a passionate Data Analyst to join our motivated and growing data team. You will be shaping the big data architecture at Zattoo and building data components that change the way data is leveraged at Zattoo!

THE DATA AND ANALYTICS TEAM

We are a diverse set of people ranging from Data Engineers (DEs) to Data Analysts and Machine Learning Engineers. We love bringing more value out of our data for the organization and truly drive data based decision making in all divisions. We are a bit nerdy and understand the heart of our business operations and our stakeholders to do our job well.

Zattoo operates in both the DtC and B2B space and combined with a TV streaming product, it is a dream company for a data professional to get maximum value out of data and learn new things everyday! We are building a scalable architecture with the newest tools, technologies and methodologies to leverage our big data (we process 6TB daily!)

WHAT YOU'LL DO

  • Collaborate with our Product Owners (POs) to understand their needs to generate insights from data
  • Identify and improve KPIs that are most relevant for driving product decisions and understanding what users do in our applications
  • Design dashboards that are tuned for decision making and insights. You will also be responsible for the design of external facing dashboards and analytics for our B2B clients
  • Conduct trainings for POs to understand our data and dashboards
  • Own and improve our product data models and documentation
  • Design A/B tests and interpret the results for product decisions
  • Collaborate closely with our Data Engineers (DEs) and other teams to ensure data quality and consistency

WHAT YOU'LL BRING

  • Master's degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or Statistics
  • 4+ years of experience as a Data/Product Analyst in a digital or tech company, analyzing large amounts of data
  • Obsession to understand end users and what they do in our products with data
  • Data Visualization: strong proficiency in designing intuitive, impactful and insightful data visualizations that effectively communicate key product metrics and user behavior patterns is essential
    • Experience with visualization and product analytics tools (we use Tableau, Apache Superset and mParticle (former Indicative)) and the ability to create custom visualizations when standard charts don't suffice
  • Statistics: background in designing and analyzing A/B tests for product features and user experience improvements
  • Strong SQL skills
  • Data Storytelling and Communication: strong communication and collaboration skills with data stakeholders and DEs
    • Ability to craft compelling narratives from complex data insights
    • Skill in presenting analytical findings into actionable recommendations for product and business strategies, from technical teams to C-level executives
  • Data Literacy: as a key member of the data team, you will also serve as a data literacy champion within the organization and:
    • Collaborate with the data team and POs to foster a data-driven culture
    • Advocate for data-informed decision making at all levels of the organization
    • Stay informed about the latest trends and best practices in data analytics and share knowledge with the wider team
  • Data Quality and Governance: ensure data quality, good data governance practices, and maintaining data dictionaries
  • Continuous Learning: demonstrate a passion for staying updated with the latest trends, tools, and techniques in data analytics and the streaming industry
Bonus:

  • Familiarity with A/B testing platforms like Optimizely or Google Optimize
  • Python skills

WHY JOIN US?

At Zattoo, you're always on firm ground with real freedom to explore. You'll have the support and opportunity you need to go far, while you're helping us create a sustainable and entertainment-filled future for all.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU

  • Reward: strong market competitive salary
  • Recharge: 30 days vacation plus public holidays
  • Regulate: trust-based flexible working hours and the option for remote work worldwide for up to 8 weeks per year

Plus:

  • We're sharing: Free access to the best streaming experience on the market
  • We're developing: Your own development budget, German classes and Zattoo all-company hack days
  • We're inclusive: 'Zattooies' are a fun, engaged, and diverse team made up of 47 nationalities
  • We're healthy: Health checks, team sports, organic fruit, vegan options and more!
  • We're responsible: We are carbon neutral, an active employee Green team, discounted BVG tickets and free bike rentals
  • We're sociable: A calendar of events with fireside chats, lunches, in-house bar, BBQ's, monthly socials, summer party and an annual off-site event

Zattoo enables our users to view indiscriminately and we reflect that in our team too. Regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law we encourage everyone to apply and will give everyone equal consideration. We are an equal opportunities employer, join us and help build a diverse team dedicated to the future of TV.

You can learn more about us at: https://zattoo.com

Title: Social Media Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Daten über das Social Media Verhalten deiner Zielgruppe faszinieren dich? Du liebst es, aus einer großen, ungeordneten Menge an Zahlen, konkrete Schlüsse zu ziehen und dein gewonnenes Wissen für andere verständlich zu machen? Du bist außerdem detailverliebt und hast Lust neue Prozesse mitzugestalten?

Dann sucht unser Team Dich! Als Social Media Analyst (w/m/d).

Bewirb Dich! Auch wenn das Profil auf den ersten Blick nicht zu 100% passt.




Was erwartet dich

Auswertung und Analyse von Performance-Daten auf allen relevanten Social-Media-Kanälen
Nutzung von Analyse-Tools (Sprinklr, Google Analytics, Google Looker Studio etc.)
Ableiten und Präsentieren von relevanten Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen
Optimierung/Automatisierung von Datenverarbeitung und Prozessen
Visuelle Datenaufbereitung & Dashboarding
Unterstützung von interdisziplinären Projektteams
Die Chance, mit einer der weltweit führenden Automobilmarken zu arbeiten




Was bringst du mit

Expertise im Bereich Social Media Analytics, zusätzliche Kenntnisse in Social-Media-Strategie und Advertising
Ein Gespür für Zahlen
Kompetenz im Umgang mit den aktuell relevanten Social-Media-Netzwerken
Fähigkeit zum Aufbau vertrauensvoller Kund:innenbeziehungen
Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office und eine unbändige Excel-Leidenschaft
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Interesse an der Automobilbranche ist von Vorteil




Wer wir sind

Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 200 sehr guten Leuten an unserem Standort in Berlin-Kreuzberg.

Autonomie, Vertrauen und Gestaltungsspielraum sind unsere Vision der modernen Arbeitswelt von morgen.
Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig und glauben an die kulturstiftende Wirkung von regelmäßigen Teamevents zur beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung.
Diversity, Gleichberechtigung sowie eine gesunde Work-Life Balance gehören zu unseren wichtigsten Werten.
Unser transparenter Feedbackprozess trägt bei uns zu einer offenen und wertschätzenden Kommunikationskultur bei.
Wir wollen zu deinem Leben passen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Work-Life-Care-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts an.




Was wir bieten

Hybrides Arbeitszeitmodell mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Regelmäßige Teamevents
Bis zu vier Wochen im Jahr im EU-Ausland arbeiten
30 Urlaubstage für alle Mitarbeiter:innen
Unbefristeter Vertrag nach 6-monatiger Probezeit
Raum zur Entfaltung und zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten in deiner neuen Rolle
Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget mit individuellem Gestaltungsspielraum




Wir freuen uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins an talent@tlgg.de.

Show more

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

As a Senior Analyst your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. We’re looking for a special candidate that has a combination of HR domain expertise, strong knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to a Senior Director in the People team, you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, you’ll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Understand business problems and enable business leaders and the People team to translate them into solutions supported by data and analysis
Managing dashboards, analysis and enabling for data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (“From Hire to Retire”)
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field (or equivalent working experience)
HR domain expertise
Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Excellent communication and relationships building skills to partner with stakeholders
Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Knowledge of Workday reporting would be an advantage


Nice-to-have:


Hands-on experience in statistics and advanced analysis, i.e. hypothesis testing, forecasting, predictions, sentiment analysis, etc.
Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)
Ability to use SQL
App scripting in Google Sheets


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 68,000 - € 92,000 gross per year.
Show more

  • BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field (or equivalent working experience)
  • HR domain expertise
  • Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills
  • Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
  • You are a Google Sheets master
  • Excellent communication and relationships building skills to partner with stakeholders
  • Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
  • Knowledge of Workday reporting would be an advantage

Nice-to-have:

  • Hands-on experience in statistics and advanced analysis, i.e. hypothesis testing, forecasting, predictions, sentiment analysis, etc.
  • Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)
  • Ability to use SQL
  • App scripting in Google Sheets

Work perks

  • The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
  • 30 days of paid annual leave
  • Newest MacBook models
  • Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
  • Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
  • A daily lunch allowance
  • Frequent team-building events
  • A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
  • A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
  • A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
  • Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
  • Life and disability insurance provided
  • A subsidised Deutschlandticket
  • The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
  • A dog-friendly office

Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 68,000 - € 92,000 gross per year.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.







THE ROLE

As a Senior Data Analyst at Oetker Digital, you will play a critical role in owning and leveraging data to drive business decisions and strategies. You will work closely with various teams and business partners on the side of our Group companies to ask the right questions, deeply understand the business domains and processes, analyze datasets, generate insights and business cases based on data that help our brands grow and succeed in the digital space. Your expertise will guide the optimization of brand, marketing and sales strategies, product development, and customer engagement initiatives.







WHAT YOU'LL DO

Partner and collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their strategies, needs and objectives
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key business partners to ensure data solutions align with business goals
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Analyze datasets to extract actionable insights and support data-driven decision making
Develop and implement statistical models to solve complex business problems
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights through effective data storytelling







WHAT YOU'LL BRING

At least 5 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Experience in Marketing Analytics & Optimization
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
You like to learn, work hands-on, take ownership, and have an impact
Fluent in German and English







WHAT WE OFFER

At Oetker Digital, we believe that a fulfilling career goes hand-in-hand with a vibrant culture and supportive environment. Here’s a glimpse of what you can expect when you join our team:




Our Berlin office is a lively space where creativity thrives – and yes, your furry friends are welcome too. Centrally located at Südkreuz, it offers excellent connections to public transport.
Enjoy the best of both worlds with our flexible hybrid work setup, designed to foster a healthy work-life balance.
Tailor your work schedule to fit your daily routine, ensuring you can achieve both professional success and personal fulfillment.
Work with diverse, talented colleagues from around the globe, and build meaningful connections at our regular company and team events, as well as during our monthly Collaboration Day.
Recharge with 28 days of paid vacation, plus enjoy Christmas and New Year’s Eve off. Need more time? We offer options for sabbaticals and additional unpaid leave.
We support families with 10 paid sick days per year for when your little ones need you.
Prioritize your mental health with individual sessions through our partner, Likeminded. Enjoy access to their exclusive workshops and webinars designed to support your well-being.
Invest in your future with up to €1,500 annually for courses, books, and other educational resources.
We foster a dynamic learning culture designed to empower your growth through Collaboration Days, Yeast Initiative exchanges, and knowledge-sharing sessions.
We offer a clear five-step career pathway, with the opportunity to choose from three advanced career tracks after reaching the senior level.
Choose between a Macbook or Lenovo, and get additional devices to perfect your home office setup.
Stay active with a subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket.
Secure your future with our robust company pension plan and personal accident insurance.
Enjoy special discounts from a wide range of external partners, making your everyday life more affordable and enjoyable.




Ready to take the next step in your career? Join us and experience a workplace where your well-being and growth are our top priorities. Apply today and let’s unlock next level Oetker together!







Diversity and Inclusion

At Oetker Digital, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are crucial elements of a respectful and inspiring workplace. We value the unique experiences that each individual brings to our team, and we are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels valued.

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Company: IU International University of Applied Sciences
Description:
Join us on the mission of democratising education and playing a key role in advancing the education journey for more than 2¹⁷ learners around the globe.

We are currently looking for a Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d) to join our platform analytics team.

This position is available as a full-time role at our IU office locations or remotely (must reside in Germany or the UK).

Your tasks


Be a core member of the Lecturing > Course Coordination team where you will be analysing vast staffing > recruiting demand data.
You will identify relevant information for our business and communicate the generated insights including interpretation to various stakeholders. In doing so, you ensure that practical recommendations for action are derived from the data collected.
You create automated reporting solutions - primarily working with SQL and visualizing your analyses in PowerBI.
You maintain our existing reporting landscape and continuously develop it.
You monitor the relevant KPIs of the department and you act as a sparring partner for our stakeholders.
You handle these tasks as part of an agile remote team in a dynamic corporate environment.
You mentor other analysts within the team in effectively utilizing Python for advanced data analysis.
You utilize your expertise in advanced analytics to evolve the traditional reporting and analytics processes, thereby contributing significantly to the methodological growth of the business.


Your Profile


Several years of experience in Business Intelligence, Analytics and Data Analytics.
Advanced knowledge in Excel, SQL and Python/R programming with a keen interest for further development.
Experience working with large datasets and Power BI.
Strong business sense, analytical abilities, and a goal-oriented approach to analyses and optimization measures.
Proficient in stakeholder management, able to effectively communicate data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Appreciation for fast, efficient processes in an agile environment.
Excellent communication skills in English > German (minimum B2) to collaborate with various stakeholders.


What We Offer


Design your ideal career and pathway: Explosive growth enables great opportunities. Tell us your dream career, and we will help you make it a reality.
Work from home, work from anywhere: We blur the lines between local and remote by embracing collaborative > video meeting technologies. Working from abroad for a while sounds good to you? No problem thanks to our WorkFlex benefit.
Flexible working times: It’s your call. We trust you will get things done.
Up level your education: Enjoy free up-skilling courses, language courses > discounted degree courses. There is always something new to learn!
Get a good rest: We push ourselves every day to go above and beyond. But we also take the time to recharge our batteries: with 30 days of annual vacation for all employees. Need some time off? How about a sabbatical?
Fruit baskets are yesterday, today we go for benefits that really count! Whether it's a job bike, employee discounts, company pension plan or net wage optimization: we're constantly working to get the most out of it for you.


Be part of our Lecturer > Course Coordination Team! Our team is focusing on efficient resource planning whilst securing the on-time staffing of all IUG-wide courses.

You find yourself in this profile and are looking for a new challenge? Then apply online now via our career portal.

If you have any further questions, please feel free to contact Rebecca (rebecca.moore@iu.org)

Please only apply via the application tool, no applications via email will be accepted.

You can find more information at www.iu.org.

Words are followed by deeds: We take our "Culture Of Everyone" very seriously and would like to point out once again that you are welcome to join us, regardless of your origin, religion, gender, age or sexual orientation. Even if you have a disability, our doors are open to you. We look forward to a diverse coexistence here at the IU!

Title: Customer Data Analyst (Customer Segmentation) (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando’s Markets organization, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer focussed analytics and segmentations we put our customers at the center of every marketing and retail decision. As a (Senior) Customer Data Analyst in our Customer Segmentation Team you are the closest link to our customer You build a deep understanding of our customer base by developing and analyzing different customer segments based on their purchasing behavior, interests, customer value and onsite activities. You will transform data and segmentations into actionable insights and recommendations that drive strategic decisions and customer retention.

WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



Develop and analyze customer segmentations and audiences, support targeting and steering initiatives to drive customer value and retention. Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to optimize and productionalize your segmentations and audience selections.
Design, conduct and evaluate A/B tests to optimize your segmentations and audiences according to their use case. Recommend testing strategies to optimize targeted campaigns, campaign efficiency and ultimately customer value and retention. Translate complex questions into sound analytical tasks, autonomously planning large scale projects.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify new strategic opportunities and recommend actions supporting the customer strategy. Present your findings and work closely with business stakeholders and product owners to operationalize your recommendations.
Drive data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members in terms of methodology & technology to raise the bar within the department. Collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers and commercial colleagues to untap new sources of data and know-how.
Independently manage analytical projects, identifying efficiency opportunities and supporting decision-making with insights from descriptive and inferential analysis.
Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions, support junior colleagues, and contribute to internal events and the hiring process.



WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



You have 3+ years experience in using customer data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions and/or drive targeting efforts incl. model driven statistical analysis, e.g. Causal Inference. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science.
Advanced skills in data methodologies and technologies (Python and SQL, PySpark). Visualization tools, e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, PowerBI and versioning tools, e.g. Git/GitHub, are considered a plus. Curious about learning new technologies, e.g. Databricks, AWS data lake, Airflow.
Strong communicator to challenge the status-quo, tell data stories, maximize decision impact of your results and liaison with commercial and tech people alike.
Proactive, fast learner, problem solver, teamplayer, comfortable working in English in a fast paced international work environment



INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy

https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups

https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups

Title: Data Analyst (d/m/w) - hybrides Arbeiten (Remote & Präsenz)
Description:
Akkodis - entstanden durch den Zusammenschluss von AKKA & Modis - ist ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Engineering & IT. Als globaler Partner in einer sich ständig verändernden Technologie- & Wettbewerbsumgebung unterstützen wir unsere Kunden mit unserem 360°-Angebot dabei, eine nachhaltigere & smartere Zukunft zu gestalten. Vereint durch unsere gemeinsame Leidenschaft für Technologie & Talente betrachten wir die Welt aus einem neuen Blickwinkel. Unsere 50.000 motivierten Ingenieur:innen & Digitalexpert:innen gehen dabei täglich über das Mögliche hinaus, um Unglaubliches zu schaffen

Sind Sie auf der Suche nach neuen und spannenden Herausforderungen? Dann beginnen Sie Ihre Karriere bei uns und werden Sie Teil eines unserer Kundenprojekte.

Ihre Aufgabenschwerpunkte



Extrahierung und Sammlung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, darunter Logdateien, Datenbanken und Monitoring-Tools
Bereinigung, Transformation und Standardisierung von Daten, um ihre Qualität und Konsistenz sicherzustellen
Automatisierung von Datenerfassungs- und Bereinigungsprozessen
Durchführung von Leistungsanalysen und Erstellung von Prognosemodellen
Entwicklung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Leistungsindikatoren, Sicherheitsmetriken und anderen relevanten Kennzahlen




Was Sie dafür mitbringen



Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Datenwissenschaft, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
Mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise im IT-Bereich
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Datenbankabfragesprachen wie SQL sowie Programmierkenntnisse in Python, R oder ähnlichen Sprachen
Erfahrung mit Tools und Technologien zur Datenvisualisierung, wie z.B. Tableau, Grafana oder Kibana
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Probleme zu lösen
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse




Warum Sie bei uns genau richtig sind



Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm




Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.

Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung. Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Ihr Kontakt Frau Maryana Dzhandarova

karriere-berlin@akkodis.com

Akkodis Germany Tech Experts GmbH Information Technology

Lietzenburger Str. 51

10789 Berlin

Telefon +49 30/20398410

www.akkodis.com/de

  • Attraktive Vergütung
  • Sozialleistungen
  • Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
  • Team- und Sportevents
  • Globales Netzwerk
  • Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm



Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.

Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung. Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Title: Senior People Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Senior HR Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders) to join the People Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

About the People Analytics team:


Data Infrastructure & Architecture: We design and maintain the data warehouse (AWS or BigQuery), integrating new systems to enhance our analytic capabilities while ensuring data privacy compliance.
Reporting and Visualization: Define and standardize People KPIs across local teams, and deliver automated reporting solutions via Tableau or other BI tools for effective data visualization.
Advanced Analytics & Data Science: Discover and communicate meaningful patterns in people data, using analytics and data science models to provide actionable insights.
Purpose and Mission: Enable senior leaders to make data-driven decisions, enhance employee experience, and improve business performance through comprehensive data analysis.
Long-term Goals: Aim for global reporting of key metrics with high accuracy, simplify complex HR and business challenges, and integrate data insights into daily decision-making.
Collaborative Approach: Work closely with local People Analytics teams to align metrics and reporting standards, ensuring a unified approach to data management.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with People Analytics teams, CHROs, P&C leaders, People Partners, and Senior Leaders for strategic decision-making based on reliable data.
Value Addition: Harmonize data across global teams, creating a single source of truth for reliable and consistent leadership decisions.


About the role:


Data Warehouse Management: Design, build, and maintain the architecture and infrastructure of our data warehouse, ensuring system integration and data compliance.
KPI Standardization: Define and align People KPIs across local teams, and implement automated reporting solutions for streamlined data visualization and analysis.
Analytics and Insights: Use advanced analytics to uncover meaningful patterns in people data, and develop data science models that provide actionable insights.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Gather requirements from CHROs and other stakeholders, translate these into actionable plans, and serve as the primary contact for people data.
Global Reporting: Collaborate with local teams for global reporting of key metrics, ensuring a unified and reliable data source for strategic decisions.
Training and Adoption: Provide training and support to drive the adoption of new BI tools and reporting practices, enhancing overall data literacy and user experience.


What you need to be successful


Background working in similar People/HR data-driven role (3+ years of experience, a must)
Advanced SQL and knowledge about data pipelines
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or other technical fields
Proven, direct experience with Tableau and demonstrate storytelling capabilities
Data visualization artist, able to create new and engaging ways of visualizing People data


Nice to have:


Worked in cross functional teams and can manage senior stakeholders
Fundamental understanding of statistics and basic principles of data analysis


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Online Canteen, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.
