Title: Senior Data Analyst - Customer Analytics (all genders)
Description:
You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando’s Markets organisation, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer analytics and customer segmentations we put our customers at the centre of every marketing and retail decision. As a Data Analyst in the Customer Analytics team, you will put customer data at the core of our decisions and processes.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED



You derive actionable customer insights and recommendations to fuel our Zalando business and the customer strategy. Your insights are derived from deep dive analysis you perform using a broad range of analytical methods and visualisations applied to data from various sources (transactional data, onsite data etc)
You proactively share your insights and recommendations in regular business reviews to senior management by providing compelling visualisations and stories. You seek opportunities to spread the insights beyond regular touchpoints with the aim of sourcing new business opportunities
You develop and optimise forecasting models for key customer metrics and provide expertise on current and expected trends for central planning efforts in close collaboration with our commercial planning teams
You drive analytical and data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members
You effectively collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers to untap new sources of data and know how



What We’re Looking For



5+ years of experience in using data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions incl. model driven statistical analysis. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Social Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related fields.
Proficient in data transformation and statistical computing in SQL and Python as well as strong skills in data visualisation. Basic experience in Google Analytics (BigQuery), MicroStrategy/Tableau, Airflow, Spark / DataBricks, and / or Github. Knowledge of basic time series forecasting techniques (SARIMAX, Prophet, Covariates) is considered a plus
Strong communication and visualisation skills and the ability to translate complex datasets into understandable and actionable insights and present to senior management in order to impact their decisions and strategy
Being curious and proactively creating insights while demonstrating end to end ownership of analytical projects. You innovate on new methodologies and datasets but also have a good sense when an pragmatic solution is sufficient
You are a role model and proved to be a mentor for junior to mid level team members



OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year (for Zalando SE)
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us
Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
At Neople we're looking for a Lead Data Analyst to join our team.

At Neople we're driven by our passion and experience in AI. We believe that AI can do lots of good, but we know it must be user-friendly in order to be widely adopted.

Our shared goal is to make it super easy for people to access helpful AI assistants in the workplace. That's why we're creating the most user-friendly digital co-workers powered by AI. More than 60 leading companies (like Levi’s, PSV, Rituals and Bax Music) have already hired a Neople to their team!

We’re growing fast and that’s why we’re looking for a new (human) colleague to join our stellar team! We're on the search for a highly motivated and resourceful Lead Data Analyst. If you’re fascinated by cutting edge AI systems, love to convert data insights into action, and you’re ready for the start-up adventure - we want to hear from you.

This can be your once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to join one the fastest growing start-ups in one of the most exciting fields to work in.

The team

We believe the people you work with are what make a job amazing. In this role you’ll be part of the Product team with Seyna (Head of Product) and Joep (CPO). You’ll work closely together with Koen, Stefan and Tom (AI Engineers), and of course with all data-consuming stakeholders in the rest of the company!

The Neople team is best described as open, ambitious, highly skilled, friendly and if you ask us - also really fun. At Neople we're driven by our passion and our core values: Eager to learn, Collegial, Trust, and Character. While those values define how we work together as humans, we’re also committed to creating digital co-workers that align with the same values.

The job

The Lead Data Analyst role at Neople is the first dedicated analytics role in the company (the work is currently being done by both AI Engineers and the Product team). That means the role combines data analytics, data engineering, and some data science skills - anything needed to get the insights we require.

As a Lead Data Analyst, you understand exactly how our Neople work and what defines their performance. By proactively working with stakeholders and gathering insights, you enable a data-driven way of working across the entire team.

Key Responsibilities


Own the data analytics function: proactively map out information needs, and provide visualizations to satisfy those needs
Own cross-functional data needs in the organization, and provide guidance to other teams on how to best utilize the data we have
Challenge data requests to understand the exact need, and whether or not a new insight is even required
Build the data infrastructure: make and update data engineering pipelines in our data warehouse, and define standard definitions to ensure consistency
Provide input to the product & tech team on opportunities to improve Neople performance


The Requirements


5+ years of experience in a similar role (e.g. Data analyst/engineer, BI engineer) in a start-up and/or SaaS environment
Technical skills: experienced with SQL, data engineering pipelines, data visualization, Python notebooks
Experience with conversational AI and LLM prompting
You have a strong belief in data-driven ways of working, and are willing to enable the organization on a path to become more data-driven
You can translate business- and customer goals into measurable metrics and clear visual insights
You don’t just execute, but you dig deep with stakeholders to understand the need for a specific insight
You’re a solution-oriented problem solver and don’t shy away from a challenge to investigate and resolve topics
You take a proactive role in defining metrics & improving observability of a Neople’s underlying systems
You’re constantly looking for opportunities to accelerate or automate your own work


Nice To Haves


Apart from working with data pipelines and creating them, experience with managing & administering a data warehouse


The offer


A competitive salary that matches market standards and matches your experience
Unlimited vacation
Opportunity to work in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment
Collaborative culture with a supportive team, and loads of team events
A work week of 32-40 hours a week
Beautiful offices in the center of Amsterdam, Den Bosch, or Berlin, and a public transport card to get there
Great equipment to work with i.e. MacBook
A competitive equity package


Interested?
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

Responsibilities


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
Hybrid working approach enabling a good balance working from home and the office
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program, that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG)
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 46 nationalities
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.
Show more

Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

Responsibilities

  • Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
  • Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
  • Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
  • Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
  • Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
  • Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
  • Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
  • Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
  • Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners

Who We Are Looking For

  • You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
  • Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
  • Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
  • Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
  • Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
  • Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
  • Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
  • You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
  • You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
  • Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage

What We Offer

  • Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
  • Hybrid working approach enabling a good balance working from home and the office
  • One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
  • Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program, that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG)
  • A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
  • Free German group classes
  • An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 46 nationalities
  • Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more

Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Title: Staff/Principal Data Analyst (d/f/m)
Description:
The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be office-based or hybrid, from one of the following countries: Germany, Spain, Ireland, the Netherlands, or the UK.

Drive Strategic Decisions. Shape Our Future. The Data Department is on a mission to facilitate better decisions within the company. We build core data products and enable internal teams to create and share their own. Join our team and help us build the foundation of data at Personio.

As a Staff/Principal Data Analyst supporting the Finance, Legal, and Strategy (FLS) team at Personio, you play a pivotal role in transforming data into strategic insights, shaping our company’s financial strategy. In this role, you're not just analyzing numbers; you're driving critical business decisions and influencing long-term strategies. Your insights directly impact our financial health and strategic direction, making your contribution vital to our mission of sustainable growth and operational excellence.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Business Partnership: Act as a primary data strategist for the organization, partnering with top executives. Regularly consult with the CFO and other executives, providing data-driven guidance on major strategic initiatives and long-term planning.
Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret diverse datasets, focusing on financial performance, legal trends, and strategic initiatives to guide FLS in making informed, data-driven decisions.
Dashboard Development: Create and strategize the evolution of real-time, interactive dashboards for stakeholders, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with the evolving needs of the business.
Business Reviews and Insight Generation: Oversee the insight generation process for business reviews at a company-wide level, guiding analysts in different departments to highlight crucial insights and trends.
Strategic Planning: Collaborate with leadership and peers in developing business strategies grounded in data insights, aimed at growth, operational optimization, and cost reduction.
Stakeholder Management: Lead multiple projects simultaneously, managing expectations and collaborating with the data team for internal consistency, scalability, and reliability of data practices.
Proactive Team Embedding: Act as a strategic data partner for multiple teams, guiding them in aligning their objectives with data insights. Lead initiatives to use data in solving complex business challenges.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Education & Experience: A quantitative degree (e.g., Applied Math, Econ, Stats, Eng, CS) paired with a minimum of 7 years of data analytics experience, in a SaaS, Subscription, or B2B environment with a focus on Finance, Legal, and Strategy. Experience working with executive-level stakeholders (CFO, CEO, …).
Deep understanding of SaaS-specific financial processes and financial systems like Salesforce, Chargebee, Adaptive.
KPI and Dashboard Expertise: Strong understanding of financial and strategic KPIs and proficient in creating scalable dashboards that effectively translate business requirements into impactful visuals.
Technical Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL and BI/Visualization tools like Tableau, facilitating data extraction, manipulation, and presentation.
Statistical Knowledge: Master the use of cutting-edge statistical methods and tools, providing strategic guidance and recommendations based on sophisticated data analysis.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve deep into data, identifying underlying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to articulate complex data observations in simple terms, ensuring clarity and understanding among stakeholders. Master the art of storytelling with data, driving organizational change and strategy through powerful presentations and reports.
Entrepreneurial Approach: A proactive problem-solver, focused on generating impactful results and identifying opportunities for improvement through data-driven insights.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Benefits

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)
Make an impact on the environment and society with 2 (fully paid) Impact Days – one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCares
Find your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! Most teams offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework
Invest in your development with an annual personal development budget to use on professional memberships, external certifications, conferences, and more
Connect with your fellow Personios at regular company and team events like All Company Culture Week and local year-end celebrations
Engage in a high-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes


About Us

Bring your best. Make your mark. We’re using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates so that we can transform the way millions of people experience work every day. We move fast, challenge the status quo, and support our people as they shape their careers.

With over 10,000 customers and a team of 2,000 in eight offices around the world, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and let’s build the future of HR technology together.

Discover our Personio Principles, that guide our mindset, behaviours, and the ways we work together:

Exceed Customer Expectations: We anticipate, prioritize, and solve for the needs of our customers.

Deliver Exceptional Results: We dream big and move with urgency to make great things happen.

Elevate One Another: We work together as trusted partners to amplify our collective impact.

Care to Challenge: We care personally and challenge directly to unlock our full potential.

Ignite Positive Momentum: We embrace the challenge with a positive mindset and celebrate our wins together.
Show more

With over 10,000 customers and a team of 2,000 in eight offices around the world, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and let’s build the future of HR technology together.

Discover our Personio Principles, that guide our mindset, behaviours, and the ways we work together:

Exceed Customer Expectations: We anticipate, prioritize, and solve for the needs of our customers.

Deliver Exceptional Results: We dream big and move with urgency to make great things happen.

Elevate One Another: We work together as trusted partners to amplify our collective impact.

Care to Challenge: We care personally and challenge directly to unlock our full potential.

Ignite Positive Momentum: We embrace the challenge with a positive mindset and celebrate our wins together.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
At Moss, we help companies spend smarter. We’re a place where aspiring, adaptable quick-thinkers thrive, and we’re set to become the next leading spend management platform in the European FinTech industry.

Our Data team is seeking a Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d) who will be responsible for using data-driven insights to support our customer success managers and enable the commercial success of Moss. You'll leverage your deep understanding of our product and users to help Moss foster relationships with customers.

Your Responsibilities

Here's a bit more on what you can expect to be doing day-to-day:


Collaborate with Commercial, Product and Engineering teams - You identify and collect the appropriate data needed for each (commercial) project and take accountability for all product-data-related inquiries within the commercial team.
Ensure quality control - You support, run, and establish reporting integrity checks to ensure high data accuracy and reliability, as well as prevent data exposure. This will enable you to secure that the data is accurate, reliable, and accessible, leading to better insights and decision-making.
Generate insights and influence our strategy - You take responsibility for extracting, cleaning, and preparing data, and create data pipelines/models as needed. This will allow you to present optimization recommendations and to produce customized analytics that inform and influence our commercial as well as product initiatives.
Define objectives and outcomes - You create and track OKRs and KPIs that are aligned with the organization's strategic goals. This will allow you to measure customer behavior, allocate resources effectively, track progress and define success.
Continuously monitor - You evaluate the success of data-driven initiatives and create adjustments to drive product growth. You will also contribute to standardizing data processes and defining best practices.



About You

We think you’ll need the following experience and qualifications to succeed in the role:


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., mathematics, computer science, or economics)
Proven experience with SQL and a strong knowledge of analysis techniques and tools (e.g. R, dbt, Python)
Fluent in written and spoken English



In addition, here are the skills and attributes we are looking for:


Technically and Analytically Skilled - You possess the technical knowledge to generate data driven insights and you apply the appropriate analytical methods to get the most out of available data. You adapt your approach to best address the problem at hand.
Impact-led Project Manager - You scope your projects with your team and stakeholders. You aim for high impact and actionable insights. You focus and deliver on projects and communicate deviations from the plan proactively.
Business Expert - You understand the business intricacies and needs and how Moss monetizes its product, and this helps you deeply understand how to collect, process, and interpret the data.
Collaborative Communication - You are able to present your insights and you can adapt to the audience. You foster open and constructive dialogue within the team.



Our offer

Skills

We believe the greatest benefit we can offer you is the opportunity to develop your skills and progress your career - we’d like to help you on that journey. Here's what else you can expect:


An attractive compensation package, including our company stock option plan
An annual learning budget of 600 euros
Access to our mental health and wellbeing offering, including 1-on-1 coaching sessions
An Urban Sports Club membership
20 days work from abroad



About Moss

Moss is a SaaS scale-up business founded in Berlin. In the last years, we have built a passionate team of circa 250 people from 40+ nationalities in 6 offices across Europe.

To date, we help over 3000+ businesses in Germany, Netherlands and the UK to spend smarter. Our leading spend management solution encompasses corporate cards, invoice management, employee cash reimbursements and controlling modules that help finance teams save thousands of hours in manual data processing and gain complete control while enabling their teams.

Moss has raised a total of €180 million in funding and is backed by renowned tech investors including Valar Ventures, Tiger Global, Global Founders Capital, Cherry Ventures and A-Star.

Not only do we embrace and celebrate the diversity of our customer base, but we also strive to do the same for our growing team. At Moss, we offer equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or parental status, disability, or other class protected by applicable law.

By applying, you confirm that you have been informed of the privacy policy of Nufin GmbH and you consent to the provision of personal information for the purpose of your job application. You can withdraw your consent at any time.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Was du bei uns machst

Die Analyse und Strukturierung von Daten lässt dein Herz höher schlagen? Außerdem behälst du den Blick aufs große Ganze und weißt genau welche strategischen Empfehlungen den Kunden glücklich machen? Wenn du dazu noch eine Leidenschaft für Werbung hast und dich in einem lebendigen und kreativen Umfeld weiterentwickeln möchtest, bist du bei uns genau richtig!


Entwicklung und Pflege von Dashboards
Entwicklung und Erstellung von Reportings für Kunden
Erstellung von Audiences und Insights als Basis für Strategieausarbeitungen
Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen
Unterstützung bei der Erarbeitung von Kanalstrategien und strategischen Empfehlungen für Kunden im Bereich Datenanalyse/Reporting
Unterstützung der Kolleg*innen bei der Interpretation von Daten
Aufbau und Vorantreiben der Dateninfrastruktur des Teams


Was du mitbringst


Du hast bereits Berufserfahrung im Bereich Social Media in einer digitalen Agentur mit dem Schwerpunkt Datenanalyse gesammelt (Performance Agentur, Mediaagentur)
Du bringst Kenntnisse in der Social Media Analyse von Tools mit (zB Facebook Business Manager, Twitter Analytics, Instagram Analytics, Emplifi etc.), sowie Kenntnisse in der Visualisierung von Tools und Datenbanken (zB Tableau, Looker Studio, Power BI, IBM Kognos / SQL, MS SQL, P SQL)
Du hast bereits fundierte Erfahrung mit Web- und Marketing Analytics (zB Google Analytics, SAS, Salesforce, Adobe, Microsoft etc.)
Du besitzt fachliches Know How in Global Web Index oder Best4Planning
Besonders deine Erfahrungen mit Looker Studio und Supermetrics bringst du erfolgreich bei uns ein
Du besitzt die Fähigkeit Social Media KPIs und ihre Abhängigkeit zu verstehen (Paid und Organic) sowie das Verständnis, Erkenntnis in ansprechende und verständliche Darstellungen zu übertragen
Durch dein Verständnis für Prozesse der Social Media Datenerhebung und Darstellung bereicherst du das gesamte Team (Benchmarking, Index-Berechnung, Mittelwert, Lineare Regression, Box Plot und Skalenniveaus)


Wer wir sind

Gegründet 1981 in Hamburg, sind wir als eine der führenden Kreativ-Agenturen im deutschsprachigen Raum mittlerweile mit Standorten in Berlin, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt, Stuttgart, Zürich, Wien und Brüssel vertreten. Bei uns arbeiten rund 1.200 Kolleg*innen – wir nennen sie Friends – mit Leidenschaft und Kreativität für große und kleine Kunden aus allen Branchen.

Wie wir unsere Friendskultur leben

Alle Friends haben bei uns den Raum, sie selbst zu sein, zu lernen und zu wachsen. Du kannst innovative Ideen einbringen und groß werden lassen. Auf dich warten neue Herausforderungen und vielfältige Weiterbildungsangebote. Im Mittelpunkt stehen immer die Menschen und ein wertschätzendes Miteinander. Daher sind Vielfalt, Gleichberechtigung und Inklusion wesentlich in unserer Wertekultur und Managementstrategie. In unserer Academy und mit unseren Angeboten setzen wir auf Mental Health, Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf sowie einen großen Fokus auf Diversity-Impulse in Unconscious-Bias-Workshops, in Vorträgen oder innerhalb verschiedener Mitarbeitendennetzwerke (ERGs).

Was es oben drauf gibt


Wir ermöglichen ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell (zwei Office-Tage) und flexible Arbeitszeiten
Arbeiten aus dem EU-Ausland | bis zu 45 Tage
Discounts bei Dienstleistern und Fitnessstudios im Umkreis unserer Standorte
Vergünstigter Paketpreis von "Wellhub" für Sport-, Freizeit-, Wellness- oder App-Angebote
Möglichkeit der Mitgestaltung der Agenturkultur durch Round Tables und Mitarbeitendeninitiativen, wie z. B. unserer &Queer*-Community
Scholz & Friends Academy: offene Weiterbildungsangebote zu Fachthemen, Impulsgebungen, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging (D.E.I.B.) und vielem mehr
Mental-Health-Support in Kooperation mit unseren Partner*innen von Telus Health: u.a. Videositzungen mit Therapeut*innen und Psycholog*innen, zur Förderung der individuellen mentalen Gesundheit
Eltern-Kind-Service zur Förderung des familienfreundlichen Klimas am Arbeitsplatz und eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance mit unseren Partner*innen von voiio


Weitere Benefits an deinem Standort erfährst du im persönlichen Gespräch!

Verrate uns gerne, wie du angesprochen werden möchtest (Wunschname und Pronomen). Dann können wir dies im gesamten Prozess berücksichtigen.

 

Du willst vor deiner Bewerbung noch ein wenig mehr über uns erfahren oder hast Fragen zu Barrierefreiheit bei Scholz & Friends? Kein Problem! Schreib uns einfach eine Mail unter jobs@s-f.com. Wir freuen uns auf dich!
Show more

  • Besonders deine Erfahrungen mit Looker Studio und Supermetrics bringst du erfolgreich bei uns ein
  • Du besitzt die Fähigkeit Social Media KPIs und ihre Abhängigkeit zu verstehen (Paid und Organic) sowie das Verständnis, Erkenntnis in ansprechende und verständliche Darstellungen zu übertragen
  • Durch dein Verständnis für Prozesse der Social Media Datenerhebung und Darstellung bereicherst du das gesamte Team (Benchmarking, Index-Berechnung, Mittelwert, Lineare Regression, Box Plot und Skalenniveaus)

Wer wir sind

Gegründet 1981 in Hamburg, sind wir als eine der führenden Kreativ-Agenturen im deutschsprachigen Raum mittlerweile mit Standorten in Berlin, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt, Stuttgart, Zürich, Wien und Brüssel vertreten. Bei uns arbeiten rund 1.200 Kolleg*innen – wir nennen sie Friends – mit Leidenschaft und Kreativität für große und kleine Kunden aus allen Branchen.

Wie wir unsere Friendskultur leben

Alle Friends haben bei uns den Raum, sie selbst zu sein, zu lernen und zu wachsen. Du kannst innovative Ideen einbringen und groß werden lassen. Auf dich warten neue Herausforderungen und vielfältige Weiterbildungsangebote. Im Mittelpunkt stehen immer die Menschen und ein wertschätzendes Miteinander. Daher sind Vielfalt, Gleichberechtigung und Inklusion wesentlich in unserer Wertekultur und Managementstrategie. In unserer Academy und mit unseren Angeboten setzen wir auf Mental Health, Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf sowie einen großen Fokus auf Diversity-Impulse in Unconscious-Bias-Workshops, in Vorträgen oder innerhalb verschiedener Mitarbeitendennetzwerke (ERGs).

Was es oben drauf gibt

  • Wir ermöglichen ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell (zwei Office-Tage) und flexible Arbeitszeiten
  • Arbeiten aus dem EU-Ausland | bis zu 45 Tage
  • Discounts bei Dienstleistern und Fitnessstudios im Umkreis unserer Standorte
  • Vergünstigter Paketpreis von "Wellhub" für Sport-, Freizeit-, Wellness- oder App-Angebote
  • Möglichkeit der Mitgestaltung der Agenturkultur durch Round Tables und Mitarbeitendeninitiativen, wie z. B. unserer &Queer*-Community
  • Scholz & Friends Academy: offene Weiterbildungsangebote zu Fachthemen, Impulsgebungen, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging (D.E.I.B.) und vielem mehr
  • Mental-Health-Support in Kooperation mit unseren Partner*innen von Telus Health: u.a. Videositzungen mit Therapeut*innen und Psycholog*innen, zur Förderung der individuellen mentalen Gesundheit
  • Eltern-Kind-Service zur Förderung des familienfreundlichen Klimas am Arbeitsplatz und eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance mit unseren Partner*innen von voiio

Weitere Benefits an deinem Standort erfährst du im persönlichen Gespräch!

Verrate uns gerne, wie du angesprochen werden möchtest (Wunschname und Pronomen). Dann können wir dies im gesamten Prozess berücksichtigen.

 

Du willst vor deiner Bewerbung noch ein wenig mehr über uns erfahren oder hast Fragen zu Barrierefreiheit bei Scholz & Friends? Kein Problem! Schreib uns einfach eine Mail unter jobs@s-f.com. Wir freuen uns auf dich!

Title: Datenanalyst:in
Description:
Standort: Berlin

Beschäftigungsart: Vollzeit

Gehalt: 65.000-80.000 EUR

Sprachkenntnisse: Deutsch C1 erforderlich







Für meinen renommierten Kunden in Berlin suche ich einen erfahrenen Data Analyst (m/w/d).




Deine Aufgaben:

Analyse großer Datenmengen zur Unterstützung datengetriebener Entscheidungsfindung
Entwicklung und Implementierung von Berichts- und Visualisierungslösungen (z. B. mit Power BI, Tableau, Qlik)
Identifizierung von Trends, Mustern und Korrelationen in komplexen Datensätzen
Erstellung von Dashboards und KPI-Reports für verschiedene Geschäftsbereiche
Zusammenarbeit mit internen Stakeholdern zur Definition von Analyseanforderungen und zur Verbesserung von Geschäftsprozessen durch Datenanalysen
Optimierung von ETL-Prozessen und Integration von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen
Sicherstellung der Datenqualität und -konsistenz in allen Analyseprozessen

Dein Profil:

Abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Fachbereich wie Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik, Mathematik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Fundierte Erfahrung in der Analyse großer Datenmengen sowie im Umgang mit Datenbanken und Abfragesprachen (z. B. SQL)
Gute Kenntnisse in Programmiersprachen wie Python oder R
Erfahrung mit gängigen BI-Tools (Power BI, Tableau, QlikView, o.ä.)
Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Machine Learning oder Predictive Analytics
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse
Hohes analytisches Denkvermögen, eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise und ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten

Benefits:

Mobiles und flexibles Arbeiten, JobRad, betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Corporate Benefits, uvm.
Individuelle persönliche und fachliche Weiterbildungen, Mentoring-Programme und Zertifizierungen
Austausch und Wissenstransfer zwischen verschiedenen Teams und Abteilungen
Umfangreiche Gesundheitsangebote, Mitarbeiterrabatte und weitere Zuschüsse







Interessierst du dich für diese spannende Herausforderung?




Dann bewirb dich noch heute bei mir! :)

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
For our client, a leading company in its sector, we are searching for a Data Engineer (m/f/d) as soon as possible.

Your Job


Development and maintenance of the profiling system based on Java and Spring Boot.
Responsibility for architectural framework and further development of the guidelines.
Connection of data from different sources as well as creation of ETL pipelines for the integration of data into the Snowflake DWH using infrastructure components like Logstash and Redis.
Conception, modeling and realization of data models.
Advising internal departments on the use of the data provided.


Your Profile


Quick orientation in new complex situations and never lose sight of the goals. Ideally, you have also led complex IT projects to success in recent years.
Very high analytical skills as well as a structured and method-based way of workingSound knowledge of Java, Spring Boot and SQL (PostgreSQL, Snowflake).
Confident handling of common methods for aggregation and data.
Extensive experience with the analysis of data structures.
High level of initiative and the ability to learn new things independently.
You are a team player, can communicate confidently with stakeholders and have very good German and good English skills


Interested yet? Feel free to send us your application letter!

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (f/m/d) - SCM
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description

What you'll get to do:


Conduct operations research, overhaul a set of relevant KPIs and support process transformation in partnership with the Head of SCM Finance, VP of SCM Finance, and the senior management.
Provide analytical support for projects related to over-shipping and under-shipping of materials by identifying operational gaps and assessing potential financial impacts.
Develop a deep knowledge of ERP data and use it to ensure proper usage and design of the ERP system in collaboration with the Operational Excellence and Digital Product teams, ensuring that all materials for customer deliveries and returns are accounted for in the inventory.
Automate SCM reporting by transitioning from Excel-based reports to a unified, automated system using our centralized data warehouse.
Closely work with stakeholders across Material Planning, Procurement and Hardware Engineering and overarching SCM teams to strategize and deliver reports supporting stock-out, alerting low stock levels and adoption rate of new products.



Qualifications

What you should bring:


5+ years of relevant experience as Senior BI Analyst, Senior Business Analyst or Data Analyst.
High proficiency in SQL, ETL processes, and familiarity with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Our tech stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit and Tableau.
Exposure to Python (e.g. pandas) and Excel for quick a-hoc data analysis.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record of using data to improve business outcomes.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments, with a commitment to operational excellence and innovation.



Additional Information

We're offering:


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Supply Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Supply Analytics and will see you collaborate primarily with the Supply Tech Team to improve supplier engagement and, in turn increase the inventory available on the marketplace for our travellers

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Serve as a liaison between the product teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg: pandas, scikit-learn)
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
Experience working in Marketplace business
Experience solving Marketplace operations questions, such as understanding inventory diversity.
Experience in statistical modelling.
Experience in B2B product analytics.


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Game Data Analyst (World of Tanks)
Description:
Job Overview




Wargaming is looking for a proactive, excited, and determined Game Data Analyst to strengthen the World of Tanks product analytics team.

We collect all kinds of information about the player's behavior and the events in the ‘WoT universe’: from economic, financial, and detailed combat data to the precise coordinates of each shot and tank movement, interface telemetry, and many others. All of them are routed to a singular database and are available for analysis 24/7.

You will be working with the WoT Product Team responsible for decision-making process, with the Data Warehouse team responsible for data storage, reports system and our infrastructure, as well as 60 analytics all over the world united under Wargaming Global Analyst Network.




What will you do?




Helping deliver important analytical insights to managers and other product teams necessary for decision-making.
Use quantitative analysis to understand how the game is played and identify impact and growth opportunities.
Participating in analytical maintenance for features, game events, and modes throughout all development and release stages:
Pre-Production Analytics: modeling likely outcomes and risks from implementing new features, game modes, and events into the game; predict the future events, product KPIs and metrics; providing analysis of their full development cycle (from concept to release);
Production Analytics: developing and preparing analytical reports, metrics and methodologies for evaluating features, game modes, and events in operation; looking for anomalies and insights that help increase effectiveness of the product and its parts;
Operation Analytics: creating and supporting analytical tools and interfaces (dashboards) for rapid updates on the status of the product and its subsystems delivered to the management and the responsible teams.
Gather and formulate requirements, conduct analytical research from producers, PMs, UX/UI and game designers, developers, QA and artists.
Presenting the research results and filling the product analytics knowledge base to share with other teams.







What are we looking for?




3+ years experience in a similar position.
Understanding the principles of formalizing business tasks in research plans, as well as experience writing analytical reports and presenting their results.
Advanced SQL knowledge.
Experience with at least one data visualization solution (Tableau / Qlik / Microsoft Power BI, etc).
Experience with Python/R and popular libraries for data processing and analysis.
Great communication skills, both written and spoken, especially for a non-technical audience.
Written and spoken English (B1 and higher).







What additional skills will help you stand out?




Being prepared to learn, take in, and systemize vast amounts of data within a short time.
Experience working with Cloudera Impala / Hive, Oracle SQL, Snowflake.
Knowledge and practical application of machine learning algorithms.
Rich gaming experience in different games and over 1000 World of Tanks battles.




Benefits

Benefits and perks are tailored to the local market and culture. Our benefits in Berlin include:

Career development and education opportunities within the company
Home internet reimbursement
Gym membership through Urban Sports Club - Package M
Mental well-being program (iFeel)
Language classes
Company pension scheme with a company contribution up to 150 EUR per month
Personal Gaming Account
Coffee, fruits, and snacks in the office
Company events
Seniority Awards
Referral program - You can recommend the best talents to the company and receive a reward
Show more

Title: Climate Change Analyst | Carbon Footprinting, Data Insights | Berlin
Description:
My client is an innovative tech-for-good start-up based in Berlin. With almost a third of global greenhouse gases coming from food production, this cutting-edge software provider is at the forefront of the solution securing funding of over €10 million in just 2 years. They require a Business Analyst to help their clients understand the climate data insights in order to set an accurate and achievable Net Zero target.

The role


Conduct calculations to work out carbon footprints for several different clients
Work closely with their client base ensuring accurate data collection, calculations and data analysis
Produce insights from the calculations to be used for Net Zero target plans
Keeping up to date with the latest environmental regulations and protocols
Create “products” from the calculations to offer the same service to future clients


Skills And Experience Required


At least 3 years’ experience with client facing positions
Previous experience in consulting start-ups (or other fast paced environments)
Strong skills in complex datasets and quantitative analysis
Any experience in carbon footprint calculations would be valuable
Fluent in both German and English


In Return, They Can Offer


A salary of up to €80k depending on experience
Generous benefits package
Top of the range city centre office


If this role sounds of interest, feel free to apply or reach out to Luke Rose directly!
Show more

  • A salary of up to €80k depending on experience
  • Generous benefits package
  • Top of the range city centre office

If this role sounds of interest, feel free to apply or reach out to Luke Rose directly!

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (f/m/d) - Finance
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description

What you will do:


Work closely with the VP of FP&A, Head of Finance Transformation and partner closely with Group Accounting and Controlling teams to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Segment Reporting for different business units to provide financial visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Automate the delivery of Monthly Lease data to calculate the asset values under customer lease agreements, ensuring accurate tracking of rent payments, asset lifespan, and customer purchases, for key stakeholders providing an efficient self-service reporting.
Develop deep knowledge of ERP data related to financial transactions and resources, use it to ensure adequate usage & design of ERP in collaboration with the Finance Transformation and the Analytics Engineering Guild teams to contribute to the ERP data modelling for the Finance team.
Closely work with Finance leadership, lead weekly meetings with them, ensure quarterly roadmap planning and drive prioritization.



Qualifications

What you should bring:


5+ years of relevant experience business intelligence, analytics with a strong background in finance or accounting domains.
High proficiency in SQL, ETL processes, and familiarity with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Our tech stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit and Tableau.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines and reporting workflows, especially for monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
Strong ability to analyse financial data, identify patterns, and communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring the delivery of clear, understandable financial reports.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments, with a commitment to financial excellence and innovation.



Additional Information

We're offering:


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/x) - Elternzeitvertretung- DE
Description:
The position is limited until January 1, 2026.

Forme mit uns die Zukunft des B2B


You will manage and further improve our business intelligence environment in AWS
The entire spectrum of data management, including data modelling, data integration and data aggregation for analytical consumption and reporting is part of your daily tasks
You will be conceiving and implementing Data pipelines in AWS
You ensure good data quality and consistency
You’re the contact person for stakeholders as well as for all data analysts and scientists within and outside the BI team
You design and develop technical solutions for data requirements
You are a sparring partner for your colleagues
You are always looking for new and better solutions that improve the work of the entire team in the long term


Was wir bieten


The opportunity to shape the future of online B2B business and to develop an European Champion
An agile and supportive environment where success is always a team effort
As part of our friendly and open-minded team, you can contribute your own ideas and continuously develop your skills
We offer attractive incentives and fair compensation with modern offices
30 days of vacation, flexible working hours and the opportunity to work on a mobile basis


Damit beeindruckst Du uns


University level degree in computer science or equivalent education
Professional experience with the concepts, administration and usage of AWS Redshift or similar databases
You’re an expert in SQL
You’re experienced in using AWS and you can also work on a LINUX console
You have sufficient experience with ETL/ELT tools
You’re familiar with script languages and have experience with Python
You have already worked with the following or similar tools:
Matillion, Gitlab, Jira, Confluence, Apache Airflow
You work reliably and service-oriented and also think "out of the box"


We live and love diversity! That's why at Visable we promote equal opportunities and guarantee that all qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation as well as gender identity or expression and physical or cognitive abilities. A culture of respectful interaction is deeply rooted in our corporate values and therefore we want every employee to feel included, accepted and valued.

Title: Analytical Consultant (Fixed-Term Contract)
Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Hamburg, Germany; Berlin, Germany; Frankfurt, Germany; Munich, Germany.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in media analytics, advertising sales, digital media and marketing, consulting, or financial analysis.
Experience in data analysis and visualization (e.g. Google Sheets and Slides), scripting (e.g. SQL) and dashboard development (e.g. Looker Studio).
Experience in translating data into business recommendations, creating and delivering insights-based presentations or business cases with recommendations and aligned with customers goals.


Preferred qualifications:


Experience working as an Analytical Consultant or in similar analytical, data-focused roles.
Experience in advertising from either the advertiser, agency, or other media owner side.
Experience working closely with multiple stakeholder and cross-functional teams and influence key stakeholders (internally and externally) across all levels.
Ability to communicate in English and German fluently as this is a customer-facing role that requires interactions in German with local stakeholders.


About The Job

Being an Analyst at Google is about much more than simply crunching numbers – it’s about finding compelling insights within data and using your exceptional business and communication skills to translate those insights into action. As one of the masterminds behind our strategic planning, forecasting and analysis, you’ll spend your time digging into big, complex data sets. The data will not remain inert in your hands, however, since you’ll use your critical thinking, problem solving and communication skills to influence and drive thoughtful and well-informed decision making with our most senior business leaders within the organization, and potentially some of our biggest clients.

This Fixed-Term Contract is effective from December 2024 through September 2026, with the position located in Germany.

Digital First, a sector within Germany Large Customer Sales (LCS), is home to a variety of customers, from Travel to Media and Entertainment and many digital players. Our mission is to drive the success and sustainable growth of our Digital First customers through innovation, diversity, and a customer-first mindset.

The Insights and Analytics team within Digital First empowers our customers in achieving their business and marketing goals by providing them with data-driven bases for decision-making. The team uses business acumen combined with analytical and storytelling skills to partner closely with a variety of internal and external stakeholders and support the transformation and shifts required to be successful in an ever changing market environment. The team leverages Google's internal search data and external market data, to uncover actionable insights, driving informed decision-making and fostering mutual growth for our customers and Google.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities


Conduct comprehensive bespoke analyses for our high-priority customers to uncover hidden opportunities to optimize their online advertising ROI.
Consult with clients as a strategic consultant, clearly presenting data-driven insights and recommendations that align with their business goals.
Streamline processes by developing scalable templates, dashboards and scripts (together with gCare Insights). Develop compelling narratives to deliver insights at scale for a wider customer base.
Empower clients and partners by creating internal dashboards and reports to democratize insights and by delivering training and guidance on using Google's data tools and APIs.
Work seamlessly with diverse teams and stakeholders to drive successful outcomes for clients (e.g. measurement specialists).



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Insurance (m/w/d)
Description:
Werde Teil des Verivox Teams!

Du fühlst Dich in der Welt der Daten zuhause und möchtest die Zukunft unserer Versicherungssparte aktiv mitgestalten? Dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig:

Für unseren Standort in Leipzig, Heidelberg, Berlin oder München suchen wir dich mit mehrtägiger Mobile Office Option pro Woche in Vollzeit (40 h) zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als Data Analyst Insurance (m/w/d)

Deine Mission


Du wendest deine gesammelten Erfahrungen im Bereich Mathematik/Statistik und Informatik in Kombination an
Mit explorativer Datenanalyse und Machine Learning Modellen beantwortest du Fragen der Stakeholder
Durch Analysen, Deepdives und in Reporten findest du Probleme, die den Weg zu neuen und wertvollen Lösungen ebenen können


Das bringst du mit


Du hast ein abgeschlossenes naturwissenschaftliches Studium, idealerweise mit Schwerpunkt Mathematik/Statistik und Informatik
Du besitzt mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Rolle und hast gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie mit relationalen Datenbanken
Du bringst Big-Data- und Machine-Learning-relevante Programmierkenntnisse (Python, Pandas, scipy, poetry, etc.) mit, Erfahrungen im Bereich der Datenvisualisierung sind von Vorteil
Du hast praktische Erfahrungen mit Git
Du verfügst über sehr gute deutsche und englische Sprachkenntnisse


Das bieten wir dir


Rund 500 Mitarbeiter aus über 35 Nationen als kollegiale Gemeinschaft
Offene und diverse Unternehmenskultur mit flachen Hierarchien sowie modernem und wertschätzendem Arbeitsumfeld
Großzügige Mobile Office-Regelungen, die flexibles Arbeiten von zu Hause und aus dem EU-Ausland ermöglichen
Eigener Verantwortungsbereich mit Raum zur Entfaltung eigener Ideen und Konzepte
Unkompliziertes Miteinander: wir duzen uns & bestehen nicht auf Dresscodes
Exklusive Mitarbeitervorteile wie Jobticket, Jobrad, Zuschuss zum Mittagessen über Sodexo und Mitarbeiterrabatte
Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement, wie betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Urban Sportsclub und Mental Health Days
Zentral gelegene Offices in Heidelberg, Berlin, München und Leipzig mit optimaler Verkehrsanbindung


Abbinder

Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann freuen wir uns, dich kennenzulernen. Überzeuge uns davon, dass du uns nach vorne bringst! Bitte sende deine Bewerbung inklusive Gehaltsvorstellung und Kündigungsfrist bzw. frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermin über den Link "Jetzt Bewerben" oder an jobs[AT]verivox.com .

Verivox ist eines der führenden Online-Vergleichsportale in Deutschland. Seit 1998 machen wir Märkte in den Bereichen Strom & Gas, Mobilfunk & Internet sowie Finanzen & Versicherungen transparent. Aus rund 30.000 Tarifen finden wir das beste Angebot für Verbraucherinnen und Verbraucher und helfen so Haushalten, Zeit und Geld zu sparen. Mehr als 8 Millionen Menschen haben mit unserer Hilfe bereits über 2 Milliarden Euro gespart. Seit 2015 ist Verivox Teil der ProSiebenSat.1-Gruppe.

Unternehmenstext

Informiere dich hier über die ProSiebenSat.1 Group und unser vielseitiges Portfolio.

Du hast eine Behinderung und möchtest dich bewerben? Dann bist du bei uns herzlich willkommen.

Wir wissen, dass wir noch nicht gänzlich barrierefrei sind, aber wir arbeiten daran. Lass uns darüber reden, wie wir diese Barriere gemeinsam abschaffen und wenn nötig eine individuelle Lösung finden können.

Ausschließlich aus Gründen der besseren Lesbarkeit wird nur die männliche Form verwendet. Selbstverständlich sind immer alle Geschlechter angesprochen.

Das bieten wir dir: Training and Education Subsidized company pension plan Flexible Working Hours No dress code Team Events Open corporate culture Exclusive employee benefits / discounts


Hybrid Work
