Title: Inhouse BI Consultant / BI Spezialist (m/w/d)
Company: IT-Personalberatung Dr. Dienst & Wenzel GmbH & Co. KG
Description:
Für die interne IT-Abteilung unseres Auftraggebers, eine 100% Tochter eines großen Automobilkonzerns, suchen wir einen erfahrenen BI Spezialisten / Architekt als stellvertretender Teamleiter in der Rolle als Inhouse Consultant (m/w/d) der für die Konzeption sowie Mit- und Weiterentwicklung der BI-Applikationen innerhalb der Gesamtstrategie des New MIS Projekt (Management-Informations-Systems) verantwortlich ist.




Wir kennen die Anforderungen unserer Auftraggeber und eröffnen Ihnen passgenaue Karriereperspektiven! Wir analysieren Ihr Profil und coachen Sie objektiv im Bewerbungsprozess.




Stellenbeschreibung:

Zur Verstärkung und Ausbau des internen IT-Bereichs suchen wir Sie, einen erfahrenen BI-Spezialisten der als „Kennzahlen-Junkie“, und mit dem Blick „über den Tellerrand“, für die Data Warehouse-Struktur inkl. der Datenbanken, Datenverarbeitung und Reporting verantwortlich ist. Die aufbereiteten Daten gelten als zentrales Steuerelement für die Steakholder und deren Autohausgesellschaften.




Im Rahmen der digitalen Transformation plant das Unternehmen zukünftig die Migration auf SAP S/4 HANA. Hierbei wird es Ihre Aufgabe sein, die BI-Projekte im zukünftigen SAP System mit aufzubauen und „Alt-Technologien“ wie Cognos Analytics abzulösen und in Technologien wie Microsoft Power BI zu überführen.




Unser Auftraggeber gehört zu einem international führenden Automobilkonzern. Das Unternehmen ist als Dienstleistungsgesellschaft zuständig für die interne Steuerung- und Koordination, u.a. der IT (Retail-Systeme), aller bundesweiten Verkaufs- und Serviceniederlassungen.




Zu Ihren wesentlichen Aufgaben in dieser Position gehören:

Verantwortung für das Data Engineering im zentralen Data Warehouse
Konzeption und (Mit) Entwicklung des New MIS Projekt im Rahmen der Gesamtstrategie
Datenbank-Administration der BI Center sowie Dokumentation der Datenbankstruktur
Betreuung der Reporting-, Planungs- und Analytics-Anwendungen
Ausbau und kontinuierliche Verbesserung der Analytics Landschaft
Berichtsdefinition
Integration, Wartung und Support (2nd und 3rd Level) von Data Warehousing Prozessen und analytischen Applikationen
Dokumentation der Datenbankstruktur




Ihr Profil:

Sie greifen auf Ihre Kenntnisse aus der BI Softwareentwicklung zurück und gestalten auf Basis Ihrer fachlichen Kompetenz das Projektergebnis
Sie bringen sehr gute Kenntnisse im Bereich Enterprise Datenbanken (MS SQL Server, IBM Cognos TM1, ...) mit
Sie haben mehrjährige Kenntnisse in der Datenbankentwicklung (relational und multidimensional)
Sie haben gute Kenntnisse in Business Intelligence- Software wie z.B. Cubeware, MS Analysis Server, IBM TM1, MS Power Apps, MS Power BI)
Außerdem bringen Sie sehr gute Erfahrungen im in Microsoft 365 mit
Darüber hinaus gehören Konzeptentwicklung, -prüfung und -beratung wie z. B.- Analyseworkflows (Ursache -> Wirkung) zu Ihren Erfahrungen
Idealerweise Branchenkenntnis aus und/oder im Umfeld des Automobilhandels




Auftraggeber:

Unser Auftraggeber gehört zu einem international führenden Automobilkonzern und ist als IT Dienstleistungsgesellschaft zuständig für die interne Steuerung- und Koordination, u.a. der IT (Retail-Systeme) aller bundesweiten Verkaufs- und Serviceniederlassungen.

Eine der strategischen IT-Vorhaben ist die Forcierung der Digitalisierung in den Niederlassungen. Hierbei geht es um die Entwicklung und Einführung von innovativen und kundenfokussierten Lösungen für den Automobilhandel.

Als Arbeitgeber bietet unser Auftraggeber den Mitarbeitenden umfassende Benefits und Möglichkeiten der persönlichen Weiterbildung in Form von Personalentwicklungsprogrammen.

Neben einer attraktiven Gehaltsvergütung werden ergänzende Bonusregelungen und Zusatzleistungen wie z. B. Werksangehörigenleasing oder Mitarbeiterrabatte sowie eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge angeboten.

Hybride Arbeitszeitmodelle bieten die Möglichkeit den Arbeitsalltag individuell zu gestalten. Wenn Sie aus dem Büro arbeiten, dann befindet sich Ihr Arbeitsplatz entweder in einer der deutschlandweiten Autohaus-Verwaltungen oder in einer Markenrepräsentanz.




Ausbildung:

Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschaft)Informatik oder eine abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung zum Fachinformatiker oder eine vergleichbare IT-orientierte Ausbildung.




Kenntnisse:

Mehrjährige und nachweisliche Kenntnisse im BI-Projektmanagement und -beratung
Gute Kenntnisse in Microsoft 365
Eigenverantwortliche, strukturierte und prozesssichere Arbeitsweise sowie gute Auffassungsgabe
Sicheres Auftreten, Kooperationsfähigkeit, Durchsetzungsvermögen, sowie hohe Teamfähigkeit
Gutes Kommunikationsvermögen und Konfliktfähigkeit
Sehr gute Deutsch-Kenntnisse in Wort und Schrift werden vorausgesetzt!!
gute Englisch-Kenntnisse




Erfahrungen:

Erfahrung und Kenntnisse in der Planung und Steuerung von relevanten Projekten
Erfahrung in der Zusammenarbeit und Koordination mit externen Dienstleistern




Arbeitsort:

Berlin, Metropolregionen Hamburg, Hannover, Magdeburg, Frankfurt am Main, Raum Mannheim, Stuttgart, Ulm, Augsburg sowie in und um München, Home-Office-Regelung




Es erwartet Sie eine sichere und zukunftsorientierte Position bei einem sicheren und marktführenden Automobilkonzern.

Wenn Sie diese Herausforderung interessant finden, dann freuen wir uns Sie intensiver kennenzulernen.

Ihre Fragen vorab beantwortet gerne: Viktoria Roenick unter der Telefonnummer +49 (0) 6203 / 955 6336 oder +49 (0) 172 20 3232 0

Senden Sie uns bitte Ihre aussagefähige Bewerbung direkt per Mail an roenick@it-personalberatung.de mit folgenden Inhalten:

Bezugnehmend auf diese Stellenausschreibung (Ref. Nr.)
Kurzes Anschreiben mit Darstellung Ihrer Eignung für diese Position
Prägnanter Lebenslauf, gerne mit Foto, aus dem Ihre Erfahrungen, Kenntnisse und Erfolge hervorgehen
Zeugnisse am liebsten als pdf-file
Früheste Verfügbarkeit
Ungefähre Einkommensvorstellung




Diskretion und eine umfassende Wahrnehmung Ihrer Interessen sichern wir Ihnen ausdrücklich zu.




Ich freue mich auf Ihre Bewerbung!




.... weitere Jobangebote finden sie unter www.it-personalberatung.de

Show more
HTML:
Für die interne IT-Abteilung unseres Auftraggebers, eine 100% Tochter eines großen Automobilkonzerns, suchen wir einen erfahrenen BI Spezialisten / Architekt als stellvertretender Teamleiter in der Rolle als Inhouse Consultant (m/w/d) der für die Konzeption sowie Mit- und Weiterentwicklung der BI-Applikationen innerhalb der Gesamtstrategie des New MIS Projekt (Management-Informations-Systems) verantwortlich ist.


Wir kennen die Anforderungen unserer Auftraggeber und eröffnen Ihnen passgenaue Karriereperspektiven! Wir analysieren Ihr Profil und coachen Sie objektiv im Bewerbungsprozess.


Stellenbeschreibung:

Zur Verstärkung und Ausbau des internen IT-Bereichs suchen wir Sie, einen erfahrenen BI-Spezialisten der als „Kennzahlen-Junkie“, und mit dem Blick „über den Tellerrand“, für die Data Warehouse-Struktur inkl. der Datenbanken, Datenverarbeitung und Reporting verantwortlich ist. Die aufbereiteten Daten gelten als zentrales Steuerelement für die Steakholder und deren Autohausgesellschaften.


Im Rahmen der digitalen Transformation plant das Unternehmen zukünftig die Migration auf SAP S/4 HANA. Hierbei wird es Ihre Aufgabe sein, die BI-Projekte im zukünftigen SAP System mit aufzubauen und „Alt-Technologien“ wie Cognos Analytics abzulösen und in Technologien wie Microsoft Power BI zu überführen.


Unser Auftraggeber gehört zu einem international führenden Automobilkonzern. Das Unternehmen ist als Dienstleistungsgesellschaft zuständig für die interne Steuerung- und Koordination, u.a. der IT (Retail-Systeme), aller bundesweiten Verkaufs- und Serviceniederlassungen.


Zu Ihren wesentlichen Aufgaben in dieser Position gehören:

  • Verantwortung für das Data Engineering im zentralen Data Warehouse
  • Konzeption und (Mit) Entwicklung des New MIS Projekt im Rahmen der Gesamtstrategie
  • Datenbank-Administration der BI Center sowie Dokumentation der Datenbankstruktur
  • Betreuung der Reporting-, Planungs- und Analytics-Anwendungen
  • Ausbau und kontinuierliche Verbesserung der Analytics Landschaft
  • Berichtsdefinition
  • Integration, Wartung und Support (2nd und 3rd Level) von Data Warehousing Prozessen und analytischen Applikationen
  • Dokumentation der Datenbankstruktur


Ihr Profil:

  • Sie greifen auf Ihre Kenntnisse aus der BI Softwareentwicklung zurück und gestalten auf Basis Ihrer fachlichen Kompetenz das Projektergebnis
  • Sie bringen sehr gute Kenntnisse im Bereich Enterprise Datenbanken (MS SQL Server, IBM Cognos TM1, ...) mit
  • Sie haben mehrjährige Kenntnisse in der Datenbankentwicklung (relational und multidimensional)
  • Sie haben gute Kenntnisse in Business Intelligence- Software wie z.B. Cubeware, MS Analysis Server, IBM TM1, MS Power Apps, MS Power BI)
  • Außerdem bringen Sie sehr gute Erfahrungen im in Microsoft 365 mit
  • Darüber hinaus gehören Konzeptentwicklung, -prüfung und -beratung wie z. B.- Analyseworkflows (Ursache -> Wirkung) zu Ihren Erfahrungen
  • Idealerweise Branchenkenntnis aus und/oder im Umfeld des Automobilhandels

Title: Data Analyst and Automation Specialist (m/f/d)
Description:
SafeDriver Group GmbH is a leading company in the field of safe passenger transportation and an important service partner for innovative mobility companies and global players. With over 800 dedicated employees, we implement pioneering mobility solutions in Germany's urban centers. As a growing company, we are looking for an experienced and analytically strong personality to advance our group of companies as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist (m/f/d).

Aufgaben


Performing data analysis and visualization with tools such as backends Google Cloud, AWS, Python, R, SQL, Tableau and Power BI.
Implementing machine learning models to predict business outcomes and optimize processes.
Analyzing large data sets to derive business trends and patterns.
Creating dashboards and reports to present insights to stakeholders.
stakeholders.
Collaborating with internal and external teams to implement data-driven projects.
Performing Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) for data cleansing and preparation.
Development of statistical models and implementation of predictive models with Python libraries such as Pandas, NumPy and scikit-learn or similar.
Experience with ETL processes (Extract, Transform, Load) and data pipelines an advantage.


Qualifikation


Degree in data science, information technology, business informatics or a related field (e.g. B.Sc. in Data Analytics, B.Sc. in International Economics & Management).
Practical experience in data analysis, data visualization and working with databases (SQL, NoSQL, Big Query).
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python, R and SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Excel.
Experience with graph-based databases such as Neo4j or tools for processing unstructured data (e.g. Apache Kafka) is a plus.
Familiarity with machine learning and statistics (e.g. time series analysis, regression models).
Strong analytical thinking skills and ability to solve complex data problems.
Experience working with diverse stakeholders and the ability to make complex technical concepts understandable to non-technical teams.
Language skills: Fluent in English (C1), basic knowledge of German (B1 an advantage).


Benefits


A responsible position in a growing company with a lot of creative freedom.
A dynamic and challenging working environment with the opportunity to work on exciting projects.
The opportunity to actively shape strategic decisions and support the company on its growth path.
A dynamic and motivated team, as well as short decision-making paths.
Attractive remuneration and development opportunities.
Training opportunities and support for professional development.


We look forward to receiving your complete application documents including your salary expectations and earliest possible starting date.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Customer Analytics (all genders)
Description:
You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando’s Markets organisation, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer analytics and customer segmentations we put our customers at the centre of every marketing and retail decision. As a Data Analyst in the Customer Analytics team, you will put customer data at the core of our decisions and processes.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED



You derive actionable customer insights and recommendations to fuel our Zalando business and the customer strategy. Your insights are derived from deep dive analysis you perform using a broad range of analytical methods and visualisations applied to data from various sources (transactional data, onsite data etc)
You proactively share your insights and recommendations in regular business reviews to senior management by providing compelling visualisations and stories. You seek opportunities to spread the insights beyond regular touchpoints with the aim of sourcing new business opportunities
You develop and optimise forecasting models for key customer metrics and provide expertise on current and expected trends for central planning efforts in close collaboration with our commercial planning teams
You drive analytical and data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members
You effectively collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers to untap new sources of data and know how



What We’re Looking For



5+ years of experience in using data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions incl. model driven statistical analysis. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Social Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related fields.
Proficient in data transformation and statistical computing in SQL and Python as well as strong skills in data visualisation. Basic experience in Google Analytics (BigQuery), MicroStrategy/Tableau, Airflow, Spark / DataBricks, and / or Github. Knowledge of basic time series forecasting techniques (SARIMAX, Prophet, Covariates) is considered a plus
Strong communication and visualisation skills and the ability to translate complex datasets into understandable and actionable insights and present to senior management in order to impact their decisions and strategy
Being curious and proactively creating insights while demonstrating end to end ownership of analytical projects. You innovate on new methodologies and datasets but also have a good sense when an pragmatic solution is sufficient
You are a role model and proved to be a mentor for junior to mid level team members



OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year (for Zalando SE)
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (d/m/w) - hybrides Arbeiten (Remote & Präsenz)
Description:
Akkodis - entstanden durch den Zusammenschluss von AKKA & Modis - ist ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Engineering & IT. Als globaler Partner in einer sich ständig verändernden Technologie- & Wettbewerbsumgebung unterstützen wir unsere Kunden mit unserem 360°-Angebot dabei, eine nachhaltigere & smartere Zukunft zu gestalten. Vereint durch unsere gemeinsame Leidenschaft für Technologie & Talente betrachten wir die Welt aus einem neuen Blickwinkel. Unsere 50.000 motivierten Ingenieur:innen & Digitalexpert:innen gehen dabei täglich über das Mögliche hinaus, um Unglaubliches zu schaffen

Sind Sie auf der Suche nach neuen und spannenden Herausforderungen? Dann beginnen Sie Ihre Karriere bei uns und werden Sie Teil eines unserer Kundenprojekte.

Ihre Aufgabenschwerpunkte



Extrahierung und Sammlung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, darunter Logdateien, Datenbanken und Monitoring-Tools
Bereinigung, Transformation und Standardisierung von Daten, um ihre Qualität und Konsistenz sicherzustellen
Automatisierung von Datenerfassungs- und Bereinigungsprozessen
Durchführung von Leistungsanalysen und Erstellung von Prognosemodellen
Entwicklung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Leistungsindikatoren, Sicherheitsmetriken und anderen relevanten Kennzahlen




Was Sie dafür mitbringen



Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Datenwissenschaft, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
Mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise im IT-Bereich
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Datenbankabfragesprachen wie SQL sowie Programmierkenntnisse in Python, R oder ähnlichen Sprachen
Erfahrung mit Tools und Technologien zur Datenvisualisierung, wie z.B. Tableau, Grafana oder Kibana
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Probleme zu lösen
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse




Warum Sie bei uns genau richtig sind



Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm




Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.

Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung. Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Ihr Kontakt Frau Maryana Dzhandarova

10789 Berlin

Title: Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Was du bei uns machst

Die Analyse und Strukturierung von Daten lässt dein Herz höher schlagen? Außerdem behälst du den Blick aufs große Ganze und weißt genau welche strategischen Empfehlungen den Kunden glücklich machen? Wenn du dazu noch eine Leidenschaft für Werbung hast und dich in einem lebendigen und kreativen Umfeld weiterentwickeln möchtest, bist du bei uns genau richtig!


Entwicklung und Pflege von Dashboards
Entwicklung und Erstellung von Reportings für Kunden
Erstellung von Audiences und Insights als Basis für Strategieausarbeitungen
Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen
Unterstützung bei der Erarbeitung von Kanalstrategien und strategischen Empfehlungen für Kunden im Bereich Datenanalyse/Reporting
Unterstützung der Kolleg*innen bei der Interpretation von Daten
Aufbau und Vorantreiben der Dateninfrastruktur des Teams


Was du mitbringst


Du hast bereits Berufserfahrung im Bereich Social Media in einer digitalen Agentur mit dem Schwerpunkt Datenanalyse gesammelt (Performance Agentur, Mediaagentur)
Du bringst Kenntnisse in der Social Media Analyse von Tools mit (zB Facebook Business Manager, Twitter Analytics, Instagram Analytics, Emplifi etc.), sowie Kenntnisse in der Visualisierung von Tools und Datenbanken (zB Tableau, Looker Studio, Power BI, IBM Kognos / SQL, MS SQL, P SQL)
Du hast bereits fundierte Erfahrung mit Web- und Marketing Analytics (zB Google Analytics, SAS, Salesforce, Adobe, Microsoft etc.)
Du besitzt fachliches Know How in Global Web Index oder Best4Planning
Besonders deine Erfahrungen mit Looker Studio und Supermetrics bringst du erfolgreich bei uns ein
Du besitzt die Fähigkeit Social Media KPIs und ihre Abhängigkeit zu verstehen (Paid und Organic) sowie das Verständnis, Erkenntnis in ansprechende und verständliche Darstellungen zu übertragen
Durch dein Verständnis für Prozesse der Social Media Datenerhebung und Darstellung bereicherst du das gesamte Team (Benchmarking, Index-Berechnung, Mittelwert, Lineare Regression, Box Plot und Skalenniveaus)


Wer wir sind

Gegründet 1981 in Hamburg, sind wir als eine der führenden Kreativ-Agenturen im deutschsprachigen Raum mittlerweile mit Standorten in Berlin, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt, Stuttgart, Zürich, Wien und Brüssel vertreten. Bei uns arbeiten rund 1.200 Kolleg*innen – wir nennen sie Friends – mit Leidenschaft und Kreativität für große und kleine Kunden aus allen Branchen.

Wie wir unsere Friendskultur leben

Alle Friends haben bei uns den Raum, sie selbst zu sein, zu lernen und zu wachsen. Du kannst innovative Ideen einbringen und groß werden lassen. Auf dich warten neue Herausforderungen und vielfältige Weiterbildungsangebote. Im Mittelpunkt stehen immer die Menschen und ein wertschätzendes Miteinander. Daher sind Vielfalt, Gleichberechtigung und Inklusion wesentlich in unserer Wertekultur und Managementstrategie. In unserer Academy und mit unseren Angeboten setzen wir auf Mental Health, Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf sowie einen großen Fokus auf Diversity-Impulse in Unconscious-Bias-Workshops, in Vorträgen oder innerhalb verschiedener Mitarbeitendennetzwerke (ERGs).

Was es oben drauf gibt


Wir ermöglichen ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell (zwei Office-Tage) und flexible Arbeitszeiten
Arbeiten aus dem EU-Ausland | bis zu 45 Tage
Discounts bei Dienstleistern und Fitnessstudios im Umkreis unserer Standorte
Vergünstigter Paketpreis von "Wellhub" für Sport-, Freizeit-, Wellness- oder App-Angebote
Möglichkeit der Mitgestaltung der Agenturkultur durch Round Tables und Mitarbeitendeninitiativen, wie z. B. unserer &Queer*-Community
Scholz & Friends Academy: offene Weiterbildungsangebote zu Fachthemen, Impulsgebungen, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging (D.E.I.B.) und vielem mehr
Mental-Health-Support in Kooperation mit unseren Partner*innen von Telus Health: u.a. Videositzungen mit Therapeut*innen und Psycholog*innen, zur Förderung der individuellen mentalen Gesundheit
Eltern-Kind-Service zur Förderung des familienfreundlichen Klimas am Arbeitsplatz und eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance mit unseren Partner*innen von voiio


Weitere Benefits an deinem Standort erfährst du im persönlichen Gespräch!

Verrate uns gerne, wie du angesprochen werden möchtest (Wunschname und Pronomen). Dann können wir dies im gesamten Prozess berücksichtigen.

 

Du willst vor deiner Bewerbung noch ein wenig mehr über uns erfahren oder hast Fragen zu Barrierefreiheit bei Scholz & Friends? Kein Problem! Schreib uns einfach eine Mail unter jobs@s-f.com. Wir freuen uns auf dich!

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Show more

Title: Digital Data Specialist
Description:
Your Role: As a Digital Data Specialist, you’ll be the architect behind our data-driven success story. You’ll be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting digital data to uncover actionable insights. From optimizing marketing campaigns to enhancing user experiences, your expertise will be instrumental in shaping our strategies and driving growth.

What You’ll Do:


Dive deep into digital data sources to extract meaningful insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into data requirements.
Develop and implement data collection strategies across various digital platforms.
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimization.
Create compelling data visualizations and reports to communicate findings effectively.
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to continuously innovate our data practices.


What We’re Looking For:


Passion for data-driven decision-making and problem-solving.
Strong analytical skills with a keen eye for detail.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Domo.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex ideas to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven track record of driving business impact through data insights.
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field (or equivalent experience).


Why Join Us:


Opportunity to work with a dynamic team of industry experts and thought leaders.
Flexible remote work environment, empowering you to balance work and life.
Ongoing learning and development opportunities to fuel your professional growth.
Competitive compensation package and benefits.
Show more

Title: Senior People Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Senior HR Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders) to join the People Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

About the People Analytics team:


Data Infrastructure & Architecture: We design and maintain the data warehouse (AWS or BigQuery), integrating new systems to enhance our analytic capabilities while ensuring data privacy compliance.
Reporting and Visualization: Define and standardize People KPIs across local teams, and deliver automated reporting solutions via Tableau or other BI tools for effective data visualization.
Advanced Analytics & Data Science: Discover and communicate meaningful patterns in people data, using analytics and data science models to provide actionable insights.
Purpose and Mission: Enable senior leaders to make data-driven decisions, enhance employee experience, and improve business performance through comprehensive data analysis.
Long-term Goals: Aim for global reporting of key metrics with high accuracy, simplify complex HR and business challenges, and integrate data insights into daily decision-making.
Collaborative Approach: Work closely with local People Analytics teams to align metrics and reporting standards, ensuring a unified approach to data management.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with People Analytics teams, CHROs, P&C leaders, People Partners, and Senior Leaders for strategic decision-making based on reliable data.
Value Addition: Harmonize data across global teams, creating a single source of truth for reliable and consistent leadership decisions.


About the role:


Data Warehouse Management: Design, build, and maintain the architecture and infrastructure of our data warehouse, ensuring system integration and data compliance.
KPI Standardization: Define and align People KPIs across local teams, and implement automated reporting solutions for streamlined data visualization and analysis.
Analytics and Insights: Use advanced analytics to uncover meaningful patterns in people data, and develop data science models that provide actionable insights.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Gather requirements from CHROs and other stakeholders, translate these into actionable plans, and serve as the primary contact for people data.
Global Reporting: Collaborate with local teams for global reporting of key metrics, ensuring a unified and reliable data source for strategic decisions.
Training and Adoption: Provide training and support to drive the adoption of new BI tools and reporting practices, enhancing overall data literacy and user experience.


What you need to be successful


Background working in similar People/HR data-driven role (3+ years of experience, a must)
Advanced SQL and knowledge about data pipelines
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or other technical fields
Proven, direct experience with Tableau and demonstrate storytelling capabilities
Data visualization artist, able to create new and engaging ways of visualizing People data


Nice to have:


Worked in cross functional teams and can manage senior stakeholders
Fundamental understanding of statistics and basic principles of data analysis


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Online Canteen, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
At Neople we're looking for a Lead Data Analyst to join our team.

At Neople we're driven by our passion and experience in AI. We believe that AI can do lots of good, but we know it must be user-friendly in order to be widely adopted.

Our shared goal is to make it super easy for people to access helpful AI assistants in the workplace. That's why we're creating the most user-friendly digital co-workers powered by AI. More than 60 leading companies (like Levi’s, PSV, Rituals and Bax Music) have already hired a Neople to their team!

We’re growing fast and that’s why we’re looking for a new (human) colleague to join our stellar team! We're on the search for a highly motivated and resourceful Lead Data Analyst. If you’re fascinated by cutting edge AI systems, love to convert data insights into action, and you’re ready for the start-up adventure - we want to hear from you.

This can be your once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to join one the fastest growing start-ups in one of the most exciting fields to work in.

The team

We believe the people you work with are what make a job amazing. In this role you’ll be part of the Product team with Seyna (Head of Product) and Joep (CPO). You’ll work closely together with Koen, Stefan and Tom (AI Engineers), and of course with all data-consuming stakeholders in the rest of the company!

The Neople team is best described as open, ambitious, highly skilled, friendly and if you ask us - also really fun. At Neople we're driven by our passion and our core values: Eager to learn, Collegial, Trust, and Character. While those values define how we work together as humans, we’re also committed to creating digital co-workers that align with the same values.

The job

The Lead Data Analyst role at Neople is the first dedicated analytics role in the company (the work is currently being done by both AI Engineers and the Product team). That means the role combines data analytics, data engineering, and some data science skills - anything needed to get the insights we require.

As a Lead Data Analyst, you understand exactly how our Neople work and what defines their performance. By proactively working with stakeholders and gathering insights, you enable a data-driven way of working across the entire team.

Key Responsibilities


Own the data analytics function: proactively map out information needs, and provide visualizations to satisfy those needs
Own cross-functional data needs in the organization, and provide guidance to other teams on how to best utilize the data we have
Challenge data requests to understand the exact need, and whether or not a new insight is even required
Build the data infrastructure: make and update data engineering pipelines in our data warehouse, and define standard definitions to ensure consistency
Provide input to the product & tech team on opportunities to improve Neople performance


The Requirements


5+ years of experience in a similar role (e.g. Data analyst/engineer, BI engineer) in a start-up and/or SaaS environment
Technical skills: experienced with SQL, data engineering pipelines, data visualization, Python notebooks
Experience with conversational AI and LLM prompting
You have a strong belief in data-driven ways of working, and are willing to enable the organization on a path to become more data-driven
You can translate business- and customer goals into measurable metrics and clear visual insights
You don’t just execute, but you dig deep with stakeholders to understand the need for a specific insight
You’re a solution-oriented problem solver and don’t shy away from a challenge to investigate and resolve topics
You take a proactive role in defining metrics & improving observability of a Neople’s underlying systems
You’re constantly looking for opportunities to accelerate or automate your own work


Nice To Haves


Apart from working with data pipelines and creating them, experience with managing & administering a data warehouse


The offer


A competitive salary that matches market standards and matches your experience
Unlimited vacation
Opportunity to work in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment
Collaborative culture with a supportive team, and loads of team events
A work week of 32-40 hours a week
Beautiful offices in the center of Amsterdam, Den Bosch, or Berlin, and a public transport card to get there
Great equipment to work with i.e. MacBook
A competitive equity package


Interested?
Show more
HTML:
At Neople we're looking for a Lead Data Analyst to join our team.

At Neople we're driven by our passion and experience in AI. We believe that AI can do lots of good, but we know it must be user-friendly in order to be widely adopted.

Our shared goal is to make it super easy for people to access helpful AI assistants in the workplace. That's why we're creating the most user-friendly digital co-workers powered by AI. More than 60 leading companies (like Levi’s, PSV, Rituals and Bax Music) have already hired a Neople to their team!

We’re growing fast and that’s why we’re looking for a new (human) colleague to join our stellar team! We're on the search for a highly motivated and resourceful Lead Data Analyst. If you’re fascinated by cutting edge AI systems, love to convert data insights into action, and you’re ready for the start-up adventure - we want to hear from you.

This can be your once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to join one the fastest growing start-ups in one of the most exciting fields to work in.

The team

We believe the people you work with are what make a job amazing. In this role you’ll be part of the Product team with Seyna (Head of Product) and Joep (CPO). You’ll work closely together with Koen, Stefan and Tom (AI Engineers), and of course with all data-consuming stakeholders in the rest of the company!

The Neople team is best described as open, ambitious, highly skilled, friendly and if you ask us - also really fun. At Neople we're driven by our passion and our core values: Eager to learn, Collegial, Trust, and Character. While those values define how we work together as humans, we’re also committed to creating digital co-workers that align with the same values.

The job

The Lead Data Analyst role at Neople is the first dedicated analytics role in the company (the work is currently being done by both AI Engineers and the Product team). That means the role combines data analytics, data engineering, and some data science skills - anything needed to get the insights we require.

As a Lead Data Analyst, you understand exactly how our Neople work and what defines their performance. By proactively working with stakeholders and gathering insights, you enable a data-driven way of working across the entire team.

Key Responsibilities

  • Own the data analytics function: proactively map out information needs, and provide visualizations to satisfy those needs
  • Own cross-functional data needs in the organization, and provide guidance to other teams on how to best utilize the data we have
  • Challenge data requests to understand the exact need, and whether or not a new insight is even required
  • Build the data infrastructure: make and update data engineering pipelines in our data warehouse, and define standard definitions to ensure consistency
  • Provide input to the product & tech team on opportunities to improve Neople performance

The Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience in a similar role (e.g. Data analyst/engineer, BI engineer) in a start-up and/or SaaS environment
  • Technical skills: experienced with SQL, data engineering pipelines, data visualization, Python notebooks
  • Experience with conversational AI and LLM prompting
  • You have a strong belief in data-driven ways of working, and are willing to enable the organization on a path to become more data-driven
  • You can translate business- and customer goals into measurable metrics and clear visual insights
  • You don’t just execute, but you dig deep with stakeholders to understand the need for a specific insight
  • You’re a solution-oriented problem solver and don’t shy away from a challenge to investigate and resolve topics
  • You take a proactive role in defining metrics & improving observability of a Neople’s underlying systems
  • You’re constantly looking for opportunities to accelerate or automate your own work

Nice To Haves

  • Apart from working with data pipelines and creating them, experience with managing & administering a data warehouse

The offer

  • A competitive salary that matches market standards and matches your experience
  • Unlimited vacation
  • Opportunity to work in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment
  • Collaborative culture with a supportive team, and loads of team events
  • A work week of 32-40 hours a week
  • Beautiful offices in the center of Amsterdam, Den Bosch, or Berlin, and a public transport card to get there
  • Great equipment to work with i.e. MacBook
  • A competitive equity package

Interested?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role

At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants). Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What you'll be doing



Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Analytics Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries



Requirements



Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)



Why Deliveroo

Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Workplace & Benefits

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.

Diversity

At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will make every effort to provide the necessary adjustments to ensure you have an equitable opportunity to succeed.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are 🩵

We’re the people behind global loyalty currency, Avios, and home to three ambitious, growing businesses; Loyalty, Holidays and Retail. Each business has its own goals, strategy and team, but collectively we share a purpose to create the world’s most rewarding experiences for our customers through loyalty programmes, new products and holidays. Get the full IAG Loyalty lowdown, here.

We’re on a truly exciting journey of growth and transformation – we’re going places! It means we have a fantastic story to tell our people and the rest of the world. This is where you come in.

The opportunity ✨

You’ll be joining our Data Products team and working closely with teams that are aligned to value streams. Our team exists to drive success across Commercial, Customer, Finance and Product domains. We’re on a mission to make our data available and usable in one place by delivering powerful data solutions that optimise performance and supercharge decision-making.

The Data Analyst will be collaborating with our Customer domain colleagues, delivering insightful analytics which will bring the customer to the centre of IAG Loyalty’s strategy helping us to achieve our objectives and gain competitor advantage. This will include analysis on understanding and predicting Customer behaviour, helping the organisation to understand what drives customer loyalty, satisfaction and profitability and transforming such information into actionable insights which you will share through great storytelling and visualisation. As such, your contribution will influence the internal decision-making processes, ensuring the company invests in the right things to improve customer engagement and you’ll influence the future of how we approach data, working with our Data Product Owners and Tech Leads as we migrate to the likes of Snowflake.

You’ll be an individual contributor, playing a role within your team as well as the wider Analytics community. You’ll play an important part in driving the right decisions to support growth across our business.

What you’ll get up to 🌠


Performing analysis on different customer behaviours, through coding and applying data analysis techniques to uncover opportunities to enhance our partnerships.
Define and develop key descriptive and predictive customer metrics and models to ensure the long-term success of the business, such as Penetration, Customer Lifetime Value, and Churn
Turning business requirements into data solutions that are high-quality through solid collaboration with colleagues in the team and across our stakeholder domains.
Empower IAG Loyalty colleagues with self-serve capabilities, by developing behavioural data customer dashboards
Communicating effectively – being able to articulate actionable insights in a simple and effective manner to the wider customer teams.
Sharing learnings across the Data domain.


What we need from you 💡


Experience taking a problem from ideation through to solution that’s supports business outcomes.
Hands on with writing SQL queries for data analysis and reporting.
Experience of python
Experience of analysing large datasets.
Experience in telling stories with data, with the ability to create visualisation to bring it to life - Tableau or equivalent visualisation tool experience.
An analytical mind, who is keen to solve problems and who focuses on progress to get things into our colleagues’ hands sooner.
Worked with agility in mind, in an environment where you break work down and focus on delivering iteratively.


What you’ll get in return 🤝

A few to spark your interest below, and you’ll find even more on our career site.


A place to grow your career: We’re home to three businesses under one roof and part of one of the world’s leading airline groups (International Airlines Group), so the opportunities here, if you go after them, are endless. Our newly launched learning programme, ‘Develop You’, will also give you the skills and capability to take your career to new heights.
A place to belong: Our socials are a firm fave in the calendar, and our colleague-led networks and Equity, Diversity and Inclusion agenda will give you the platforms to make new connections, share your passions and your voice.
A place to make your mark: Our focus on agility and continuous improvement is a mindset and way of working. We put the customer at the heart of our decisions and move fast so you can deliver the most value possible.
A place to do things that matter: We’re passionate about the part we play in our customers lives; helping them make memories that last a lifetime, as well as the work we do to give back to our local communities. Our thriving charity network, combined with work that impacts millions, means we’re a place you can do your part.


Perks that take you places: ✈️


One non-contractual Annual Bookable Travel Concession for you, your partner and dependants after 12 months service and unlimited standby and premium standby fares for you and your nominees on the full British Airways network and numerous other partner airlines from day one
20 days working from abroad in Europe per annum. 
Annual Bonus (dependant on company and individual performance)
Company pension of 9% (6% contribution from IAGL, 3% employee contribution) 
25 days annual leave, + 2 days charity leave and a day off on your birthday
New joiner, birthday and recognition Avios


We Might Not Be Right For You If


You value perfection over fast iteration and progress; IAG Loyalty moves fast, we learn and iterate as we go; our environment isn't right for everyone.
You prefer to operate in a fully established function with a set remit. This is a broad role where you have your hands on multiple levers and offers you the ability to shape it as you feel best, so it does mean you'll encounter some ambiguity as you build our creative capability


If you think you have what it takes but don't meet every single point above, please do still apply. We'd love to chat and see if you could be a great fit.

This role will be based out of our London office (WeWork Victoria). We have a flexible working policy where a blended approach is encouraged, with the focus on being in the correct location for the work that needs to be undertaken. This will involve a mix of office and home working.

Equity, Diversity and Inclusion at IAG Loyalty

Our vision, 'to create the world's most rewarding experiences,' applies not only to our customers but for our colleagues too. It's about taking belonging seriously, actively fostering a culture where everyone feels welcomed and valued by embracing diverse identities, personal histories, and perspectives.

This commitment makes IAG Loyalty a rewarding place to work and enhances our ability to solve complex problems, drive innovation, and better serve our customers and communities.

Please let us know if we can make any reasonable adjustments to support your interview process with us.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Bauer Media Audio

London - Hybrid (1-2 times per month)




Sadly we are not able to sponsor candidates




Bauer Media Audio is leading the charge in transforming our digital business, scaling innovative products and services across 9 dynamic territories. We're excited to announce the formation of our Centre of Excellence (CoE) within the Audio Data Organisation, and we are searching for passionate, driven individuals to join us. Be a key player in this pivotal transformation as we evolve our data architecture and engineering solutions, supporting high value implementations for future platforms. Our mission? To enhance user experience, engagement, competitions, and commercial ventures.




The role:

As a Data Analyst at Bauer Media Audio, you will play a crucial role in supporting our Marketing, Commercial, and Product teams by enabling them to use data effectively. Your primary focus will be on the Competitions, CRM, Ad, and Finance data domains, acting as the bridge between business needs and the central data organization. You will empower local teams to make actionable decisions based on data insights, ensuring data-driven strategies and operations.




Key Aspects of the role:

Act as a liaison between the business units and the central data organization to ensure data solutions meet business needs.
Gather and refine business requirements for data projects and communicate them effectively to the central data team.
Ensure data quality and consistency across different data sources and domains.







Tech stack:

Expert in SQL (Postgres, Cloud SQL).
Proficient in Python for data processing and analysis.
Skilled in data segmentation and analysis.
Experience with data segmentation, data analysis, and developing insightful reports.
Confident with BI Platforms like Looker or Power BI.
Experience with web analytics technologies such as Google Analytics (GA4 or UA360) / Firebase
Experience in developing and maintaining dashboards and reports.
Strong problem-solving skills and a flexible attitude to managing projects and engaging with senior stakeholders.







Why Join Us?

Exciting Projects:

Dive into diverse datasets that reveal the journey of our consumers as they interact with our apps, websites, and smart devices. Your work will help define and enhance the relevance and timeliness of our products, services, and messaging.




Innovative Environment:

With recent launches like Rayo in the UK, the expansion of our SMS and Competitions business, and ongoing development, there’s always something new and exciting on the horizon.




Expertise and Growth:

Our team has access to cutting-edge data, events, and analytics, offering a golden opportunity for you to become an expert and take ownership of the platforms, products, and services you help shape. Be a Part of Something Bigger Join us and be at the heart of the digital transformation at Bauer Media Audio. Together, we’ll craft compelling stories and create impactful experiences for our audience. Don’t miss out on the chance to make a significant impact and grow with us.




We’d love to hear from you of you bring the following qualities:

• Challenger Mindset: Thrive in a dynamic environment, always seeking out new challenges and opportunities for growth.

• Team Player: Excellent communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively across multiple topics and stakeholders.

• Independent Worker: Self-motivated and capable of working autonomously, driving projects from conception to completion.




Be part of an innovative team that’s transforming the digital landscape of audio media. If you're ready to take on a challenge and grow your career in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you.




Join Bauer Media Audio and help us shape the future of digital audio!

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Inspired Education is the leading global group of premium schools, with a portfolio of over 116 premium private schools spanning six continents which utilise proven educational practices from every corner of the globe, ensuring over 90,000 students receive a world-class learning experience from Kindergarten to Year 13.

Founded in 2013 by Nadim M. Nsouli, Inspired is backed by investors such as Stonepeak, GIC, TA Associates, and the Oppenheimer and Mansour family offices. The Group is experiencing 20% per annum growth through acquisition, greenfield site expansion, and the development of existing schools within its portfolio. In 2023, Inspired was recognised by Beauhurst as one of the UK's top 10 highest-value private companies.

ROLE SUMMARY:

Inspired is seeking to appoint a Junior Data Analyst to join us as soon as possible on a permanent basis.

“Inspiring Academic Excellence Across 5 Continents”

A definitive statement of excellence in private education, Inspired is a co-educational, non- denominational, independent school group designed to inspire students to achieve their maximum potential in a nurturing, progressive academic environment from ages 3 months to 18 yrs.

Inspired offers a fresh and contemporary approach to education by re-evaluating traditional teaching methods and curriculums, and creating a more dynamic, relevant and powerful model reflecting current attitudes. We nurture the unique individuality, talent and self-assurance of each student, equipping them to take on the world with the skills and confidence to ensure success.

Our current portfolio of 110+ schools currently operate across Europe, Asia-Pacific, Africa, the Middle East and Latin America, with quick ongoing expansion foreseen. The group has grown exponentially since its founding 10 years ago and offers a unique opportunity to join a connected global community obsessed with a dedication to excellence.

We take great care when selecting new colleagues to join Inspired Education and hand pick every single role. We believe true excellence in education is only achieved through an inspiring and passionate team with whom are dedicated to supporting our schools to recruit and retain students by sustaining engaging and inspiring learning environments through our 3 pillars of: Performing and Creative Arts; Academics and Sport.

Professionalism, responsive teaching, specialist knowledge, strong planning, excellent qualifications, and an outstanding personal reputation, are just few of the core requirements we look for when recruiting Inspired teaching staff.

For more information about us, please visit Inspired Schools - Premium Private Education (inspirededu.com)

The Role/Purpose

Working alongside our Head of Data & Analytics, you will be a key member of the data team focused on delivering and enhancing the data solutions across our organisation. You will be confident with querying data using SQL to investigate and resolve our data challenges.

You will identify opportunities to drive incremental revenue which impacts the customer journey and work on improving measurement and reporting across all enrolment and marketing functions. The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated, results-oriented individual, with strong analytical aptitude and problem-solving skills to join our global team.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Qualifications & Technical Skills


A proven track record of querying & resolving data inaccuracies and challenges using SQL & T-SQL including joins, sub-selects & aggregation
Strong understanding of relational database concepts & data normalisation
Knowledge of PowerBI dashboard building and DAX is a bonus
Strong time management skills to ensure effective on time delivery of tasks


Data Analysis & Management


Undertake data analysis to maintain accurate data in all school systems, enabling responsive decision-making through the enrolment pipeline, recruitment events and accurate forecasting during annual planning
Support the Data, Admissions and Finance teams where needed to ensure data is defined, structured and accessible in a way that provides actionable insights to stakeholders
Partner with our data engineers to identify and solve data quality issues, database cleansing, segmentation, enrichment, and acquisition initiatives


Performance Marketing & Automation


Partner with the global customer experience team, CRM, and marketing teams, to ensure accuracy of data across our acquisition funnels
Evolve the web, social, media, and analytics work, developing areas such as journey analytics, digital effectiveness, and attribution


Stakeholder communication


Work in partnership with the finance, admissions, marketing and local teams to query and resolve data challenges and initiatives
Support admissions teams, ensuring they have the knowledge, training, and expertise to deliver accurate and effective enrolment reports


THE IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:


Highly organised with strong attention to detail, ensuring clarity and accuracy
Analytical and data driven thinker
Strong time-management skills with ability to manage competing priorities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent critical thinking and analysis skills
Creativity, flexibility, and adaptability
Confident problem solver
Professional demeanor


Key Relationships:

Internal:


Engineering team
CRM team
Regional marketing teams
Finance
Digital team


External


Analytics agency
Technology providers


Visit our careers site for more information; https://jobs.inspirededu.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us




Covering more trades than anyone else, Aspect is one of London’s largest property maintenance teams. We’re always ready to help, no matter what maintenance issue someone has, operating 24/7. After over 15 years of helping thousands of residential and commercial customers every month, we have ambitious plans to expand our business over the next 3 years. We’re looking for ambitious people to join us at this exciting time.




The Role




The Data Analyst will play a key role in supporting our business through data-driven insights and solutions. You’ll be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data from multiple sources to help drive decision-making across various departments.

You will:




Use tools like SQL, Python, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, and Salesforce to gather and analyze data.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs), operational efficiency, and customer trends.
Collaborate with teams across the business to identify areas for improvement, optimize processes, and support business growth.
Conduct detailed data analysis, including data mining, trend analysis, and predictive analytics to inform business decisions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all systems, implementing data quality checks and working with different departments to maintain consistent and accurate data inputs.
Provide actionable insights through visualizations and presentations, making complex data understandable for non-technical stakeholders.




This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a strong analytical background and experience in leveraging data tools to support strategic decision-making in a fast-paced environment.




About You




To excel in this role, you should have strong technical skills, a passion for data, and the ability to turn numbers into actionable business insights. Key qualifications include:

2+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with Python for data analysis and automation of tasks.
Strong skills in data visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau to create dynamic, interactive reports.
Familiarity with Salesforce CRM or similar platforms to analyze customer and sales data.
Advanced Excel skills for data modeling, forecasting, and reporting.
Excellent problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and a strong understanding of data governance principles.
Strong communication skills with the ability to explain complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Knowledge of the property maintenance or service industry is a plus but not required.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Data Analyst

Location: London

Reporting to: Head of Claims Analytics

Direct Reports: None

Working Arrangements: Full-time Hybrid

Who We Are

SiriusPoint is a global underwriter of insurance and reinsurance. We utilize deep risk capabilities to protect our customers SiriusPoint is a global underwriter of insurance and reinsurance. We utilize deep risk capabilities to protect our customers and provide intelligent risk solutions to clients and brokers around the world. Bermuda-headquartered and listed on the New York Stock Exchange (SPNT), we work as ‘One SiriusPoint’, to apply expertise and underwrite risks across our four operational areas - International Insurance, North American Insurance, Global Accident and Health, and Global Reinsurance.

We have underwriting hubs in Bermuda, Liège, London, New York, Stockholm and Zurich, and licenses to write Property & Casualty and Accident & Health insurance and reinsurance globally.

Join Our Team

You will be Data Analyst. You will report to the Head of Claims Analytics with reporting lines to the Chief Legacy Officer.

The Data Analyst is responsible for sourcing, organizing, cleansing and optimizing data to help drive strategic decisions and work activities for the Claims & Legacy team. This role requires working with multiple sources of data to meet both internal reporting requirements and support new initiatives.

Responsibilities:


Creation, configuration and administration of analytic tools, the development and use of databases, data marts, reports, dashboards and the interpretation of data and analysis results using statistical techniques.
Provide essential data support and analysis for various business initiatives.
Research, analyse, validate, and prepare data for use in monitoring and reporting, strategy support, and special projects.
Projects range from simple programming and basic data manipulation/analysis to more advanced techniques and analytics.
Access data, write queries, create dashboards, run reports, manipulate, and analyse large datasets to meet the needs of the organization.
Presenting analytical findings in a variety of formats (reports, PowerPoint, Tableau, graphs, figures, and tables), formulating recommendations, and effectively present results to non-analytic audiences.


Technical Skill And Qualifications


Master's degree in business, analytics, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field. Master's degree in analytics, data science or related field preferred.
Work experience in actuarial and financial data analysis or business intelligence experience.
Programming skills such as SQL, R, Python, Tableau and similar are necessary for this role.
Broad knowledge of data warehouses, data marts and business intelligence solutions is preferred
Demonstrated experience in analytical problem solving (including statement of problem, identification and collection of pertinent data, analysis, recommendation, and revaluation) strongly preferred.
Ability to work independently on multiple concurrent cross-border projects within team setting to achieve outcomes.
Must possess strong ability to perform route cause analysis and communicate findings in actionable manner.
Strong analytical thinking to breakdown complex problems and a strong will to get things done and deliver accurate results.
Problem solver, detail oriented and strong analytical skills required.
Ability to engage with stakeholders to understand and respond to their needs.
Experience with analytics reporting and data interpretation/presentation.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications Skills required.


Why should you join SiriusPoint?

Our people are our experts, and from day one you will be empowered to apply your expertise in a supportive, collaborative and purposeful environment. Our Values - Integrity, Customer Focused, Solution Driven, Diversity, and Collaboration are at the heart of our business, and they guide our everyday actions and decision making. We also unite our global team behind common goals, ensuring you can make a meaningful impact.

We Achieve More Together

At SiriusPoint, we know that diversity, inclusion and allyship make us stronger. We value and are committed to supporting the unique voices, backgrounds, cultures, lifestyles and contributions of the diverse global employee base that make up our business.

We know that a diverse and equitable culture, where all voices are included and heard, is critical to our success as an employer. We are committed to developing our DE&I strategy to ensure that SiriusPoint remains a supportive and empowering place of work.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Data & BI

Location: Head Office

Description

In 2024 we're transforming Pasta Evangelists into a truly data-driven organisation.

In a fast-paced industry, a 'Best In Class' BI team will be crucial if we are to grow as quickly in the next 3 years, as we have in the previous 3.

Having invested heavily in consolidating data across all aspects of our business and rebuilt our Power BI reporting suite for all verticals(Takeaway, E-Commerce, and e-retail), we now have a strong foundation to surface the insights to drive growth.

What you'll do at Pasta Evangelists:


Integrate with our new ERP system and build the data pipelines needed to automate P&L reporting.
Own and optimise our Takeaway PPC and Marketing Offer strategy to grow order volume.
Enhance our modelling to identify the optimal locations for additional restaurants across the UK.
Evolve the models to improve the accuracy of order forecasting across the business.
Support Finance and Commercial with pricing and basket value optimization.
Grow our data-driven culture and coach stakeholders on how to surface the insights they need to drive day-to-day operations.
Analyse customer feedback on our products and recommend changes to our Food NPD team.
Continue to develop clear, concise, and insightful reporting and data models that will allow our stakeholders to self-serve.
For a candidate to succeed in this role, they must be able to produce insights, in addition to building the dashboards.
Support the design and development of new data warehousing.
Collaborate with co-workers and management to implement operational improvements.


Who you are:


Computer Science, Finance, Business graduate or similar.
Highly competent with Power BI and DAX
Strong SQL and Excel
Clear communication and attention to detail is crucial
Ability to multi-task and to coordinate a series of different jobs concurrently
Can articulate insights from a complex solution, simply and coherently.
You love working in a start-up team!
... A pasta lover!


What we can offer:


Competitive salary to attract the best talent
Join a dynamic, fast-moving & diverse team
Regular team socials and pasta tastings, as well as occasional trips to 'il bel paese'
Free Pasta Evangelists products
Cycle to work scheme
25 days of paid annual leave (plus bank holidays)
Show more

Title: TikTok LIVE Data Analyst
Description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touchpoints to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions
