Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst



Salary: £65,000 - £75,000



Location: London - 3 days per week



Data Idols is working with a scale-up and industry disruptor in the world of warehouse-to-doorstep delivery services. This is a great time to join this organisation as they continue to build their presence in the UK with global expansion on their roadmap.


As a Senior Data Analyst joining the team, you will have strong communication skills and a proactive attitude to help the operational team make decisions and make sure they always know how the business is performing.






The Opportunity



Working with the operational teams this is an opportunity to grow your career working with talented people.

You will work to inform, automate and optimise the decision-making using data and advanced analytics.

This position will help the operational teams dig into the data to optimise and improve a number of interesting data challenges.





What's in it for you?


£65,000 - £75,000


Skills and Experience


Strong SQL inclduing advance techniques such as subqueries, mulitple joins, aggregations, etc.
Python
Excellent communication skills
Creating dashboards to share and present to stakeholders

If you would like to be considered for the role and feel you would be an ideal fit with our team then please send your CV to us by clicking on the Apply button below.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
This is a fantastic opportunity at a progressive and successful media agency where you will provide support to the ARMLabs team and media planning and buying teams at All Response Media by way of data wrangling, analysis and basic econometrics. 

You will be joining a passionate and supportive team of economists who crave answers, enjoy learning, and thrive off working on multiple tasks and projects ranging from data extraction through SQL/Snowflake to analysing the impact of advertising campaigns using time series econometrics models. 

This a is great opportunity for newcomers to the data analytics world. You will be trained by the senior members of the team, who will soft manage you on a day-to-day basis, but you will report to the head of data science.

A BSc in Maths, Statistics or Econometrics, or successful completion of a level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship is required to be considered for this role.

About The Company

All Response Media is Europe’s leading performance media agency, providing clients with an “Unfair Competitive Advantage” since 1995, with offices in London, Leeds and Amsterdam

We are progressive, dynamic and a rewarding company where you can develop your skills and build a long-term career in advertising, as part of a highly talented and driven team of over 150 professionals. As a growing agency, you will be a part of a fast-paced, exciting and social company culture that truly enriches employee careers. We show a great level of passion and care for all we do, and our leaders appreciate that embedding a strong team culture is important to the success of ARM. As such, we are passionate about developing strong leaders from within the business.

We provide industry-leading media performance to a growing global client base and partner with some of the most innovative and established businesses to continue our mission to disrupt and innovate the advertising industry. Our success is achieved through the success of our clients, and we do this by cultivating strong working relationships through collaboration, innovation and integration which drives engagement, helping them build strong brands and performance.

We plan and buy across all media channels, on and offline. Our bespoke campaign measurement suite, ARMalytics®, gives us a competitive advantage and is at the core of our model, underpinning the data-led operations of our integrated client business teams and ARMlabs data and systems unit. We actively encourage integration across the agency, therefore those who join us soon find that they have a wealth of knowledge across all marketing disciplines.

Your key responsibilities will include:


Access, investigate and extract data as needed (using Snowflake and SQL)
Manipulate data (format, remove and add data and tables)
Test data for completeness and correctness
Format client reports and data extracts (mainly in Excel and R)
Create own visualisation and dashboards and maintenance of dashboards
Manage the log of weekly requests from the ARM teams
Provide web tag data to ARM teams
Assist ARM team with queries regarding the bespoke ARM RAPS system
Assist ARM teams with client setup and configuration on the RAPS system
Analyse Direct Response advertising effectiveness
Compile and report on competitor insights
Run simple econometric regressions in R
Econometrics modelling to answer questions about the effect of advertising
Maintain GDPR compliance with regards to handling of first- and third-party data
Assist with finding innovative ways to systemise and streamline processes 


Requirements


BSc in Maths, Statistics or Econometrics, or level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship.
Basic data manipulation skills in Excel/R (or Python)
Basic timeseries econometric regressions experience (Python/R/etc.)
Advanced MS Excel Skills (VLOOKUP's, etc.)
Strong number orientation through abilities in maths, accounting, statistics.
Good communication skills
Good story telling with data skills
MS SQL 2012+ experience (preferred)
Media experience (preferred)
Eligible to work in the UK


Benefits


Competitive salary and bonus
25 days annual leave + bank holidays
Annual company away day and socials - we're all about the socials!
Daily drinks fridge, free fruits, breakfast on Mondays and lunch on Fridays
Private healthcare with Vitality (50% off at Virgin Gyms!) and eye test
Flexi Fridays and time off on your birthday
Long term service rewards up to £10k and sabbaticals to travel the globe!
Life cover 4x your annual salary, enhanced sick pay, income protection
Perkbox and Wellbeing programme
Season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme
Media, technical and managerial training, including LinkedIn Learning!
Progression and development


Accelerate and fast-track your career with All Response Media.
Show more

You will be joining a passionate and supportive team of economists who crave answers, enjoy learning, and thrive off working on multiple tasks and projects ranging from data extraction through SQL/Snowflake to analysing the impact of advertising campaigns using time series econometrics models. 

This a is great opportunity for newcomers to the data analytics world. You will be trained by the senior members of the team, who will soft manage you on a day-to-day basis, but you will report to the head of data science.

A BSc in Maths, Statistics or Econometrics, or successful completion of a level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship is required to be considered for this role.

About The Company

All Response Media is Europe’s leading performance media agency, providing clients with an “Unfair Competitive Advantage” since 1995, with offices in London, Leeds and Amsterdam

We are progressive, dynamic and a rewarding company where you can develop your skills and build a long-term career in advertising, as part of a highly talented and driven team of over 150 professionals. As a growing agency, you will be a part of a fast-paced, exciting and social company culture that truly enriches employee careers. We show a great level of passion and care for all we do, and our leaders appreciate that embedding a strong team culture is important to the success of ARM. As such, we are passionate about developing strong leaders from within the business.

We provide industry-leading media performance to a growing global client base and partner with some of the most innovative and established businesses to continue our mission to disrupt and innovate the advertising industry. Our success is achieved through the success of our clients, and we do this by cultivating strong working relationships through collaboration, innovation and integration which drives engagement, helping them build strong brands and performance.

We plan and buy across all media channels, on and offline. Our bespoke campaign measurement suite, ARMalytics®, gives us a competitive advantage and is at the core of our model, underpinning the data-led operations of our integrated client business teams and ARMlabs data and systems unit. We actively encourage integration across the agency, therefore those who join us soon find that they have a wealth of knowledge across all marketing disciplines.

Your key responsibilities will include:

  • Access, investigate and extract data as needed (using Snowflake and SQL)
  • Manipulate data (format, remove and add data and tables)
  • Test data for completeness and correctness
  • Format client reports and data extracts (mainly in Excel and R)
  • Create own visualisation and dashboards and maintenance of dashboards
  • Manage the log of weekly requests from the ARM teams
  • Provide web tag data to ARM teams
  • Assist ARM team with queries regarding the bespoke ARM RAPS system
  • Assist ARM teams with client setup and configuration on the RAPS system
  • Analyse Direct Response advertising effectiveness
  • Compile and report on competitor insights
  • Run simple econometric regressions in R
  • Econometrics modelling to answer questions about the effect of advertising
  • Maintain GDPR compliance with regards to handling of first- and third-party data
  • Assist with finding innovative ways to systemise and streamline processes 

Requirements

  • BSc in Maths, Statistics or Econometrics, or level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship.
  • Basic data manipulation skills in Excel/R (or Python)
  • Basic timeseries econometric regressions experience (Python/R/etc.)
  • Advanced MS Excel Skills (VLOOKUP's, etc.)
  • Strong number orientation through abilities in maths, accounting, statistics.
  • Good communication skills
  • Good story telling with data skills
  • MS SQL 2012+ experience (preferred)
  • Media experience (preferred)
  • Eligible to work in the UK

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and bonus
  • 25 days annual leave + bank holidays
  • Annual company away day and socials - we're all about the socials!
  • Daily drinks fridge, free fruits, breakfast on Mondays and lunch on Fridays
  • Private healthcare with Vitality (50% off at Virgin Gyms!) and eye test
  • Flexi Fridays and time off on your birthday
  • Long term service rewards up to £10k and sabbaticals to travel the globe!
  • Life cover 4x your annual salary, enhanced sick pay, income protection
  • Perkbox and Wellbeing programme
  • Season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme
  • Media, technical and managerial training, including LinkedIn Learning!
  • Progression and development

Accelerate and fast-track your career with All Response Media.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Data Analyst

Location: London

Reporting to: Head of Claims Analytics

Direct Reports: None

Working Arrangements: Full-time Hybrid

Who We Are

SiriusPoint is a global underwriter of insurance and reinsurance. We utilize deep risk capabilities to protect our customers SiriusPoint is a global underwriter of insurance and reinsurance. We utilize deep risk capabilities to protect our customers and provide intelligent risk solutions to clients and brokers around the world. Bermuda-headquartered and listed on the New York Stock Exchange (SPNT), we work as ‘One SiriusPoint’, to apply expertise and underwrite risks across our four operational areas - International Insurance, North American Insurance, Global Accident and Health, and Global Reinsurance.

We have underwriting hubs in Bermuda, Liège, London, New York, Stockholm and Zurich, and licenses to write Property & Casualty and Accident & Health insurance and reinsurance globally.

Join Our Team

You will be Data Analyst. You will report to the Head of Claims Analytics with reporting lines to the Chief Legacy Officer.

The Data Analyst is responsible for sourcing, organizing, cleansing and optimizing data to help drive strategic decisions and work activities for the Claims & Legacy team. This role requires working with multiple sources of data to meet both internal reporting requirements and support new initiatives.

Responsibilities:


Creation, configuration and administration of analytic tools, the development and use of databases, data marts, reports, dashboards and the interpretation of data and analysis results using statistical techniques.
Provide essential data support and analysis for various business initiatives.
Research, analyse, validate, and prepare data for use in monitoring and reporting, strategy support, and special projects.
Projects range from simple programming and basic data manipulation/analysis to more advanced techniques and analytics.
Access data, write queries, create dashboards, run reports, manipulate, and analyse large datasets to meet the needs of the organization.
Presenting analytical findings in a variety of formats (reports, PowerPoint, Tableau, graphs, figures, and tables), formulating recommendations, and effectively present results to non-analytic audiences.


Technical Skill And Qualifications


Master's degree in business, analytics, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field. Master's degree in analytics, data science or related field preferred.
Work experience in actuarial and financial data analysis or business intelligence experience.
Programming skills such as SQL, R, Python, Tableau and similar are necessary for this role.
Broad knowledge of data warehouses, data marts and business intelligence solutions is preferred
Demonstrated experience in analytical problem solving (including statement of problem, identification and collection of pertinent data, analysis, recommendation, and revaluation) strongly preferred.
Ability to work independently on multiple concurrent cross-border projects within team setting to achieve outcomes.
Must possess strong ability to perform route cause analysis and communicate findings in actionable manner.
Strong analytical thinking to breakdown complex problems and a strong will to get things done and deliver accurate results.
Problem solver, detail oriented and strong analytical skills required.
Ability to engage with stakeholders to understand and respond to their needs.
Experience with analytics reporting and data interpretation/presentation.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications Skills required.


Why should you join SiriusPoint?

Our people are our experts, and from day one you will be empowered to apply your expertise in a supportive, collaborative and purposeful environment. Our Values - Integrity, Customer Focused, Solution Driven, Diversity, and Collaboration are at the heart of our business, and they guide our everyday actions and decision making. We also unite our global team behind common goals, ensuring you can make a meaningful impact.

We Achieve More Together

At SiriusPoint, we know that diversity, inclusion and allyship make us stronger. We value and are committed to supporting the unique voices, backgrounds, cultures, lifestyles and contributions of the diverse global employee base that make up our business.

We know that a diverse and equitable culture, where all voices are included and heard, is critical to our success as an employer. We are committed to developing our DE&I strategy to ensure that SiriusPoint remains a supportive and empowering place of work.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking to work for a growing fintech in London? We are seeking a talented Data Analyst with expertise in the payments space, specifically focused on issuer processors.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with complex data sets related to payment transactions, providing crucial insights that will drive business decisions and strategic initiatives. Your analysis will directly influence the efficiency of payment processing and card issuance operations, helping to shape the future of our business.

Job Summary

As a Data Analyst specializing in the payments space for issuer processors, you will play a critical role in analysing and interpreting complex data sets to support decision-making and strategic initiatives. You will be responsible for extracting insights from payment transaction data, identifying trends, ensuring data quality, and providing actionable recommendations to improve business outcomes. Your work will directly impact the efficiency and effectiveness of payment processing and card issuance operations.

Key Responsibilities


Analyse large datasets related to payment processing, card issuance, and customer transactions to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Use statistical techniques and data mining tools to interpret data and generate actionable insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data and track key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work closely with business units, product managers, and other teams to understand data requirements and business objectives.
Provide analytical support to stakeholders by delivering data-driven recommendations and insights.
Communicate findings and insights effectively through presentations, reports, and visualizations.
Ensure the accuracy, completeness, and consistency of data used for analysis.
Work with data engineers to implement data validation and cleansing processes to maintain high data quality.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and optimization within payment processing and card issuance operations.
Analyse operational workflows to recommend efficiency improvements.
Monitor system performance and data trends to proactively address potential issues.
Ensure data analysis practices comply with industry standards, regulatory requirements, and security protocols.
Assist in preparing data and reports for regulatory audits and compliance reviews.
Proactively identify opportunities for process improvements and implement innovative solutions.
Participate in training and professional development activities to enhance skills and knowledge.


Qualifications


Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in the payments industry with issuer processors.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Knowledge of payment processing system, card issuance, and related services.
Experience with cloud-based data solutions (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and warehouses such as Snowflake, Redshift etc.
Familiarity with modern data architecture such as Lakehouse.
Familiarity with dBT tool for data transformation.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Attention to detail and a commitment to data quality and integrity.
Familiarity with regulatory requirements and security standards in the financial industry.


About Thredd

Thredd is helping to change the face of the Fintech landscape by delivering industry-leading solutions to the payment and finance sectors. At the heart of our capability is our award-winning payments platform (Apex), which powers some of the world's most high-profile challenger banks, disruptors and fintech innovators. When we say we are global, we mean it; the flexibility of our platform has enabled us to work with over 100 clients, in over 60 countries operating across 150 different currencies.

If you want to be at the forefront of financial technologies in a growing business apply now!

NOTE: APPLICANTS SHOULD HAVE THE RIGHTS TO WORK IN THE UK. WE DON'T OFFER VISA SPONSORSHIP
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analytics Engineer - Must have Insurance experience


Location: London 2-3 days a week on-site


Salary: £62,000, 15% bonus

Overview:

Join a leading insurance organisation that delivers data-driven solutions across diverse business functions. As a Senior Analytics Engineer, you’ll be at the forefront of developing tools, visualizations, and strategies to enhance data accessibility and accuracy. Your contributions will support decision-making processes across the organization, combining hands-on engineering with leadership to influence the analytics vision.

Key Responsibilities:


Analytics Strategy: Drive the company’s analytics strategy by creating data visualizations and analytical tools that empower users with actionable insights.
Engineering Standards: Develop and implement global standards to ensure the consistency and scalability of analytics products.
Data Infrastructure: Design and maintain a high-performance data environment, collaborating closely with technical and business teams.
User Interface Design: Lead the development of user-friendly, visually compelling dashboards and reporting tools in Power BI, ensuring insights are accessible to all users.
Data Accuracy: Troubleshoot data issues, ensuring consistency and integrity across systems, and promote a single version of data truth.
Client Engagement: Work closely with stakeholders to ensure the delivered data solutions meet user acceptance criteria and drive data adoption within the organization.
Cloud Technologies: Utilize Azure tools, including Data Factory, Synapse, and Data Bricks, to build robust analytics infrastructure, supporting both operational and ad-hoc reporting needs.
Automation and Improvement: Introduce automation and continuous improvement practices to streamline data access and reporting, enhancing productivity and efficiency across departments.


Technical Skills:


5+ years of experience as an analytics engineer with expertise in building data solutions using the Microsoft tech stack (Azure, Power BI).
Proficiency in SQL, DAX, and a basic understanding of Python in a Spark environment.
Demonstrated ability to create engineering standards and maintain data consistency across analytical products.
Experience within Financial Services or Insurance is highly desirable.
Strong ability to communicate complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Rakuten Viber is one of the most popular and downloaded apps in the world. Working with us provides a unique opportunity to influence hundreds of millions of our users and to be part of the journey that makes us a super-app. Our mission is to make people’s lives easier by enabling meaningful connections, from precious moments with family and friends, through managing business relationships to pursuing their passions.

Our Data Analyst team provides insights on how millions of users interact with our products. As a Data Analyst, you will be part of Viber Pay unit and deliver insights that translate directly into business growth.

Working hand-in-hand with the global managers for each region, you will spot new opportunities, challenge the status quo, and present your findings back to the leadership team. We are looking for an experienced, hands-on individual with both strong technical skills (SQL, Python / R, and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Excel, Looker, etc.) and a business mindset.

Responsibilities:


Deliver cutting-edge analytics projects optimizing across regions, channels, and analytical functions
Report on key performance metrics against targets on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis and provide actionable insights to improve performance
Liaise with stakeholders, such as Product, Marketing, Analytics and Data Science teams to drive step changes in growth
Share expertise and best practices within analytical functions to develop a shared center of excellence
Proactively craft stories from data to clearly identify opportunities in the markets/channels
Build and maintain reporting dashboards, reports, and data models


Requirements:


3+ years experience in a role equivalent to data or business analysis
Analytical and problem-solving skills
An ability to communicate complex findings to key stakeholders in a clear, simple way
Good command of Excel, experience with SQL and BI tools (ideally Tableau, Looker or similar)
BSc degree (or higher) in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or any other quantitative field


Advantages:


Experience working in similar fintech/social/technology industries or else high-data-volume industries
Knowledge of basic marketing terms, funnel conversion, retention analysis, CRM activities
Knowledge of A/B testing principles and statistical analysis techniques
Experience with Python and ETL

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Publicis Media helps clients drive sustainable business growth by harnessing the modern media landscape to drive one-to-one consumer connections at scale. Publicis Media UK is made up of 2000 people working across market-leading media agencies including Zenith, Starcom and Spark Foundry as well as specialist practices Publicis Media Exchange (PMX), Performics, Publicis Sport & Entertainment, Publicis Media Content and NextTECHnow. Together they combine deep expertise in media investment, strategy, insights and analytics, data and technology, commerce, performance marketing and content. Publicis Media is part of Publicis Groupe and is present in more than 100 countries with over 23,500 employees worldwide.


Our Commitment
Publicis Media is committed to building a culturally diverse workforce and therefore strongly encourages applications from underrepresented groups. We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of their background.




Job Description



We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Product Development team. You will work closely with the Scrum Master to deliver our technical builds, approach, and prioritisation.


Are you a developer, data or software engineer with experience working with advertising/media dataset, and a history of creating data pipelines and structures that can be used in front end applications or creating automations that make data work harder? If so this is the role for you!




Qualifications



To be successful in this role you will need:


Previous experience as a data engineer or in a similar role
Technical expertise with data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques
Knowledge of programming languages (minimum Python & SQL)
Hands-on experience with SQL database design
Understanding of ETL, serverless and cloud computing (Google Cloud Platform preferred)


Additional Information



Publicis Media has fantastic benefits on offer to all of our employees. In addition to the classics, Pension, Life Assurance, Private Medical and Income Protection Plans we also offer;


WORK YOUR WORLD opportunity to work anywhere in the world, where there is a Publicis office, for up to 6 weeks a year.
REFLECTION DAYS - Two additional days of paid leave to step away from your usual day-to-day work and create time to focus on your well-being and self-care.
HELP@HAND BENEFITS 24/7 helpline to support you on a personal and professional level. Access to remote GPs, mental health support and CBT. Wellbeing content and lifestyle coaching.
FAMILY FRIENDLY POLICIES We provide 26 weeks of full pay for the following family milestones: Maternity. Adoption, Surrogacy and Shared Parental Leave.
FLEXIBLE WORKING, BANK HOLIDAY SWAP & BIRTHDAY DAY OFF You are entitled to an additional day off for your birthday, from your first day of employment.
GREAT LOCAL DISCOUNTS This includes membership discounts with Soho Friends, local restaurants and retailers in Westfield White City and Television Centre.

Full details of our benefits will be shared when you join us!


Publicis Groupe operates a hybrid working pattern with full time employees being office-based three days during the working week.


We are supportive of all candidates and are committed to providing a fair assessment process. If you have any circumstances (such as neurodiversity, physical or mental impairments or a medical condition) that may affect your assessment, please inform your Talent Acquisition Partner. We will discuss possible adjustments to ensure fairness. Rest assured, disclosing this information will not impact your treatment in our process.


Please make sure you check out the Publicis Career Page which showcases our Inclusive Benefits and our EAG’s (Employee Action Groups).





Show more

  • FLEXIBLE WORKING, BANK HOLIDAY SWAP & BIRTHDAY DAY OFF You are entitled to an additional day off for your birthday, from your first day of employment.
  • GREAT LOCAL DISCOUNTS This includes membership discounts with Soho Friends, local restaurants and retailers in Westfield White City and Television Centre.

Full details of our benefits will be shared when you join us!

Publicis Groupe operates a hybrid working pattern with full time employees being office-based three days during the working week.

We are supportive of all candidates and are committed to providing a fair assessment process. If you have any circumstances (such as neurodiversity, physical or mental impairments or a medical condition) that may affect your assessment, please inform your Talent Acquisition Partner. We will discuss possible adjustments to ensure fairness. Rest assured, disclosing this information will not impact your treatment in our process.

Please make sure you check out the Publicis Career Page which showcases our Inclusive Benefits and our EAG’s (Employee Action Groups).

Title: Lead Data Analyst, Operations
Description:
Gopuff is the go-to solution for immediate everyday needs, fulfilling customer orders of cleaning and home products to food and drinks, and in some markets, alcohol - in just minutes.

As a Lead Data Analyst, Operations, you will be at the forefront of transforming how our delivery and warehouse operations function. In this role, you’ll dive deep into the heart of our supply chain, logistics, and warehouse management to uncover insights that will streamline processes and improve efficiency.

Our operations span multiple warehouses and delivery points, facing the daily challenges of managing fluctuating demand, optimizing delivery routes, reducing waste, and ensuring timely fulfillment. This is an opportunity for a highly analytical individual who is excited by solving tough operational problems and who thrives in fast-paced, dynamic environments.

You Will:


Drive Operational Efficiency: Analyse and enhance key metrics related to delivery times, warehouse capacity, order fulfilment, and logistics operations. Your insights will directly impact how we optimise our delivery operations to reduce delays, improve cost-efficiency, and enhance customer satisfaction.
Deep Dive into Warehouse Operations: Work closely with our operations team to ensure our warehouse functions are aligned with overall business goals. You'll investigate key areas such as stock inbounding and storage optimisation.
Data at the Core: Build and maintain advanced data models that provide clarity and insight into complex operational challenges. You’ll be a key player in ensuring that data is accessible and actionable to drive day-to-day decision-making across our logistics and delivery network.
Collaborate with Stakeholders: Partner with regional managers, store general managers, delivery operations leads, and the customer service team to translate data into strategic recommendations. You'll ensure that data insights are not only clear but actionable for those on the ground.
Tackle Real-World Challenges: From last-mile delivery hurdles to warehouse bottlenecks, this role requires someone who can navigate ambiguity and provide practical, data-driven solutions. This is not a role for someone who wants to stay behind the scenes; we need a hands-on analyst who can get into the details of operations and drive tangible improvements.


You Have:


5+ years in Data Analytics: Experience with data analysis in operational or logistics-heavy environments, such as e-commerce, retail, or distribution centre's.
Proven Experience in Delivery & Warehouse Operations: Familiarity with the intricacies of last-mile delivery, logistics optimisation, and warehouse management.
Expertise in SQL: Strong command of SQL for querying large datasets and developing complex, automated reports. Knowledge of Python or R is a plus.
Tools Mastery: Experience with BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI. Experience with dbt is a requirement, DataBricks is an advantage.
Strong Communicator: Ability to present complex data insights clearly and compellingly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Problem-Solver: You’re not afraid of diving into operational complexity, identifying challenges, and providing clear solutions that work on the ground.
Curiosity and Drive: A passion for problem-solving and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment. You’ll be excited to tackle operational pain points and make our systems better, faster, and more efficient.


Benefits:


A high-impact role where you’ll be directly involved in the company’s most critical operations.
Company RSU’s (Company Shares)
Private Medical + Dental cover
Annual performance appraisal and bonus
Employee Discount + FAM membership
Career growth opportunities


Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it—stuff happens. But that’s where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we’re assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you’re hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity

We are currently looking for a Client Data Associate to join ACA Mirabella’s Data and Implementations Team. This person will assist the day-to-day clients’ data onboarding, supporting the client implementation team with data quality issues and helping to identify data inconsistencies.

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Client Data Associate to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate must be a team player and be able to collaborate effectively with other stakeholders to support data management and implementation. Self initiative to learn in a challenging, fast-paced and developing regulatory environment is an asset.

The position requires strong analytical skills, and a passion for data integrity and quality. Core responsibilities involve the seamless integration and management of client data obtained from various external systems into our internal control framework.

What you’ll do:



Assist in the day-to-day clients’ data onboarding process, including ongoing collaboration with departments and updating internal documentation (FAQs, Data Samples, Data Specs, etc)
Assist in recognising potential data inconsistencies and reconcile appropriately to preserve data integrity.
Assist identifying data quality issues through analysis and work with departments to resolve them.
Assist client implementation team with data mapping and help resolve any data inconsistency issues detected.
Work closely with internal teams to address data quality issues and enhance data workflows.
Ensure timely and accurate response to internal and external data requests. Maintain detailed documentation of data onboarding processes, client data specifications, and data mappings.
Performs any other related duties as required or assigned.


Knowledge and Skills Required:



Bachelor's degree in Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer or Data Science, or a related field.
1-2 years of relevant work experience, working with large data sets preferably in the financial services sector.
Proficiency in Excel – pivot tables, lookups, etc.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to work with personnel at all levels.
Able to work independently and be resourceful, with excellent time management skills.
Able to work independently and be resourceful, with excellent time management skills.


Desirable skills/experience:



Data analytics.
Disclosure reporting.
Surveillance systems implementation.
Power BI/Tableau.
SQL/Python .


What working at ACA offers:

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options as well as a flexible work environment. You’ll also be granted time off for designated ACA Paid Holidays, Summer Fridays, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. We also offer unique benefits such as Student Debt Forgiveness and Pet Insurance.

About Mirabella:

Established in 2004, ACA Mirabella provides regulated financial services to the discretionary management and advisory sectors and manages approximately $30bn in assets.

ACA Mirabella, part of the ACA Group, offers a high-quality and flexible regulatory hosting platform in the UK and continental Europe (via Malta). ACA Mirabella has helped over two hundred firms undertake regulated activities under its umbrella, while allowing them to retain their own brand identity and control.

About ACA:

ACA Group is the leading governance, risk, and compliance (GRC) advisor in financial services. We empower our clients to reimagine GRC and protect and grow their business. Our innovative approach integrates consulting, managed services, and our ComplianceAlpha® technology platform with the specialized expertise of former regulators and practitioners and our deep understanding of the global regulatory landscape.

What we commit to:

ACA is firmly committed to a policy of non-discrimination, which applies to recruiting, hiring, placement, promotions, training, discipline, terminations, layoffs, transfers, leaves of absence, compensation and all other terms and conditions of employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Title: Data Insight Analyst
Description:
This is an exciting opportunity for a data-focused marketeer to join a quickly growing business where you can have an immediate impact. You will be crucial in supporting our marketing and sales teams by sourcing high-quality prospect data, managing our CRM & CMS systems and helping coordinate vital campaigns. 




We are a small business (for now), so you will work closely with senior members of the team, learn from our experiences and be given the opportunity to progress and develop your skills quickly.




This is an amazing opportunity to make a significant contribution to our ambitious growth plans and meet some of the most influential business leaders in the country.




Who are PepTalks?

PepTalks is the UK’s leading peer-to-peer training community dedicated to supporting private equity backed CEOs and their management teams.




We are in our sixth year of trading and growing very quickly - we are projected to double our membership and revenues in the next 12-18 months.




Our members join PepTalks to:




Understand the unwritten rules of Private Equity.
To maximise and realise the value in their businesses.
To stay on the top of their game as leaders & culture developers.




We are incredibly fortunate to work with some of the best CEOs, management teams and businesses in UK industry and as much as we provide peer training, we also learn from our members every day.




Responsibilities

CRM Management: Oversee and maintain PepTalks’ CRM database to ensure accuracy and completeness of data. Also, contribute to the implementation and upkeep of a new membership platform.
Data Sourcing & Segmentation: Research, source and segment relevant prospect data to support the marketing and sales teams with campaigns.
Automation implementation: Create and maintain automated workflows for campaigns, customer management and database updates.
Data Analysis & Reporting: Analyse CRM and marketing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights, and provide actionable recommendations to the marketing team.




What would make someone great at this role?

Bachelor’s degree in marketing, data analytics or other related field.




1+ years of relevant industry experience.
High proficiency in database management and Excel.
CRM management experience (preferably HubSpot).
Excellent verbal communication skills and high attention to detail.
Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment, under pressure and have the ability to manage multiple projects.




Above all, we are looking for a passion in personal development, achievement and hard work.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a motivated Data Analyst to join our London team in a hybrid role. This position involves data analytics, reporting, dashboards, and supporting machine learning projects. Collaborating closely with the Lead Data Scientist, the role focuses on generating actionable insights, improving reports, and contributing to analytical and machine learning initiatives.




What you’ll be doing




Data Analysis & Reporting: Perform in-depth analysis of large datasets to extract meaningful insights. Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to support business decisions.
Visualisation & Dashboards: Build and manage interactive dashboards to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and visualise trends. Experience with tools like Power BI or Grafana is beneficial.
ETL Processes: Transform data into data warehouses for analysis and reporting.
Machine Learning Support: Assist in the development and implementation of machine learning models and algorithms. Gain exposure to advanced techniques such as generative AI and large language models (LLMs).
Collaboration with Developers: Work with developers on data-related tasks and projects using Agile or Kanban methodologies.
Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with stakeholders to understand their needs and provide actionable insights and recommendations.
Technical Communication: Communicate technical findings and insights clearly to non-technical team members and stakeholders.







The skills & experience needed as Data Analyst




Some experience in data analysis, reporting, and dashboard creation, with some exposure to machine learning or similar projects.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with databases like Redshift, Postgres, or Microsoft SQL Server.
Strong skills in data analysis and visualisation using tools such as Excel (including pivot tables), Tableau, Power BI, or Grafana.
Familiarity with Python, particularly for data manipulation and analysis.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an emphasis on practical solutions and clear reporting.
Effective communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively across teams.







We are not able to offer visa sponsorship or assist with relocation support for this role. Please ensure you have the right to work in the country where this role is located before applying.




Benefits include: 25 days annual leave (increasing with tenure), private medical health cash plan, income protection, life assurance, enhanced employer pension contribution; plus award winning voluntary flexible benefits (lifestyle, health, wealth, wellbeing).







Kantar Profiles Division




Unleash your potential at Kantar's Profiles division, home to the world’s largest audience network.




Join our expert team in survey design, sampling methodologies, and data science, we leverage cutting-edge technology to provide our clients with seamless access to real people and unparalleled insights.




Backed by industry-leading anti-fraud technology, our Profiles Audience Network comprises over 170 million individuals, in more than 100 markets worldwide. Our clients include many of the world’s leading brands, who trust us to collect reliable insights.




Be part of a team that shapes the future of panel market research and drives results for brands everywhere!




Some key facts:

Our team is made up of 600 people globally.
We are present in 27 countries.
Profiles currently holds a 10% share in the $3b panel industry but we have ambition, a robust 3-year business plan and the financial backing of our private equity owners (Bain Capital) to grow to be the #1 player in this sector.
We provide an ideal environment for professional growth, offering:
A ‘start-up’ atmosphere in which you can make a big impact and get credit for it.
The chance to learn all aspects of the business and influence the decision-making process.
The opportunity to network and learn from highly experienced, senior members of our teams from across the business, globally.




Why join Kantar?




We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.




And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

HTML:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:

  • Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
  • Data Analyst - £50,000
  • Business Data Analyst - £67,500
  • Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
  • Business Analysts - £60,000

Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Title: Business/Data Analyst (£50-60k)
Description:
The Highlights!

We’re thrilled to be working with this impressive fintech business, based in Central London, focused on delivering insight products and services to the finance sector. After receiving significant investment, they are growing their data management function as they look to realise their ambition of building a market leading platform.

This Business Data Analyst position is part of a growing delivery team that owns the development and improvement of core data workflows. Working in a matrix environment with talented teams in Data, Technology and Product, you’ll act as the connection point between end users and the data team, building an understanding of the as is and to be business processes.

A fantastic opportunity for someone to further develop their analysis skills, this role would suit someone moving from a data operations position or someone that has already established themselves as a Business/Data Analyst.

Our client’s working arrangements require three days per week in the office in London as a minimum. This is a deliberate and thoughtful choice that is aligned with an emphasis on collaboration between the product and data teams and the user community.

About The Company

This Fintech business has demonstrated an admirable track record of adapting to meet the needs of its customers, evolving its product portfolio and establishing itself as one of the leaders in the provision of insight products and services to the financial sector.

Through adopting a customer centric approach they have been able to demonstrate impressive growth domestically and internationally. It is the breadth of services, combined with investment in technology, and crucially the people that deliver it, that has seen the business go from strength to strength.

About The Opportunity

Working directly for the Head of Data, in a team that is set to grow significantly over coming months, your key focus will be on supporting the backlog of data management tasks undertaken by the Product Owners.

Using your eye for detail you’ll create accurate documentation that details the current state of core data systems, applications and workflows before working with Product Owners and stakeholders to document the target state.

You’ll use your inquisitive nature to ask questions of your users, helping you to understand the business needs that would drive new developments and enhancements to the core systems. Drafting requirements and preparing user stories, you’ll be building on the core skills that could ultimately support a move into product management.

An agile environment, this role will have you playing an active part in Scrum ceremonies, backlog refinement and preparation sessions. You’ll also use your data analysis skills to support decision making on what tasks to prioritise and why.

Bringing a quality focus to this position you’ll be involved in the testing process, from planning and executing User Acceptance Test scenarios and scripts as required.

Acting as the bridge between stakeholders and the engineering team, you’ll ensure that requirements are understood and met throughout the development process.

About You

A strong Data or Business Analyst, you’ll evidence the ability to blend core business analysis skills with an excellent grasp of data management and processing, using these skills to improve data workflows across the business.

In Addition, You’ll Demonstrate The Following


Experience working either in a data product business or in a data team that has been responsible for working with large scale data challenges. Time spent working in a Fintech environment is particularly helpful but not essential.
Ability to create data documents and artefacts.
Experience of working in an Agile environment and in partnership with Product Owners.
Strong data analysis skills using tools such as SQL and Power BI.
Exceptional communication skills that support your engagement with team members and stakeholders.
Confidence in visualising data and communicating your analysis of that data.


Inclusion Statement

We are dedicated to providing reasonable adjustments to applicants throughout the recruitment process and we work closely with our clients to encourage them to do the same.

If you require any accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, please let us know. Your needs will be treated confidentially and with respect.

We strive to eliminate biases and create an environment where all candidates are evaluated based on their skills, qualifications, and potential contributions.

If you have any feedback on how we can improve our process in any way, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job id: 095074

Salary: £37,332 - £42,099 including London Weighting Allowance.

Business unit: King's Digital

Department: King's Digital.

Location: Strand Campus

Category: Professional & Support Services.




About us

Our mission is to provide transformative, high-quality digital education, so students can learn, wherever they are.




We collaborate with academics and professional services staff across the university, and with our external partners, to design, develop and deliver a wide range of educational programmes.




Our learners study with us from across the world, choosing when and where they study, working around their schedules.




We are a dynamic team with ambitious growth targets in a priority area of development for King’s. We proudly foster a supportive culture and community which prioritises both individual and collective wellbeing.




Employee support at King’s includes flexible working arrangements, paid maternity/shared parental leave, menopausal support, an active wellbeing programme, training and development opportunities and much more. All of our staff benefit from a generous pension contribution as well.




As part of hybrid working at King’s, all team members can work remotely for part of the week if they wish.




Join us as we open futures and unlock potential.




About the role

In this exciting new role within King's Digital, the Data Analyst will be supporting in driving the data strategy and operations of the University’s online programmes. Reporting to the Data Governance and Lead Analyst, the Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in producing regular and ad-hoc reports that deliver insights into management information, business intelligence, and statistical analysis. These reports will support key stakeholders across various teams and departments within the University.




The Data Analyst will develop a comprehensive understanding of the data that underpins King’s Digital and its programmes, using tools like Power BI to enhance productivity and inform decision-making. This role involves data manipulation and interpretation to support student experience and online delivery optimisation and in refining and improving student data processes.




Additionally, the Data Analyst will ensure that reporting is seamlessly integrated with university processes, maintaining strong communication and coordination with central data reporting teams, data governance teams, academic faculties, admissions, and marketing. As the primary point of contact for data-related inquiries, the postholder will manage reporting outputs, uphold data security, and ensure compliance with data protection regulations. The role also involves providing training and guidance to report users, promoting self-service capabilities, and enhancing the data literacy of King's Digital staff. Through these efforts, the Data Analyst will contribute significantly to the overall King’s Digital Data Strategy.




This is a full-time post and you will be offered an indefinite contract.




Contact details: Wyman Jayarajah. wyman.jayarajah@kcl.ac.uk




Closing date: 25 September 2024.




To apply, please click “Apply Now”.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (GRADUATE ROLE WITH VISA SPONSORSHIP)
Description:
Junior Data Analyst (Visa Sponsorship Available) | SaaS Scale-Up | £40,000 - £50,000 per annum | London, UK




About the Company:

Our client is a rapidly expanding SaaS scale-up, currently comprising 200 innovative and driven professionals. Based in London, they specialize in developing cutting-edge software solutions that cater to a diverse and growing clientele. With a focus on continuous improvement and leveraging the latest technologies, they have established themselves as a leader in the SaaS industry




About the Role:

The Data Analyst position offers a unique opportunity for individuals with a keen interest in data management and analysis. This role involves extracting, cleaning, and interpreting large amounts of data to provide actionable insights that drive decision-making and support the development of high-quality SaaS products. The position includes significant training and development opportunities, allowing you to enhance your analytical skills and expertise in using advanced data analysis tools within a dynamic, agile environment. The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, analytical, and driven to support data-driven decision making.




Responsibilities:

Extracting data from primary and secondary sources, then reorganizing this data in a format that can be easily read by either human or machine.
Using statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts.
Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
Collaborating with engineering and product development teams to implement and refine data collection techniques.
Assisting in the design and implementation of databases and data collection systems.
Ensuring data integrity and accuracy in all analytics activities.
Participating in ongoing education and training to stay abreast of industry developments and advancements in data analysis tools and techniques.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field is required.
Experience with data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Proficiency with statistical analysis tools (e.g., SAS, SPSS, R) and programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Effective communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.




Benefits:

A competitive salary range of £40,000 to £50,000 with potential for bonuses.
Opportunity to work in a fast-growing SaaS company with a vibrant and inclusive culture.
Extensive career development opportunities, including significant training in advanced data science techniques and tools.
Access to the latest tools and technologies in data science.
Regular team events, workshops, and networking opportunities.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst - £30k Dartford/Hybrid
Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for a recent graduate from subjects such as Mathematics and Physics to join a national organisations data team as an entry-level Data Analyst.

Youll have the opportunity to learn SQL Development, MS Fabric, Azure Data Lake and PowerBI (plus much more) to expert level and you arent required to have previous commercial experience beforehand!

The role is based near Dartford and you should expect a heavier onsite presence as you get started, but it will become more flexible as you learn and start to work more independently.

Key Skills Include

Degree in a relevant subject (Mathematics, Physics etc.)

Passion for learning Data Analytics/Engineering

The Experience Youll Gain Includes

Advanced data analysis, cleansing, and statistical modelling

Developing, automating, and optimising robust ETL pipelines and data workflows

Optimising reporting structures

Designing, implementation, and continuous improvement of data-driven solutions

SQL Development, MS Fabric, Azure Data Lake and PowerBI

If youd like to learn more about this opportunity, please let me know.

In line with the Conduct Regulations 2003, when advertising permanent vacancies JNC Recruitment are acting as an Employment Agency, and when advertising temporary/contract vacancies JNC Recruitment are acting as an Employment Business.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

We are offering a long-term contract opportunity for a Data Analyst (Raiser's Edge) with a client based in Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada. As a Data Analyst, you will be instrumental in managing and analyzing large sets of data, assisting in projects to streamline data architecture, and facilitating data extraction processes. Your responsibilities will also include troubleshooting data-related issues and assisting in the development of strategies for data management.

Responsibilities


Analyze and interpret complex datasets to facilitate decision making
Regularly review and approve data batches to ensure accuracy and consistency
Assist in the reconfiguration of data architecture to streamline data extraction and management processes
Generate custom reports and conduct one-off analysis when necessary
Assist in transitioning operations to a new data viewing format
Develop and implement Standard Operating Procedures for data management
Troubleshoot data-related issues and queries from the team
Use tools such as Database Object, Database System, AB Testing, Business Intelligence (BI), and Create Dashboards for data analysis
Utilize “Raiser’s Edge” for data management and analysis


Requirements


Possess a strong understanding of database objects and database systems
Proficient in AB Testing and data analysis techniques
Experience with Business Intelligence (BI) tools
Ability to create and manage dashboards for data visualization
Familiarity with Raiser's Edge software is essential
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders
Ability to handle multiple tasks and projects simultaneously
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Analyst in the education industry will be an advantage.


Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Robert Half works to put you in the best position to succeed. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity - whenever you choose - even on the go.

As a Data Analyst, you will be instrumental in managing and analyzing large sets of data, assisting in projects to streamline data architecture, and facilitating data extraction processes. Your responsibilities will also include troubleshooting data-related issues and assisting in the development of strategies for data management.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze and interpret complex datasets to facilitate decision making
  • Regularly review and approve data batches to ensure accuracy and consistency
  • Assist in the reconfiguration of data architecture to streamline data extraction and management processes
  • Generate custom reports and conduct one-off analysis when necessary
  • Assist in transitioning operations to a new data viewing format
  • Develop and implement Standard Operating Procedures for data management
  • Troubleshoot data-related issues and queries from the team
  • Use tools such as Database Object, Database System, AB Testing, Business Intelligence (BI), and Create Dashboards for data analysis
  • Utilize “Raiser’s Edge” for data management and analysis

Requirements

  • Possess a strong understanding of database objects and database systems
  • Proficient in AB Testing and data analysis techniques
  • Experience with Business Intelligence (BI) tools
  • Ability to create and manage dashboards for data visualization
  • Familiarity with Raiser's Edge software is essential
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks and projects simultaneously
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics or a related field
  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst in the education industry will be an advantage.

Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.

Robert Half works to put you in the best position to succeed. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity - whenever you choose - even on the go.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Come join Pattison Food Group Ltd., a Jim Pattison business, and Canada’s largest Western-based provider of food and health products.

Pattison Food Group Ltd. consists of Save-On-Foods and other well-known grocery banners. With nearly 300 retail locations, we proudly employ more than 30,000 team members.

We have an exciting opportunity for a full-time Data Analyst to join our More Rewards Loyalty team in Langley, BC.

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Customer Data & Analytics, you will leverage all aspects of data and analytics to support large-scale projects and continuous experimentation initiatives that guide decision-making and deliver high-quality insights.

You will also support the development and management of customer data and insights using one of the largest and most comprehensive data sets in Canada to support the More Rewards Loyalty Program, Marketing, Retail Operations and Merchandising

You will be responsible for:


Collaborating with stakeholders to understand business questions, processes, and KPIs.
Formulating testable hypotheses aligned with business questions and conducting statistical experiments in a live environment.
Writing SQL scripts to automate data pipelines and workflows.
Using Python scripts in a Jupyter Notebook environment for exploratory data analysis, data wrangling, and statistical testing.
Developing and maintaining dashboards and visualizations in Power BI to convey insights and report on KPIs and test results.
Learning cloud-based analytics environments and big data tools to build analytics workflows on large datasets.
Discovering unique and creative insights to identify new opportunities for driving business value.
Becoming an expert in the relevant datasets within your analytics domain.
Supporting the Data & Analytics with key projects.



You have:


A degree in a STEM discipline with 1 to 3 years of relevant experience in data analytics or data science.
Intermediate Python coding skills. Experience in other programming languages is a considered an asset.
Intermediate understanding of SQL.
Experience using experimental design principles such as A/B and multivariate testing and working with business stakeholders to formulate testable hypotheses.
Experience with visualization and reporting tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Working knowledge of cloud environments such as Azure, GCP, or AWS. Experience with big data tools such as Spark and Databricks is a considered an asset.



You are:


A confident communicator, both verbally and written, with strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate a story with data and insights to non-technical stakeholders.
A problem solver with strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Effective in task management and delivering high-quality work.
Capable of multitasking and thriving in a fast-paced environment.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.



What we offer:

In addition to a highly competitive salary, we offer a great range of benefits, a company pension plan, free parking, exclusive team member offers, and opportunities for development and career progression.

If you’re looking to join a team that puts people first, you’re in the right place. Apply online today!

Compensation Details:

$72,720.00 - $90,900.00

The compensation offered for this position will take into consideration location, education, skills, experience, and other factors.

Title: Data Analyst/Data Engineer
Description:
About TCS:




Tata Consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile™ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS has over 615,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 55 countries. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $27.9 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2023, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.




Skills and Responsibilities:

• Good years of experience in Data Analyst/Data Engineer.

•Experience in data visualization, data cleaning, data manipulation (extract, transform, load), and tool usage of Tableau, Talend, SSIS.

•Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.

•Databases - MS SQL/Oracle/Teradata

•Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret complex data.

•Experience in performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.

•Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.

•A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large datasets.

•Excellent communication abilities in English communication skill, in written and oral.

•Roles & Responsibilities - [Data analysis] Define and specify data analysis target and support modeling / verification / test / application.

•[Data-based decision making] Research and support the insight to support decision making in the areas of business direction/market strategy/product strategy.

•[Verification of decision effects] Support methods to verify the effect of decision on business.

•[Algorithms acidization] Support implementing, evaluating and verifying algorithms for data analysis.

•Excellent communication skills

•Continuous learning attitude

•Team worker

•Meticulous Education bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or related technical skills.




Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualification for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.
