Title: Geoscience Data Analyst
Description:
Be part of something incredible. Metals are necessary for our world, but mining historically faced issues with waste, sustainability, and inefficiencies. MineSense is changing that. Our solutions reduce mining waste and environmental impacts while increasing profits and efficiencies. Backed by the best in venture capital and government funds, and recognized by tech industry and sustainability programs, MineSense is doing what many said could not be done: improving mining for people and planet.




We are looking to add a Geoscience Data Analyst to our GeoScience team. The role will report to the Manager, GeoScience and be based out of the Vancouver office. The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in detailed data analysis and statistics within the mining industry. You will work with clients globally, to incorporate MineSense solutions into their ore control processes and show them the value of using our systems. If you enjoy working with data, collaborating with multidisciplinary groups, and have a mining, geology, or geophysics background, we want to hear from you! 




Job Responsibilities:
Helping new and existing clients leverage MineSense technology in their grade control engineering processes, which includes developing client facing reports and presentations. 
Collaborating with internal teams to develop prediction models by correlating mine grade measurements or estimates with our sensor results to identify patterns, trends or other data features that relate to grade, texture, mineralogy, or lithology. 
Working with the Field Service and Product Development team to further enhance our products and services through system data analysis and data quality assurance/control. 
Determining and tracking data model accuracy and precision through comparison with sampled assay grades or grade estimates.  
Reporting and presenting data results/trends to internal teams, as well as external clients. 
Working closely with the Data team to create queries, scripts, and reports while ensuring data is well organized and maintained. 
Building and maintaining good working relationships with our clients. 
Promotes a positive company culture through sharing of information and supporting the learning and development of all colleagues. 
Additional duties as occasionally required by your manager. 





Qualifications:
Degree in Earth Sciences (Geology, Geophysics), Geostatistics, Data Analytics, Mining Engineering or related field. 
Ideally 1 to 4 years of relevant working experience, where experience in mining is preferred. 
Experience performing statistical analysis or data science in a work setting is preferred. 
Mining experience with in-grade control or working with ore control models is preferred. 
Experience with data analysis tools such as Python or other statistical packages. 
Experience and passion for solving analytical problems involving diverse data sets using quantitative approaches to generate insights. 
Attention to detail and an interest in problem-solving. 
Oral and written proficiency in English is required.  
Additional oral and written proficiency in Spanish is an asset. 
The ability to travel and support global offices is required (10-30%).  
Legally able to work in Canada. 








The salary offered to the successful candidate will be based on their experience, knowledge and skills they bring to MineSense, market data based on their location as well as internal equity. Keeping this mind, the salary offered can be outside of the range posted. We are looking for talented folks at all levels, so please do not hesitate to apply.

 

Our total rewards package includes: 

·        A competitive bonus.

·        Matching RRSP or 401K program (for Canadian and US employees)

·        A comprehensive benefit program

·        Transit Subsidy (for roles based in Vancouver, BC)

·        Hybrid work (for roles that do not require to be onsite)

·        3 weeks' vacation or more depending on the position

·        Company organized social events and celebrations to connect with your team

 

 

Here's what you can expect as a part of the MineSense Team: 

 

When you join MineSense, a trailblazing Canadian mining technology company, you become a part of our purpose to maximize global metals and minimize global impacts. We’re not just a company; we’re a Community of Innovators who forge a path toward a sustainable future. Here’s why we want you to be excited: 

·        Purpose-Driven: At MineSense, we don’t just clock in—we live our purpose. We’re on a mission to revolutionize the  mining industry, and every day, we’re one step closer to a cleaner, greener world. 

·        Values That Resonate: Our core values—Innovation, Belonging, Resilience, and Adding Value—aren’t just buzzwords. They’re the bedrock of our culture. When you step into our team, you’re not just an employee; you’re a steward of these values. 

·        Impactful Work: Imagine contributing to a cleaner, more sustainable planet. At MineSense, you’re shaping the future of cleantech and developing cutting edge technology that literally hasn't been developed before. Your work matters, and it echoes beyond our walls. 

·        People-Centric: We’re not just about profits; we’re about people. Our organization cares deeply about its employees. When you join us, you become part of a community that supports growth, well-being, and success. 

 

Ready to make your mark? Join MineSense and be part of something bigger than yourself. 

  

MineSense is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing accommodation to individuals with disabilities. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment or hiring process, please contact us at careers@minesense.com for assistance. Information received related to accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially. 

  

All applications are welcome, even if you don't meet all the requirements, so please do not hesitate to apply.

MineSense is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing accommodation to individuals with disabilities. Title: Entry Level Data Analyst (Rebel Apparel)
Description:
Entry Level Data Analyst - Canada

Job Summary

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Entry Level Data Analyst to join our team in Canada. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing data sets to help drive business decisions, identifying trends, and presenting findings in a clear and actionable manner. This is an excellent opportunity for recent graduates or individuals with a strong interest in data analysis who are eager to start their career in a dynamic and supportive environment.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources.
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Utilize statistical methods and tools to analyze data and generate insights.
Create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools like Excel, Tableau, or Power BI.
Assist in developing and implementing data-driven strategies to support business objectives.
Collaborate with team members to understand data needs and provide actionable recommendations.
Document analysis processes and results for transparency and future reference.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Familiarity with data analysis tools and techniques, such as Excel, SQL, or Python/R.
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to interpret and present data in a clear and meaningful way.
Basic knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Eagerness to learn and grow in the field of data analysis.


Preferred Skills


Experience with data cleaning and transformation.
Understanding of basic statistical concepts and methods.
Exposure to machine learning algorithms and data modeling is an advantage.


Value

Title: Data & Analytics - Senior Data Analyst, Digital
Description:
THE TEAM

The mission of the Data & Analytics Department is to provide the business with actionable and accurate information to enable data-driven decision-making.







THE OPPORTUNITY

As a member of the Data & Analytics Department supporting the eCommerce division, you will be part of the team that bridges the gap between business strategy and data. As a Senior Data Analyst at Aritzia, you will combine your deep understanding of digital customer experiences with your passion for data and masterful analytics skills to drive decisions that will create long lasting relationships with our customers and enhance outcomes for our eCommerce business. And, with the skills you gain in this role, the opportunities are endless – from a rewarding career in Analytics to continued growth and development with Aritzia.




THE ROLE

As the Senior Data Analyst, Digital, you will:

Seek to deeply understand Aritzia’s digital channels and generate actionable insights
Partner closely with business leaders and cross-functional partners in Digital Product Management, Digital Merchandising and/or Performance Marketing to enable data-driven decisions that will enhance customer experience and grow the business
Lead measurement strategies to quantify the performance of various Digital initiatives leveraging benchmarks, forecasts and advanced analytics techniques
Clearly visualize and communicate data through reports, dashboards, and presentations
Identify and refine digital data collection and modeling requirements to enable insight creation and maintain coverage of a constantly evolving Digital customer experience
Provide technical leadership to elevate the analytics acumen amongst the team and stakeholders




THE QUALIFICATIONS

The Senior Data Analyst will:

Have a background in eCommerce, Digital and/or Digital Marketing
Commit to learning and applying Aritzia's Business and People Leadership principles to achieve the best team and business results
Have an understanding and passion for the industry in which we operate
A dedication to quality and investing in results and new business opportunities that add value
Successfully collaborate with business leaders and cross-functional partners, establishing yourself as a subject matter expert and trust partner
Understand and transform complex business problems into data & analytics requirements
Translate data into concise insights that clearly communicate outcomes and value to stakeholders
Leverage advanced analytics techniques such as regression analysis, causal impact, A/B testing and customer lifetime value to derive data driven insights, predict outcomes and recommend actions
Have proven skills, education, and/or applicable certifications in:
SQL, Visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI)
Google Analytics/Google Tag Manager or Adobe Analytics/Adobe Launch
Python, R or related analysis tools




THE COMPENSATION

The typical hiring range for this position is $100,000 - $150,000 CAD per year. The final agreed upon salary may vary based on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills and experience. Additionally, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity




We are always looking for top talent - if your qualifications differ from those listed above, the scope of work and final agreed upon [salary/wage] may be adjusted to reflect your individual qualifications.




Aritzia’s Everyday Luxury compensation package goes beyond the base salary with endless growth and recognition opportunities through our pay-for-performance philosophy. Along with comprehensive benefits, aspirational workspaces and elevated employee perks and experiences - we provide it all.




THE PERKS

Some of the industry-leading benefits you will receive working at Aritzia:

Product Discount – Maybe you’ve heard of our famous product discount? Or our exclusive private shopping events? You have now.
A-OK Commissary & Café – Everyday Luxury dining, exclusive to Aritzia. Our in-house bistro and café is a private oasis where employees can enjoy curated, subsidized Everyday Luxury dining.
The SET – Our in-office fitness studio and gym with state-of-the-art equipment, custom-created classes, and optional personal training. Open 7 days a week, works out well.
Aritzia Virtual Wellness – Because your health, happiness, and safety matter – 24/7 resources to support you in your wellbeing goals, be it physical, mental, social, or financial.
Aspirational Workplace – Our offices are specially designed to be spaces of creativity, productivity, and inspiration. They’re also dog friendly. Woof.
Amenities – Additional amenities include a private parent’s room, shower facilities with elevated complementary conveniences, bike rooms, and more.
The Extras – We also offer a multitude of other perks like dry-cleaning, hotel and restaurant discounts, self-care promos and on-site medical care.

  • Lead measurement strategies to quantify the performance of various Digital initiatives leveraging benchmarks, forecasts and advanced analytics techniques
  • Clearly visualize and communicate data through reports, dashboards, and presentations
  • Identify and refine digital data collection and modeling requirements to enable insight creation and maintain coverage of a constantly evolving Digital customer experience
  • Provide technical leadership to elevate the analytics acumen amongst the team and stakeholders


THE QUALIFICATIONS

The Senior Data Analyst will:

  • Have a background in eCommerce, Digital and/or Digital Marketing
  • Commit to learning and applying Aritzia's Business and People Leadership principles to achieve the best team and business results
  • Have an understanding and passion for the industry in which we operate
  • A dedication to quality and investing in results and new business opportunities that add value
  • Successfully collaborate with business leaders and cross-functional partners, establishing yourself as a subject matter expert and trust partner
  • Understand and transform complex business problems into data & analytics requirements
  • Translate data into concise insights that clearly communicate outcomes and value to stakeholders
  • Leverage advanced analytics techniques such as regression analysis, causal impact, A/B testing and customer lifetime value to derive data driven insights, predict outcomes and recommend actions
  • Have proven skills, education, and/or applicable certifications in:
  • SQL, Visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI)
  • Google Analytics/Google Tag Manager or Adobe Analytics/Adobe Launch
  • Python, R or related analysis tools


THE COMPENSATION

The typical hiring range for this position is $100,000 - $150,000 CAD per year. The final agreed upon salary may vary based on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills and experience. Additionally, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity


We are always looking for top talent - if your qualifications differ from those listed above, the scope of work and final agreed upon [salary/wage] may be adjusted to reflect your individual qualifications.


Aritzia’s Everyday Luxury compensation package goes beyond the base salary with endless growth and recognition opportunities through our pay-for-performance philosophy. Along with comprehensive benefits, aspirational workspaces and elevated employee perks and experiences - we provide it all.


THE PERKS

Some of the industry-leading benefits you will receive working at Aritzia:

  • Product Discount – Maybe you’ve heard of our famous product discount? Or our exclusive private shopping events? You have now.
  • A-OK Commissary & Café – Everyday Luxury dining, exclusive to Aritzia. Our in-house bistro and café is a private oasis where employees can enjoy curated, subsidized Everyday Luxury dining.
  • The SET – Our in-office fitness studio and gym with state-of-the-art equipment, custom-created classes, and optional personal training. Open 7 days a week, works out well.
  • Aritzia Virtual Wellness – Because your health, happiness, and safety matter – 24/7 resources to support you in your wellbeing goals, be it physical, mental, social, or financial.
  • Aspirational Workplace – Our offices are specially designed to be spaces of creativity, productivity, and inspiration. They’re also dog friendly. Woof.
  • Amenities – Additional amenities include a private parent’s room, shower facilities with elevated complementary conveniences, bike rooms, and more.
  • The Extras – We also offer a multitude of other perks like dry-cleaning, hotel and restaurant discounts, self-care promos and on-site medical care.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Affiliation: MoveUP

Employment Status: Full-Time Regular

Salary: $3,576.00 bi-weekly

Workplace Flexibility: No

Posting End Date: Open until filled

As the province’s largest energy provider with more than 100 years of knowledge and experience, we proudly deliver renewable energy, natural gas, electricity and propane to 1.3 million customers.

We're actively seeking new talent to join our mission of transforming B.C.'s energy landscape. As one of BC's Top Employers with a diverse team of over 2,700 employees, we are committed to a safe and inclusive culture where each of us can connect, belong, and grow. Join us, and together, let's shape a brighter future for B.C.

Responsibilities


Collaborates with Business Units, Departments, Clients to analyze business information requirements and translate these requirements into conceptual/logical data models and interfaces; develops the data infrastructure that best supports the business. Collaborates with applications systems, interface development, implementation & sustainment teams to translate conceptual/logical data models into physical database designs.
Specifies and supports the implementation of IT infrastructure requirements for databases with operational teams; reviews and resolves IT/technical infrastructure for points of failure. Develops and supports implementation of fall-over, backup and recovery strategies for databases. Participates in the production turnover process, and coordinates production turnover requirements for databases with Applications and Operations teams.
Develops and maintains data architecture and data models at the conceptual and logical levels; coordinates the implementation of data model changes to existing physical databases. Participates, and makes recommendations, in the evaluation and selection of tools and technologies to support data architecture, data modeling and database design.
Establish and maintains relationships with Outsourcing Partners and/or Vendors to support implementation of database designs into physical databases; ensures ongoing administration and maintenance of databases.
Develops and maintains the Business Intelligence (BI) reporting to address business decision support requirements; utilizes business data available in the Data Warehouse to identify the way end users want to analyze the data.
Identifies data ownership issues across the enterprise, including data integration issues for consolidation and transformation. Participates in the development of data architecture, policies, standards and guidelines related to the enterprise wide integration of data.
Performs duties of a minor nature related to the above duties, which do not affect the rating of the job.


Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Business Administration from a recognized program.
Five (5) years recent, related experience.
Knowledge of business systems analysis, conceptual and logical data models and database design. Knowledge of data architecture, conceptual design, and implementation. Knowledge of information systems technologies, systems development tools and methodologies, and end user tools and approaches.
Ability to manage medium to large database design and implementation projects, with multiple sub-projects, system interfaces and specialized functions, spanning several business units and client departments.
Ability to work independently and as a member of a team.
Ability to analyze business requirements and make sound judgements.
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing
Ability to facilitate groups, make presentations and effectively resolve conflict
Ability to work with demanding work schedules


Our engaging workplace offers a wide range of challenging opportunities, while being safe, inclusive and diverse. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, while supporting life-long career development. We also encourage volunteerism and nourish the need to give back to your community.

To learn more about the recruitment process with FortisBC, please visit the You’re Applying. What now? page for additional information.

FortisBC acknowledges and respects Indigenous Peoples in Canada, on whose Traditional Territories we all live and work. FortisBC is committed to Reconciliation with Indigenous Peoples and is guided by our Statement of Indigenous Principles .

Title: Data Entry Analyst (Entry-Level) (Rebel Apparel)
Description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Data Entry Analyst to join our team. This entry-level role is perfect for individuals eager to start a career in data analysis and management.

Key Responsibilities


Accurately input and update data into various systems and databases.
Review and clean data to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Assist in generating and analyzing reports based on data trends.
Collaborate with team members to resolve data discrepancies and issues.
Maintain organized records and documentation for easy retrieval.
Support data-related projects and tasks as assigned by supervisors.


Qualifications


High school diploma or equivalent; associate’s degree or coursework in data management is a plus.
Basic proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word).
Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.
Good organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks.
Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.
Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace if remote.


Preferred Skills (Not Required)


Familiarity with data analysis tools or software.
Previous experience in a data entry or analytical role.


What We Offer


Competitive salary.
Flexible work hours and remote work options.
Comprehensive training and career development opportunities.
Supportive work environment with opportunities for growth.


How to Apply: Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter detailing your interest and relevant skills to [email address or application link].

Title: Entry-Level Data Analyst (Rebel Apparel)
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking a motivated Entry-Level Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. This role is an excellent opportunity for recent graduates or individuals with foundational experience in data analysis to grow their career in a supportive environment.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and analyze data to generate actionable insights.
Prepare reports and presentations of findings, clearly communicating complex data to stakeholders.
Assist in identifying trends and patterns in datasets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver solutions.
Contribute to the development and improvement of data collection and analysis processes.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis.


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, or R (experience with statistical software is a plus).
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently when needed.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Canadian citizenship, permanent residency, or a valid work permit.


Benefits


Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for career growth and professional development.
Collaborative and inclusive work culture.


How to Apply: Please submit your resume

Title: Data Analyst (Rebel Apparel)
Description:
We are looking to hire a data analyst to join our data team. You will take responsibility for managing our master data set, developing reports, and troubleshooting data issues. To do well in this role you need a very fine eye for detail, experience as a data analyst, and a deep understanding of the popular data analysis tools and databases.

Data Analyst Responsibilities


Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.
Managing users and user roles.
Provide quality assurance of imported data, working with quality assurance analysts if necessary.
Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets.
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.
Helping develop reports and analyses.
Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.
Generating reports from single or multiple systems.
Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.
Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.
Training end-users on new reports and dashboards.
Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.


Data Analyst Requirements:


Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or college in computer science.
Work experience as a data analyst or in a related field.
Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks.
Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.
Ability to translate business requirements into nontechnical, lay terms.
High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large-scale databases.
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
Understanding of addressing and metadata standards.
High-level written and verbal communication skills.

Title: Lead Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
Who We Are

tsworks Canada, Inc is a technology products and services company based out of Ontario, Canada. We are a subsidiary of The Software Works, Inc, USA. Our mission is to adopt, challenge and set the best practices in Information Technology. At tsworks Canada Inc, we value our employees, take pride in providing best value in customer engagements, and make every effort to be transparent, responsible, and prompt in our commitments.




About This Role

tsworks Canada, Inc is seeking driven and motivated Lead Data Analyst to join its Digital Services Team. You will get hands-on experience with projects employing industry-leading technologies. This position will be a contract to perm, reporting to the Senior Manager and work type will be hybrid with a 2-3 days per week, on-site, in our clients’ locations in Vancouver, BC. This would initially be focused on the operational readiness and maintenance of existing applications and would transition into a build and maintenance role in the long run.




Position: Lead Data Analyst 
Experience: - 10+ Years of hands-on experience in Information Technology 

- 5+ years of experience designing and executing data solutions in Business Intelligence. 

Location: Vancouver, BC 




What skills do we expect from you on Power BI 

Extensive hands-on Power BI visual dashboards, applications, KPI (key performance indicators) scorecards, DAX functions. 
Experience with performance tuning Power BI datasets and reports with Direct and Import mode, Aggregations, Filter Contexts, Partitioning, Row Level Security etc. 
Experience managing and optimizing Power BI Capacities, using Advanced Restful APIs 




What skills do we expect from you in Data and Analytics 

Experience on cloud data ecosystems AWS (Amazon Web Services) Redshift, Azure Synapse, Snowflake or Data Bricks 
Experience writing and tuning performance on complex SQL queries. 
Experience with Star/Snowflake data models 
Experience providing solutions on Retail or Finance data domains. 
Ability to articulate, create, and maintain technical and non-technical documentation. 




In This Role, You Will  

Design and build data applications on public cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) and/or hybrid cloud using a well architected framework. 
Leveraging expertise in data analysis, visualization, and business intelligence to provide valuable insights and support data-driven decision-making within the organization. 
Lead a team of data analysts to execute the data strategy and maintain the ecosystem. 
Regular evaluation of changes in the data industry and adopt the best practices in terms of technology, governance, security, and compliance. 
Optimize cloud data infrastructure costs. 
Respond to technical issues in a professional and timely manner. 
Develop Power BI visual dashboards, KPI scorecards, and reports utilizing Microsoft technology stack. 
Leverage modern Power BI to extract and manipulate data from a variety of diverse sources. 
Write complex DAX functions in Power BI and Power Pivot. 
Present alternative ways for internal customers to visualize and consume data. 
Understand business questions/pain points and alleviate with supporting data. 
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and adherence to data governance policies. Conduct data quality checks and implement measures to maintain data integrity. 
Research advanced analytic/visualization capabilities to improve customer understanding of data insights. 
Collaborate cross-functionally at various levels and diplomatically influence stakeholders. 
Demonstrate excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. 
Demonstrate the ability to multi-task, deal effectively with ambiguity, change in business requirements, and self-prioritize under pressure. 
Debug data issues and deliver quality results under tight timelines. 

 

Preferences 

Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, information technology, or relevant field. 
Experience in Azure Data Factory or other ETL (Extraction, Transformation, Loading) tools solutioning and development 
Experience working in an agile setting. 
Being self-driven, naturally curious, and able to adapt to a fast-paced work environment. 
Public cloud certifications. 
Excellent Communication Skills

Title: Remote Data Analyst (Rebel Apparel)
Description:
Job Title: Remote Data Analyst

Location: Remote

Job Type: Full-Time/Part-Time/Contract

Overview: We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Remote Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, statistical methods, and data visualization. This role is responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques, and providing ongoing reports. You will work closely with various teams to support data-driven decision-making processes.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and preprocess data from multiple sources.
Perform exploratory data analysis and develop predictive models.
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize trends and key metrics.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex datasets.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy across all reports and analyses.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, or R.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present findings clearly and effectively.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks efficiently.


Benefits


Competitive salary and performance bonuses.
Flexible working hours and remote work.
Professional development opportunities.
Health, dental, and vision insurance options.
Collaborative and inclusive work environment.


Application Process: To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and skills. We look forward to reviewing your application!

Title: Remote Data Analyst (Rebel Apparel)
Description:
Job Description: Rebel Apparel Inc. is seeking a skilled Remote Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques, and providing ongoing reports. Your primary focus will be to develop, implement, and maintain databases, data collection systems, and analytics tools that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. The ideal candidate will have a strong ability to analyze trends and provide actionable insights to enhance decision-making processes across the organization.

Responsibilities


Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.


Requirements


Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, etc.), databases (SQL, etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks), and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, or Statistics.


Preferred Qualifications


Proven experience working in an e-commerce or retail environment.
Advanced degree in a related field.
Certification in Data Analytics.


Join Rebel Apparel Inc. and help us redefine the future of fashion through data-driven insights and innovation. Apply now to become a part of our passionate team!

HTML:
Job Description: Rebel Apparel Inc. is seeking a skilled Remote Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques, and providing ongoing reports. Your primary focus will be to develop, implement, and maintain databases, data collection systems, and analytics tools that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. The ideal candidate will have a strong ability to analyze trends and provide actionable insights to enhance decision-making processes across the organization.

Responsibilities

  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
  • Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
  • Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.

Requirements

  • Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, etc.), databases (SQL, etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks), and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
  • Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, or Statistics.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Proven experience working in an e-commerce or retail environment.
  • Advanced degree in a related field.
  • Certification in Data Analytics.

Join Rebel Apparel Inc. and help us redefine the future of fashion through data-driven insights and innovation. Apply now to become a part of our passionate team!

Value

Title: Data Analyst, Investment Data Management
Description:
Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group (CCLFG)

Vancouver, BC

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Vancouver based Investment Data Management team.

The Investment Data Management Team (IDM) resides within the middle office and is responsible for managing data centric processes and data quality that supports the investment management business. Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group Ltd. (CCLFG) manages a wide range of global assets and heavily relies on the output of the DMT for a variety of functions from the front office to the back. This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a dynamic strategic team whose scope and importance continues to grow enterprise wide.

We place a high value on maintaining an entrepreneurial spirit and creating a culture where each of us have opportunities to succeed. We are a solution orientated and collaborative team seeking likeminded individuals who thrive in a challenging and dynamic environment. This is a Vancouver based role, which offers a flexibility between working from home and the office.

What You’ll Be Doing

This role operates in a unique position, working closely with front office traders, investment managers and a wide range of investment-operation business unit in the middle and back-office. You will use your financial and technical knowledge, to provide critical investment data inputs to the whole investment operations process. Our analysts are empowered to thrive as process owners, with both the creativity and responsibility that comes with delegation. Our

team continuously strives to identify improvements to operations to scale and grow with the business; you will work highly collaboratively with your team members and dedicated development teams to execute.

Key Responsibilities Include


Security Master: Maintain and validate accuracy of equity/fixed income/derivative data across multiple systems/databases to enable Investment Manager modeling, trading, and risk monitoring.
Process Manager: Manage and enable a myriad of scheduled processes for vendor systems, internal and market data transfers, valuation, and benchmarking data inputs to the investment process.
Data Quality Expert: Deliver timely data signoffs to investment teams; develop and analyze data-quality exceptions and ensure timely resolution.
Stakeholder Servicer: Provide analysis on operational needs, ad-hoc data/data-history requests for multiple business partners to support pre- and post-trade portfolio management functions.
Process Improver: Identify process/workflow improvements to increase operational efficiency, mitigate risk, improve data-quality, and increase service levels provided to stakeholders.
Supporter of other operational or engineering staff, senior or managers on a variety of ad-hoc tasks and projects.


About You


Education – You have a degree in Finance, Commerce, Business Administration, Business Operations, or a related field. Relevant designation, such as the MBA, CFA, or FRM is an asset.
Industry Knowledge – Some experience in the investment management industry with exposure to equity, fixed income, and/or derivatives would be ideal. 1-2 years would be an asset.
Problem Solver / Technical – You possess an analytical mindset and able to break down complex processes into components to logically deduce the root cause of issues in data and technology.
Collaborative – You have a collaborative spirit that helps you to work well with others and you communicate effectively to team/cross-team members, and upward to key stakeholders.
Self-Motivated – You have a passion for advancing the quality, scale, and efficiency of data processes and can take ownership of multiple processes with keen attention to detail.
Continuous Process Improvement Mindset – You constantly take a critical eye to processes with the goal of finding improvement opportunities and bring an ability to manage multiple projects.


The salary range for this position is 60-90k. The salary range provided reflects the base salary range for this position as required by legislation. In addition, there is an annual performance bonus which contributes to the total compensation of this position. Further questions may be directed to the HR team during the interview process.

About Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group

At Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group, we understand the value of opportunity – for our clients and our team. Independent and employee-owned, we partner with investment professionals to grow successful asset management businesses, giving them the space to innovate and truly make an impact.

With more than 40 years of history and offices across Canada and in the US, the UK and India, CC&L Financial Group and our multi-boutique family of affiliate firms collectively manage over $133 billion in assets, providing a diverse range of traditional and alternative investment products and solutions to institutional, high-net-worth and retail clients.

For a closer look at how you can build your career with us, we invite you to explore www.cclgroup.com .

CC&L is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation or expression, disability, or age.

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter as one PDF.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, but only those candidates shortlisted for interviews will be contacted. No telephone calls or recruitment agencies will be accepted.

Apply for this Position

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Your Job

DarkVision, a Koch Engineered Solutions company, is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join the Data Development Team in North Vancouver, BC. In this role, you will work collaboratively with teammates and other departments in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment to develop and advance the data analysis deliverables supporting the multi-million-dollar operations of our customers.

You will support the Data Analysis Delivery team by writing and maintaining scripts to automate their analysis and deliverable workflows, and recommend improvements. You will work with the Product team to prototype new deliverables, and work with the Engineering Team to diagnose issues that affect Data Analysis Deliverables, and suggest improvements.

This position requires 100% on-site work in our North Vancouver office.

Our Team

DarkVision's acoustic imaging technology captures terabytes of high-fidelity data with each run. Our Data Analysis Development team plays a critical role in the commercial process by supporting the Data Analysis Delivery team in building and maintaining tools to streamline the analysis workflow, advancing and improving new deliverables, and improving processes for quality assurance.

There will always be new software tools and scripts to write and improve, new technologies to exploit and generate deliverables on, and new ways to make processes better, faster, and more sustainable and scalable. This entails a detail-oriented mindset, a default-to-action work ethic, and a multi-disciplinary perspective.

What You Will Do


Develop and maintain scripts to automate analysis workflows.
Develop and maintain analysis dashboards for higher level tracking of project status and Key Performance Indicators.
Develop and maintain analysis procedures that streamline a sustainable and scalable workflow.
Work with other analysts, Sales, Product, and Engineering teams to document and investigate issues, and prevent their reoccurrence.
Gather and analyze test data that will be used to prove out feasibility of new technology and deliverable products.
Develop new and innovative ways of representing and visualizing current data to generate new customer deliverables.
Work with the Product team in the data gathering, analysis, and writing of technical conferences papers.
Help analysts debug issues in their analysis workflow, and reproduce, document, and raise issues for other functional teams.
Interface with our Research, Machine Learning, Software, and Product teams to ensure the Data Team's needs are met, and vice versa.


Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)


Ability to work 100% on-site in the North Vancouver office.
Post-secondary degree in STEM.
Professional experience in Python and MATLAB.
Data visualization experience.
Git experience.


What Will Put You Ahead


Excellent communication skills.
Detail oriented; meticulous in documentation.
Default-to-action personality.
Independent - can operate with little guidance, yet provide results at regular intervals for feedback.
Collaborative; works to meet the needs and goals of the team.
Image processing experience.
3D data experience.
3D rendering experience.
Proficiency in PowerBI.
Ultrasonic imaging experience.
Software and algorithm development experience.
Atlassian product experience.


General Salary Range

For this role, we anticipate paying $70,000 - 90,000 per year. This role is eligible for variable pay, issued as a monetary bonus or in another form.

At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.

Who We Are

DarkVision Technologies Inc. is a Canada-based tech company disrupting the industrial imaging market since 2013. We have created the world's most advanced acoustic-based imaging platform. We are packaging it into multiple new product lines, revolutionizing how our clients quantify and visualize the integrity of their critical assets.

Backed by Koch Industries, one of the world's largest privately held companies, DarkVision's team of Mechanical, Skunkworks, Electrical, Software, and Machine Learning Engineers is rapidly expanding to meet the demand for the company's current and upcoming products.

We allow employees to work on cutting-edge technologies that blend science with real-world applications. We invite you to join our team for the exciting journey ahead as we become the global leader in industrial imaging.

At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company.

Additionally, everyone has individual work and personal needs. We seek to enable the best work environment that helps you and the business work together to produce superior results.

How To Apply

If you have the above qualifications, we would like to hear from you. We thank all applicants in advance, but please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

We are an equal opportunity employer. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the kochcareers.com webpage.

Successful candidates will be required to complete a criminal background check.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Why join us

Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Finance at Brex

The Finance team leads financial planning and analysis as well as corporate development, which includes board communications, investor relations, fundraising, and M&A. We strive to be agents of change rather than a reporting function. We’re integrated and partner closely with teams across Brex to evaluate key questions, solve problems, and drive results. Through our corporate development efforts, we are also deeply involved in long-term planning and major strategic decisions for the company.

What You’ll Do

As a Salesforce Business Systems Analyst, you’ll partner closely with internal teams, including Marketing, Sales, Revenue Operations, Customer Success, Support, and Finance, to bridge business needs with technical solutions. You will champion a data-driven culture, leveraging insights to ensure systems empower informed decision-making. Your focus will be on introducing new capabilities, change management, optimizing system efficiency, increasing adoption, and aligning technology with the company’s strategic goals.

Where you’ll work

This role will be based in our Vancouver office. You must be willing to work in office at least 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday, starting the week of January 6th, 2025. Employees will be able to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, for a minimum of one week at a time.

Responsibilities


Collaborate proactively with business stakeholders and internal system teams to deliver scalable and effective solutions - from concept to delivery..
Design, document, and implement solutions in Salesforce Sales Cloud and related tools within the Go-to-Market (GTM) tech stack.
Analyze existing business processes and systems, identifying opportunities for improvement.
Partner with business stakeholders to simplify key metric reporting and ensure the accuracy of data across systems.
Utilize data to generate insights that guide future business decisions and promote a data-driven culture throughout the organization.
Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for solutions, ensuring they are well-documented for change management, enablement/training and support.


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
3-5 years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst or in a similar role, with a focus on Salesforce (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud).
Proven experience working with cross-functional teams, particularly in Marketing, Sales, Revenue Operations, and Customer Success.
Strong analytical skills to evaluate and improve complex business processes and systems.
Expertise in data analysis, with the ability to handle large datasets, generate reports, and deliver actionable insights.
In-depth knowledge of Salesforce architecture, data models, and integrations. Proficient in Salesforce administration tasks such as user management, security settings, and data management.
Familiarity with third-party Salesforce applications/packages (LeanData, Gong, Outreach, ZoomInfo, Marketo) is a plus.
Must be willing to work in office 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday


Compensation

The expected salary range for this role is $116,000 - $145,000 CAD. However, the starting base pay will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.

Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.

Ultrasonic imaging experience.
Software and algorithm development experience.
Atlassian product experience.




General Salary Range

For this role, we anticipate paying $70,000 - 90,000 per year. This role is eligible for variable pay, issued as a monetary bonus or in another form.




At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.




Who We Are

DarkVision Technologies Inc. is a Canada-based tech company disrupting the industrial imaging market since 2013. We have created the world’s most advanced acoustic-based imaging platform. We are packaging it into multiple new product lines, revolutionizing how our clients quantify and visualize the integrity of their critical assets.




Backed by Koch Industries, one of the world’s largest privately held companies, DarkVision’s team of Mechanical, Skunkworks, Electrical, Software, and Machine Learning Engineers is rapidly expanding to meet the demand for the company’s current and upcoming products.




We allow employees to work on cutting-edge technologies that blend science with real-world applications. We invite you to join our team for the exciting journey ahead as we become the global leader in industrial imaging.




At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company.




Additionally, everyone has individual work and personal needs. We seek to enable the best work environment that helps you and the business work together to produce superior results.




How To Apply

If you have the above qualifications, we would like to hear from you. We thank all applicants in advance, but please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.




We are an equal opportunity employer. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the kochcareers.com webpage.




Successful candidates will be required to complete a criminal background check.

Show more
HTML:
Your Job

DarkVision, a Koch Engineered Solutions company, is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join the Data Development Team in North Vancouver, BC. In this role, you will work collaboratively with teammates and other departments in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment to develop and advance the data analysis deliverables supporting the multi-million-dollar operations of our customers.


You will support the Data Analysis Delivery team by writing and maintaining scripts to automate their analysis and deliverable workflows, and recommend improvements. You will work with the Product team to prototype new deliverables, and work with the Engineering Team to diagnose issues that affect Data Analysis Deliverables, and suggest improvements.


This position requires 100% on-site work in our North Vancouver office.


Our Team

DarkVision’s acoustic imaging technology captures terabytes of high-fidelity data with each run. Our Data Analysis Development team plays a critical role in the commercial process by supporting the Data Analysis Delivery team in building and maintaining tools to streamline the analysis workflow, advancing and improving new deliverables, and improving processes for quality assurance.


There will always be new software tools and scripts to write and improve, new technologies to exploit and generate deliverables on, and new ways to make processes better, faster, and more sustainable and scalable. This entails a detail-oriented mindset, a default-to-action work ethic, and a multi-disciplinary perspective.


What You Will Do

  • Develop and maintain scripts to automate analysis workflows.
  • Develop and maintain analysis dashboards for higher level tracking of project status and Key Performance Indicators.
  • Develop and maintain analysis procedures that streamline a sustainable and scalable workflow.
  • Work with other analysts, Sales, Product, and Engineering teams to document and investigate issues, and prevent their reoccurrence.
  • Gather and analyze test data that will be used to prove out feasibility of new technology and deliverable products.
  • Develop new and innovative ways of representing and visualizing current data to generate new customer deliverables.
  • Work with the Product team in the data gathering, analysis, and writing of technical conferences papers.
  • Help analysts debug issues in their analysis workflow, and reproduce, document, and raise issues for other functional teams.
  • Interface with our Research, Machine Learning, Software, and Product teams to ensure the Data Team’s needs are met, and vice versa.


Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)

  • Ability to work 100% on-site in the North Vancouver office.
  • Post-secondary degree in STEM.
  • Professional experience in Python and MATLAB.
  • Data visualization experience.
  • Git experience.


What Will Put You Ahead

  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Detail oriented; meticulous in documentation.
  • Default-to-action personality.
  • Independent - can operate with little guidance, yet provide results at regular intervals for feedback.
  • Collaborative; works to meet the needs and goals of the team.
  • Image processing experience.
  • 3D data experience.
  • 3D rendering experience.
  • Proficiency in PowerBI.
  • Ultrasonic imaging experience.
  • Software and algorithm development experience.
  • Atlassian product experience.


General Salary Range

For this role, we anticipate paying $70,000 - 90,000 per year. This role is eligible for variable pay, issued as a monetary bonus or in another form.


At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.


Who We Are

DarkVision Technologies Inc. is a Canada-based tech company disrupting the industrial imaging market since 2013. We have created the world’s most advanced acoustic-based imaging platform. We are packaging it into multiple new product lines, revolutionizing how our clients quantify and visualize the integrity of their critical assets.


Backed by Koch Industries, one of the world’s largest privately held companies, DarkVision’s team of Mechanical, Skunkworks, Electrical, Software, and Machine Learning Engineers is rapidly expanding to meet the demand for the company’s current and upcoming products.


We allow employees to work on cutting-edge technologies that blend science with real-world applications. We invite you to join our team for the exciting journey ahead as we become the global leader in industrial imaging.


At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company.


Additionally, everyone has individual work and personal needs. We seek to enable the best work environment that helps you and the business work together to produce superior results.


How To Apply

We are an equal opportunity employer. If you require accommodation or assistance at any time during the application or selection processes, please submit a request by following the directions located in the FAQ section at the bottom of the kochcareers.com webpage.


Successful candidates will be required to complete a criminal background check.

Title: Intern, Data Developer (Vancouver)
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

24WD81980

Position Overview

We are seeking an enthusiastic Data Developer Intern who is passionate about building and optimizing data pipelines and infrastructure to support cutting-edge AI-powered applications. The Fusion Machine Learning team is a multi-disciplinary group of engineers and researchers dedicated to developing AI/ML solutions for some of the biggest challenges in 3D design, manufacturing, and mechanical engineering.

Responsibilities


Data Operations: Develop and execute strategies for the acquisition, transformation, and preparation of datasets to facilitate the training of ML models and make outputs of ML models usable
Data Infrastructure: Support the development and maintenance of databases, data schemas, and queries, ensuring data integrity and accessibility
Operational Efficiency: Contribute to improving the team’s efficiency by assisting in the implementation of MLOps and DevOps practices
Data Analytics: Analyze complex datasets and effectively communicate valuable insights to technical and non-technical stakeholder audiences, including with visual tools and dashboards
Deployment Automation: Adapt research models to automated deployment pipelines
Collaboration: Collaborate across MLOps, Data Acquisition, Machine Learning, and Product Management teams


Minimum Qualifications


Must be currently enrolled in a full-time, degree seeking program graduating by 2026
Strong understanding of data modeling, database concepts, and data warehousing principles
Proficiency in Python and SQL
Experience with efficient algorithm and data structure design
Experience with cloud data processing, training, and deployment platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure)
Experience with statistical analysis, machine learning, natural language processing, and prompt engineering (e.g., sklearn, PyTorch, NLTK, LLMs)
Self-motivated with the initiative to find and implement solutions independently


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with UI development
Experience in REST API development
Working knowledge of Docker
Experience with AWS SageMaker or other cloud machine learning platforms
Experience working with data processing frameworks (e.g., Spark, Dask, Ray)
Experience working with data integration tools, ETL/ELT frameworks, and workflow management systems
Knowledge of the design and manufacturing industry and Autodesk or competitive products (CAD, CAE, CAM, etc.)


About The Canada Intern Program

The 2025 Canada Internship program runs for 16 weeks (January 6th – April 25th). All internships are paid. As an intern, you will contribute to meaningful projects, be mentored by industry leaders, and participate in tech talks and other activities designed to support your personal and professional development. Our internships align with Autodesk’s Flexible Workplace approach, which is designed to meet the needs of our business while providing flexibility in support of office, remote and hybrid work preferences.

Learn More

About Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – our Culture Code is at the core of everything we do. Our values and ways of working help our people thrive and realize their potential, which leads to even better outcomes for our customers.

When you’re an Autodesker, you can be your whole, authentic self and do meaningful work that helps build a better future for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Salary transparency

Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience, educational level, and geographic location.

Diversity & Belonging

We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging and an equitable workplace where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Title: Systems Analyst – Inventory Intelligence
Description:
Requirements

Description & Requirements

W ho we are

lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we are in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. That includes creating an equitable , inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people.

A bout this team

This role is on Inventory Intelligence team in the lululemon technology organization. This team and products RFID and EIS are the technology and platforms at the heart of one of the key ingredients that powers our ability to deliver a best-in-class omni guest experience, which is inventory.

RFID has been a competitive advantage for us in our approach to inventory since its inception in 2015. It allows us to always know where product is with the highest degree of accuracy. This in turn allows us to not only manage inventory better, but it honour’s our guest's time, ensuring that if the product is available, it’s on the floor. Equally important, it’s an essential part of our ability to connect the physical and digital experience and drives all our key OMNI channel programs. EIS enables our customers and educator supporting platforms to have accurate store inventory beyond the four walls of our store.

Our team is fast-paced and taking on exciting new initiatives to support a fast-growing business. We strive to adopt leading-edge technology and seek to improve on the solutions continuously. We are not afraid to try new things, have fun, and encourage each other to take on new challenges. We support each other in growing professionally and personally. We fail forward and learn from our mistakes, thus creating a better path ahead. We create space for team members to share feedback and ideas that can help us continually grow as an organization.

We operate following the agile framework and leverage product teams across our various functions. We encourage our teams to form and figure out the best way to deliver critical business initiatives. We institute a culture of fun and lightheartedness to enjoy work each day. We are inclusive and know that we are stronger as a team than as an individual. We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented System Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, excellent communication skills, and the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. This role involves working closely with stakeholders to understand their needs, analyzing data, and working with our Solution architect to design efficient system changes to meet business goals.

A Day In The Life

This System Analyst position is technical, bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions and involved with high-complexity, high-impact deliveries from inception through implementation deliveries. This role is key to ensuring alignment between business strategies and technical implementations. We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced System Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for reviewing business processes and needs and working with our Solution architect in identifying technical solutions and our development team in delivering those solutions . This role involves working closely with stakeholders, technology teams, and cross functional departments to ensure the successful implementation and optimization of inventory retail systems.

Technical Solutions Design & Implementation

Review business requirements and translate business requirements into detailed technical specifications.

Support technical impact assessments as needed and manage dependencies, ensuring that architectural decisions are included in the design.

Engage with Solution Architect and engineering team to support the design, configuration, and implementation of technical solutions.

Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment within project technical constraints.

Support tech partners with how product works from requirements/technical perspective

Production Support & Troubleshooting

Help troubleshoot and be involved in the triage process.

Contribute to all areas of production support, including process creation, response, root cause analysis, and process refinement.

Apply in-depth knowledge of applications to drive resolution of cross-application troubleshooting or problem-solving across teams and systems.

Data Analysis & Reporting

Analyze data to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for improvement or surface possible data and system issues.

Create and maintain reports to support business decision-making and provide actionable recommendations and or to meet requests from the business for data needs.

Testing & Quality Assurance

Support QA in Developing and documenting testing strategies and test cases for product development ensuring that the system features or technical solutions meets technical requirement and functions correctly.

Assist in testing and participate in test phases prior to User Acceptance Testing (UAT) as needed.

Update technical specifications based on testing outcomes, prioritized defects, or post-release lessons learned.

Communication & Documentation

Support communication efforts for application/system deployment.

Create diagrams and documentation for processes, including triage and JIRA workflows.

Document technical solutions to identified problems.

Qualifications

Educational Background:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field. Equivalent industry experience may be considered. Data Science qualifications would be a plus.

Experience

5 + years of systems analysis experience, preferably in inventory management, retail, or supply chain, with a focus on RFID.

5 + years of experience following, participating , and supporting Agile or Scrum processes as a System s Analyst.

Strong experience providing technical requirements for medium to large initiatives , preferably in Retail.

Technical Skills

Familiarity with IT SDLC processes (both waterfall and agile).

Experience or understanding of or with CI/CD pipelines, automation, container management, application performance engineering, monitoring, alerting, AWS services, and architecture would be a plus

Knowledge and usage of the tech stack including NEDAP’s Id Cloud, Kafka, APIs, SQL query generation, Power BI, Python, and collaboration tools like JIRA, Confluence, SharePoint, Teams, Zoom, and Miro.

High-level familiarity with observability tools, such as DataDog , PagerDuty, Splunk, and ServiceNow.

Soft Skills

Exceptional organizational and communication skills.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Proven facilitation and problem-solving skills.

Ability to be self-directed, proactive, and work with a sense of urgency.

Comfortable navigating ambiguity to deliver results.

Demonstrated experience making trade-offs between business needs and technology constraints while keeping end-user needs at the forefront.

Additional Qualifications

Strong understanding of retail systems, including inventory management.

Experience creating technical specifications and documentation for large, complex projects.

Demonstrable analytical and problem-solving skills.

Strong interpersonal and leadership skills, including collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation.

Ability to challenge the status quo, champion change, and influence others to adopt new practices .

Must haves

A cknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their life.

Possesses an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovates to achieve great results .

Communicates with honesty and kindness and creates the space for others to do the same.

Leads with courage , knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure.

Fosters connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.

Integrates fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take themselves too seriously.

Additional Notes

Immigration support is potentially available for this role.

Compensation And Benefits Package

lululemon’s compensation offerings are grounded in a pay-for-performance philosophy that recognizes exceptional individual and team performance. The typical hiring range for this position is from $105,000 - $132,200annually; the base pay offered is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and internal equity. As part of our total rewards offering, permanent employees in this position may be eligible for our competitive annual bonus program.  

At Lululemon, Investing In Our People Is a Top Priority. We Believe That When Life Works, Work Works. We Strive To Be The Place Where Inclusive Leaders Come To Develop And Enable All To Be Well. Recognizing Our Teams For Their Performance And Dedication, Other Components Of Our Total Rewards Offerings Include Support Of Career Development, Wellbeing, And Personal Growth


Extended health and dental benefits, and mental health plans
Paid time off
Savings and retirement plan matching
Generous employee discount
Fitness & yoga classes
Parenthood top-up
Extensive catalog of development course offerings
People networks, mentorship programs, and leadership series (to name a few)


Note: The incentive programs, benefits, and perks have certain eligibility requirements. The Company reserves the right to alter these incentive programs, benefits, and perks in whole or in part at any time without advance notice.

workplace arrangement

This role is classified as [Hybrid] under our SSC Workplace Policy:

In-person collaboration is important, and much of the role can be performed remotely. Work is performed onsite at least 3 days per week.
